leads.address: 529 Boston Post Road, Rte #20, Wayland, MA 01778, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
I contacted Rolls-Royce Motor Cars Boston last week to schedule routine maintenance for my 2006 Rolls-Royce Phantom. Since the dealership is about 100 miles away, I asked about transportation options. The representative I spoke with, Amanda, offered to check with management to see if a complimentary pickup was possible and would get back to me by the end of the day. I did not receive a return call.

Over the next several days, I left multiple messages and made follow-up calls. When I reached her again, she did not remember our previous conversation at first, and after I refreshed her memory, she said the vehicle was too old for a courtesy pickup. I then asked for a quote for a paid pickup service. She told me she would speak with management and call me back that day. Again, I received no call.

I made one more attempt and left another message, but as of today, I still have not received a return call.

I am disappointed with the lack of follow-through and communication, especially given the expectations that typically accompany the Rolls-Royce name. I hope the dealership will review this experience and improve responsiveness for future customers.

Update December 8, 2025:

I received a follow-up call from the service manager after posting my review, and I appreciate that he took the time to reach out. He explained that the department had been short-staffed due to his attendance at a manufacturer conference.

On my initial call, Amanda did mention that she needed to speak with management before giving me an answer, and I appreciated that transparency. The concern was not that she needed guidance; it was that she assured me she would call back the same day, and no call ever came. After several additional attempts on my part, I still received no follow-up.

While I appreciate the courtesy of the manager’s call, the explanation did not fully resolve the underlying issue. Even if short-staffed, a quick message acknowledging the delay or letting me know a decision would have to wait until management returned would have set clear expectations. Instead, the lack of communication over several days made the process more difficult than it needed to be.

The follow-up call did confirm that the challenge was not simply workload but a breakdown in communication and follow-through. I hope this feedback helps the department strengthen those areas going forward.

At this time, I believe my original rating remains accurate based on the full experience.

leads.worst_review_text: Went here because of all the good reviews but was disappointed. First of all the price was pretty high, I paid 320 euros for ONE pair of glasses. Thank god i have insurance that paid 75% of that. Secondly considering the abysmal price tag you would think the customer service would be amazing. Well you would be wrong. The girls at the reception got my name and surname wrong on the invoice and then when i emailed them about it i never got a reply. When i was choosing the frames downstairs nobody helped me. And usually opticians are supposed to help you choose the right frame that sit on your nose correctly and don’t feel tight. None of that happened either. I chose the frames myself and they sent me on my way, nobody asked any questions at all. I feel like they were all a bit lackluster when it came to customer service (let me remind you the cost was 320 eur). So i will never come back and don’t advise you to. My husband went to Specsavers dundrum (not sure about any other location) and he got two pairs of glasses for the same price as me and their customer service was so much better. I really regret spending my insurance cover on this place. Thanks for reading.

I purchased a BMW from Cargem in November after seeing it on AutoTrader. Initially, communication via WhatsApp was quick and straightforward. When I arrived to view the car, Jahid only offered a quick test drive around the car park, and I had to insist on a proper road test. During the viewing, it also became clear that Jahid did not appear to know much about this specific car when I asked him questions, and he seemed more interested in taking personal calls while I was trying to sort the paperwork with him. The vehicle itself was faultless and accurately described.

I proceeded with a finance agreement and a £1700 RAC Platinum warranty, although the terms and conditions were not fully explained to me at the time. I decided to cancel the warranty less than a week after purchasing the car. The sales manager, James, initially said he didn’t know how to process a cancellation and claimed no customer had ever asked before. He later said he did know, and that the refund would take 7–10 days.

I have since seen online that my warranty policy has been cancelled, yet no refund has been issued by Cargem. Despite multiple messages, emails, and phone calls, I’ve been completely ignored by the sales staff and still have not received any acknowledgement or explanation.

This level of customer service is completely unacceptable. I have sought independent advice, and given that Cargem has cancelled the warranty but failed to refund the money paid, I will now be looking to take legal action to recover the cost of the warranty.

Based on my experience, I would not recommend Cargem.

I bought a truck from them in December. Everything looked great at first thought I was really getting a good deal I even looked around the truck and in the truck and under the truck. It was a 2 hour drive for me I went all the way down there the first day and they couldn't approve me for the truck there for some reason? So I came home and got a loan and went back the next day and got the truck. On my way home from buying the truck found out the cruise control didn't work, and the fender flare fell off on the way home. I was like okay whatever no big deal drove it 2 weeks and the front left wheel bearing went out and the Evap system went out and the power steering cooler had a hole in it and was leaking antifreeze and the upper right control arm went out. Cost me $1,200 dollars to fix it and London motorsports told me sorry but the truck was fine when they had it. That's what I get for buying "AS IS" I guess. I get my truck back from the shop and I took all the fender flares off because they were all falling off anyways. That's when I find out the truck has rusted out over the rear wheels and they had used cardboard and foam to "fix it" and painted over it. Needless to say be careful before you buy. Don't think just because people are friendly that you are getting a good deal.

I went to this pharmacy for something quite personal and time-sensitive. Unfortunately, the person who served me was cold and unhelpful. They didn’t say a single word during the interaction, offered no explanation or guidance, and made me feel judged and uncomfortable. In moments like these, a little empathy can make a big difference - sadly, that wasn’t the case here.

The medicine I asked for weren't available so I had to wait 2 hours to pick them up. I agreed to this because the Apotheke is in my neighborhood. When I went back to get my medicine, I also asked if they had tiger balm. The older lady didn't know and didn't speak English so I asked the young blonde woman. She said they had it but instead of telling me where it is she agressively told me to wait and then purposefully ignored me until I decided to leave. I honestly feel bad for her, hope she will get some love someday. This attitude lost you a customer.

Also, the prices were a lot higher compared to my previous purchase.

If I could, I would give this pharmacy 0 stars.

leads.worst_review_text:
Found this hidden gem simply by accident, but it was a wonderful surprise. I would recommend making a reservation just to be sure. We were a but early, but later on parties of four without a reservation couldn't be seated anymore as the larger tables were already reserved.

The food was wonderful and I was especially impressed by the amount of vegetarian options. About 60% of the menu is at least vegetarian friendly, which is not that common for a tapas restaurant. All the dishes tasted fresh and of good quality, but be careful with the tomatoes. They might attack your shirt.

They have menu's available in both English and German and the staff speaks English well.

The inside is cosy, but wheelchair users might find it a tight squeeze depending on the size of the wheelchair of course. However, if the weather is nice and you can sit outside, it will be no issue.

Good to note that you can also pay by card and cash.

Would definitely recommend.
leads.ai_response_draft:
Good spot on the tomatoes - we should probably warn people about that. Glad you found us by accident.

- Le Golden Igel

leads.worst_review_text:
I hate writing bad reviews for small businesses. However, I think criticism may better help the restaurant. Let me explain.

I moved to the area about a year ago and walked by Mason's Grille. Place was busy, smelled amazing. My wife and I enjoyed the food and we would recommend this place to all our friends and family. So let's establish that I am not a complete hater of this restaurant.

We went yesterday evening for dinner and this was my honest experience.

- There's a strange smell the the dinning area.
- Service is always great.
- Soups and bread are great.
- Caesar Salad seemed dry and lacking of cheese. The presentation almost looked like a bag of Wegmans romaine lettuce without any dressing and a few pieces of grilled chicken slices.
- Mac and Cheese Lobster - watered down cheese sauce and too garlicky + a small portion of lobster. This was not worth $33.
-Seafood Norfolk - oh boy. When I had this a year ago, it was amazing. The fish was so bland, tasteless, no seasoning. I'm guessing the seafood was frozen and thawed out in the oven.
- Bloody Mary and chocolate martini - Excellent.
- Mason's perfect pomegranate - fruit flies in our drink. Yummy.

Overall if I can recap this review. I'm not a professional critic. I'm just a guy that travels a lot in the states, eats different foods and watch a lot of nightmare kitchen. This place, in my opinion use to be great. I can tell, over the year that they are cutting corners in food quality and portion. The pricing is also tiered with some of the higher end spots downtown.

Hoping for the best for this business.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That seafood dish falling off from a year ago - you're absolutely right and I needed to hear that. The fruit flies are unacceptable, we're addressing the bar setup today.

- Mason's Grille 52

Having lived in Stuttgart, Munich, and Hamburg, OT is definitely the best Thai restaurant I have been to in Germany. Have been here several times though I'm still new in HH.

It was really, really average. Surf and Turf with chimichurri shrimp that was anything but chimichurri.  Tons of too-coarsely chopped raw garlic with flavorless nameless herbs.  If I want the same experience I would gnaw on a clove of garlic.  Steak was underseasoned with near zero personality.  Tired rice and anemic pale green asparagus.  I hate to sound mean, but this place was really lame.  Never going back.  Don't waste your money - there are far better places in the same price range.

So if you ask where to get the most exclusive, creatively arranged, rare flowers in Munich, it is definitely Blumen Bahlmann.
Their shopwindow is simply a peace of floristic art. It is changing every week. I once saw homegrown sort of Edelweiß, which is almost impossible to see in a regular life. The wild grown sorts of Edelweiß live only in the high Alpine altitudes. Those flowers are protected. So to see cultured sort of Edelweiß is like a miracle. This shop is unique and it is absolutely worth it to get the bunch of flowers there.

leads.address: I U-Bahnhof, Frankfurter Allee 52, 10247 Berlin, Germany
leads.worst_review_text:
I visited this pharmacy to buy a nasal spray for my post-deviation surgery aftercare. They informed me they had Abtei Nasenspülung 100ml, which would suit my needs. However, it had to be ordered, and I was advised to return later in the day to collect it. I did exactly that and purchased it for €12.90.

About a week later, I discovered the exact same product being sold at DM for just €6.95 — a shocking 87% price difference. What makes this worse is that there is a DM LITERALLY ACROSS THE STREET from this pharmacy. Whether this was a case of intentional markup or simply ignorance, it left me deeply disturbed.

Either they are knowingly overcharging patients in vulnerable situations, or they are completely unaware of the actual retail prices of the products they stock — both scenarios are unacceptable for a healthcare provider. Given that the same spray is sold for nearly half the price at the DM right across the street, it raises serious questions about pricing practices. At best, this is a huge oversight; at worst, it feels exploitative — especially towards people needing medical care.

This experience has severely shaken my trust in pharmacies, and I urge others to be cautious. I’ve never encountered such disregard for transparency or patient well-being before.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That price difference is inexcusable - you're absolutely right to be upset about that. We should've mentioned the DM option across the street, especially for post-surgery care.

- Frankfurter Apotheke Berlin-Friedrichshain

leads.worst_review_text: Staff are friendly and consultative but mind you, they over charge for most of the over the counter products by easily double or triple the price. leads.worst_review_text: One Monday, I was shopping for my chemotherapy medication. What's wrong with buying medicine on Monday when I leave the hospital on Sunday? Another clerk told me to go to the hospital and ask for a new prescription. However, I went to another store next door and they gave me life-saving medicine.
leads.ai_response_draft:

BEWARE of the prices! I ordered a prescribed medication here, but was worried of the price I had to pay for it. I started googling and found the same medication in the same dosage from the same manufacturer in other pharmacies for the half of the price, and it wasn’t a discount, it was its standard price! And in my case it wasn’t about 10 or 20 euros, the price difference was more than 150 euros!!! To say the least it’s unacceptable.
Update: according to the rules, you can refuse to accept the ordered drugs before you receive them (I.e. before they are handed in to you) and get your money back. Which I tried to do in my case. I had to come multiple times to the pharmacy and talk to multiple employees, who refused to pay back my money and told me that I should reach out to their manager who wasn’t there. On my third visit I got to talk to the manager who tried to refuse to give my money back as the pharmacy wouldn’t be able to return the medicine after so many days. But the days have passed because other employees refused to give money back and referred to the manager. The manager then returned the money back (literally throwing them at me).
All in all, “acting in the interest of the customer” is not something you can expect here.

Today after visiting my doctor, I went to this pharmacy to collect my medication. I had three prescription slips – one pink and two green. I handed all of them to a man with black hair at the counter. He only took the pink one, brought out one medication, and I told him my doctor had also prescribed tablets and a cream.

He dismissively said “That’s it” in a very unfriendly and unprofessional manner. I then showed him the other two green prescriptions again. He looked at them briefly, handed them back without explanation, and did not bother to help further.

Confused, I left and went to another pharmacy just down the street, where the staff were friendly and helpful. The lady there immediately provided me with the rest of my medication without any issue.

Long story short – the staff at this pharmacy need to be trained on both proper customer service and how to correctly handle prescriptions. Extremely disappointing experience. I will not be returning, and I hope the management takes this seriously.

leads.worst_review_text:
With a backflip, song, dance and a defence lawyer, you too can get your contraception! Jokes aside, I have been coming here for 3 years without issues until today. This time, someone new was at the counter.

First she insisted that my e-prescription (same provider as last dozen times) was not valid because I "opened it". I explained to her that what I have is a summary of my prescription, that I cannot open or send around my prescription but my provider has sent it to the pharmacy.

I understand the confusion considering that it is a EU-wide e-prescription, but not created in the template as local German prescriptions. But the provider is certified for telemedicine in Germany, valid and has been processed by the same pharmacy about a dozen times in the last couple years.

She did, after explanation, process it. I thought that this was the end of our interaction. But this person, who has talked to me only 3 sentences in her lifetime, gave me a scolding about how I should go to a gynocologist or I could get cancer.

I told her I do go a gyno regularly. She then told me to then get a prescription from my gyno directly instead of my provider.

Again, without knowing anything about me, my situation, my reason for needing a prescription, my insurance type... Scolded me then proceeded to tell me to change my provider.

The reason I have the provider I have is because my current gyno does not offer any telemedicine services and I am frequently out of the country. It is difficult to quickly find doctors you can trust with availability, covered by my insurance and without linguistic barriers. My telemedical provider checks all these boxes and still acts according to the decisions of my gynocologist.

Regardless, I have taken her advice, partially. I will be changing my apotheke provider to an online apotheke that directly resolves my prescriptions and ships to me so I never have to deal with being randomly scolded by a stranger just to access contraception.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That's completely unacceptable - you shouldn't have to justify your healthcare choices to anyone, especially after 3 years as a customer. Our staff overstepped badly and I'll address this directly with the team today. Please reach out to me personally so I can make this right.

- Sanimedius pharmacy Rosenthaler Platz

When I asked her a question, the German woman pharmacist looked at me with disgust and dismissed me while yelling something at me in German even though she knew I didn't speak the language.  It was the central station pharmacy of Berlin, if you want to be bitchy to english speakers like the majority of service workers in this city at least go somewhere that isnt an international attraction. Pharmacists are supposed to be caring but maybe thats just my poor expectations of those who work in Healthcare here.

Anyway,  I was so confused as to what was happening, and then the next pharmacist offered to help.  When I became visibly upset at how the woman had treated me, he basically told me to shut up if I wanted to get help. That was it, I broke down crying.  I had been in pain for three days with a bladder infection, and no one would help me, and every single person there invalidated my experience.

I will NEVER go to this pharmacy again, and I hope to never see these people again.

Not recommended. While the professionals checking my eyesight were lovely and competent, the receptionist was very unprofessional. And had zero regards for basic GDPR rules.

Everybody knows that each property has an individual eircode, so I told her I don’t want to say my personal data loud and asked for a piece pf paper and a pen to write it down.
She HAD both, a piece of paper and a pen, but she REFUSED to let me write my personal details down. She insisted that I had to tell her my details loud.

That was VERY uncomfortable and CAN be unsafe. I know people who can memorise longer sequences of letters and digits after hearing them once.

Also, they pretty much have zero frames with any character and even the designer ones they sell are too vanilla. I’d be delighted to have it all sorted in one place, but the offer was „too safe”.

Last, but not least, hence I didn’t buy frames from them, and got mine elsewhere, they „forgot” to send me the survey that was supposed to arrive within 10 or so days.
I guess your feedback is not that important if you don’t spend few hundred with them (and my aim was to get quality, good looking and long-lasting frames, which I did, just not with them).

leads.worst_review_text:
Review of Curry Motors Kingston – Toyota RAV4 (LB22EWH)

I have been experiencing recurring issues with my Toyota RAV4 (LB22EWH), including warnings such as “Headlight System Malfunction” and “Braking Power Low, Stop in a safe place, see owner’s manual.”

I initially booked my vehicle in with Curry Motors Kingston, where they kept the car for almost five days. At the end, I was told the problem was caused by “leaving a headlight or another light on overnight.” This was the same explanation I had previously been given for issues with another vehicle, and it felt like an easy way of shifting the blame onto the customer rather than addressing the actual fault.

After nearly a week in their care, I collected the car — only for the exact same problem to return just three weeks later. I booked another appointment for 11/09/25 and carefully explained that the issue had not been resolved the first time. This time, Mr. Aston was assigned to me.

As I live in Farnham (GU9), arranging drop-off and collection is already very inconvenient around my work schedule. Despite this, I received no updates until I called the following day. Mr. Aston informed me the vehicle had been “fixed” — but when I asked what had been repaired, he said they had resolved a tyre pressure warning. I was extremely frustrated, as I had made it very clear that my concern was with the braking and headlight system faults, not a tyre pressure alert.

When I again explained the real issue, I was reassured it would now be addressed properly. I also requested several times to speak with the Service Manager, but was repeatedly told he was “busy.” To this day, the Service Manager has not had the courtesy to return my call.

Considering I purchased this vehicle from Toyota for around £44,000, I expected far better after-sales service. Toyota proudly advertise a 10-year / 100,000-mile warranty, but my experience shows that the level of support provided tells a very different story.

My main reason for writing this review is to highlight to other customers that when you buy a vehicle, it’s not only the car you are purchasing — it’s also the standard of service you will receive afterwards. Sadly, in my experience, Curry Motors Kingston has fallen far short of the level of care and professionalism Toyota customers should be able to rely on.

I paid them money to fix the problem only for them to just take my money and not fix the problem just cover it up by removing it from my dash board.

leads.address: 698 S Laurel Rd, London, KY 40744, USA
leads.worst_review_text: Don’t come here expecting to get much, the finance manager was extremely rude and demeaning. Quoted us an outrageous number without even doing the calculations through their system and laughed us out the door when we suggested it should be any lower. Needless to say we went to another dealer and got an almost identical truck for half of what he tried to quote

I like to believe most people are good and honorable, but I found neither at this dealership. It was a disappointing reminder of why I hadn’t purchased from a dealership in 8 years.

The car I chose had a sticker price of $23,777. After taxes and “document fees,” the salesman presented me a written quote of $26,267—the higher end of my $28,000 budget, but still manageable. Confident in the purchase, I even went ahead and bought insurance for the car.

That’s when the circus began. We arrived at 4:00 p.m. and were kept waiting for hours. Not called back until 7:45 p.m., nearly an hour after closing, exhausted and ready to sign. And that’s exactly what they were banking on.

When the finance manager finally slid the paperwork across the desk, my pen was literally on the page when I noticed the numbers. That $26,000 “deal”? Suddenly it had ballooned to over $30,000. No explanation. No disclosure. Just “sign here.”

And why? Because they had quietly tacked on thousands in worthless warranties and add-ons I never asked for. Things no one bothered to explain—just slipped in, hoping I’d be too tired or too trusting to notice. The only comments I heard were, “oh, we have a warranty on it” and “we’ll throw in the gap on us!” Throw in? No—sneak in.

When I called out this deceit, the manager insisted he’d given me a “great deal.” In what world does a $23,000 car magically becoming a $30,000 purchase qualify as a deal? To make matters worse, when I said no one told me the price increase, he brushed it off with, “I told you what the monthly payments would be.” As if anyone would assume a $26,000 quote somehow meant a $30,000 loan.

This dealership didn’t just lose a sale—they proved exactly why people hate buying cars. If you value your money, your sanity, and your dignity, stay far, far away.
Shame on you.

The worst and most stressful car buying experiences I’ve ever had.

Update: The car was finally returned but after much stress, dealing with unfriendly customer service and I wasn't fully compensated for my financial loss. They provided me the refund link with wrong details 4 times before I finally got my refund.

During the test drive, we noticed the car was pulling to the left. We immediately raised this with the salesperson, it was noted in the paperwork, and we were assured it would be fixed before collection. we even phoned Cargiant before pickup to double check, and they confirmed the issue had been resolved.

However, when we collected the car, it still had the exact same fault. Despite promising they would only release the car to customer once it was fixed and safe to drive, they knowingly handed us a faulty vehicle. The very next morning, we emailed them again to report the problem.

From there, aftercare has been appalling. When we reported the fault, we were told to take the car to KwikFit. However, when KwikFit tried to contact Cargiant for authorisation, their calls were not answered. We even had to phone Cargiant ourselves and hand the phone to the KwikFit mechanic, only for them to later confirm that they could not identify fault. We then tried four different garages, including the ones recommended by Cargiant and none were able to diagnose the issue.

When we asked Cargiant to handle the repair directly, the earliest appointment they offered was over a month away, and when we asked how long the repair would take, they did not give us an estimate. We also requested a courtesy car to cover the period without a vehicle, but this was refused. We then asked if they would cover our expenses for repeated drop-offs and pick-ups, which they also refused. Finally, we asked if they could collect and return the car themselves to save us further inconvenience, and again they refused.

Meanwhile, we rely on this car for work and daily needs. The amount of time, stress, and inconvenience this caused has been giant, all because Cargiant released a faulty and unsafe car instead of ensuring it was properly repaired.

As a last resort, we asked to return the vehicle. They gave us a appointment date two weeks later. When we went to drop it off yesterday, staff had no idea we were there to return the car, they thought we were booked in for fault inspection. We had to show them the email confirmation proving we were there to return the car.

Yesterday, we’ve dropped the car off and now waiting for their “internal inspection”. If they do not handle this fairly and promptly, we are prepared to take legal action and report them to the relevant authorities, including Trading Standards and The Motor Ombudsman.

We will keep this review updated. After this experience, We cannot recommend Cargiant. Once the sale is done, their support is dismissive, unhelpful, and completely fails to take accountability for selling a faulty car.

They paid me the full amount upfront and even allowed me to return the car a week later to finalize the handover, which was very convenient.

Overall, highly satisfied and recommend City Motor Group for anyone looking to sell their car.

My experience purchasing my first supercar from this dealership was exceptional. From the moment I spoke with Mr. Jude, the sales specialist, I was immediately impressed by his dedication, professionalism, honesty, and unwavering commitment. I mentioned that I had been in contact with several dealerships nationwide regarding the 2026 McLaren GTS. However, his approach instantly set this dealership apart.

Mr. Jude is highly motivated, intelligent, compassionate, and incredibly knowledgeable—truly an outstanding sales agent and product specialist. Throughout the process, he displayed remarkable honesty, friendliness, and professionalism. His focus was clear: to earn my business by ensuring the entire purchase experience was smooth, transparent, and completely stress-free.

Mr. David, the financial manager, was equally exceptional. There were no surprises, no hidden fees, and no confusing fine print. The financing process was clear, fair, and accommodating. I genuinely appreciated his willingness to meet my requests and commitment to excellent customer service.

From start to finish, the entire dealership team was transparent, honest, and genuinely customer-focused. Based on my experience, I would confidently consider McLaren Boston as the number one dealership in the nation. I am extremely pleased with my purchase and would highly recommend this dealership to anyone considering buying a supercar.

leads.worst_review_text: TOURIST TRAP: My wife and I ordered the Jonah's Crab Claws, fish and chips, and hushpuppies. The crab claws were tough, had very little meat, and ultimately didn't have flavor that stood out. The fish was entirely unseasoned and over-fried. The hushpuppies are marketed as containing crab, cheese curd, and jalapeno. We concluded that the only way they could've really gotten this description was from an AI model trying to get people to order the dish. A more apt name would have been bread and butter hushpuppies. They contained none of what was advertised, but would be great for anyone looking for fried dough served on top of butter. I commend this restaurant for being able to earn such great margins on their food, and they are a testament to the fact that great location is all it takes to survive as a business. The drinks we ordered - both mixed drinks - were delicious but wildly overpriced. The service was great, so my wife and I almost felt guilty for how much we hated the food. We were very upset by what we had to spend to get what we got, but that could just be a Seattle thing...

leads.address: 2208 Queen Anne Ave N, Seattle, WA 98109, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Went here recently with a group of four and sat outside, which was lovely on a nice summer night. We were celebrating a birthday and the staff surprised us with complimentary celebratory drinks, which was a really thoughtful touch and much appreciated.

Service overall was friendly, but the pacing of the meal was definitely off. We were sitting there for a while without food while other tables who sat after us started getting theirs. Our server came by to check in and realized we hadn’t gotten anything besides drinks, so she ended up comping our sourdough. It was a nice gesture, but it definitely felt like our table got overlooked early in the night.

Food-wise, things were hit or miss. We shared 3 small plates (burrata, sourdough, and hamachi crudo), 2 pastas (gnocchi and bucatini), and 2 proteins (king salmon and duck breast). Burrata didn’t come with bread, which surprised us, and while the sourdough was very good, the burrata itself didn’t land for me. The plum sauce and radish made it overly sweet and not very balanced.

The king salmon was the biggest miss. It was a very small portion for $53 and ended up being overcooked and kind of boring. The duck breast was a little better, but still didn’t have much flavor on its own. The side veggies with both proteins were actually the highlight.

Pastas were fine, but nothing memorable. The bucatini didn’t have a center hole, so it just felt like a thicker pasta. Gnocchi was decent but not standout.

With drinks, tax, and a mandatory 22% service charge, the total came out to over $500 for four people. When pastas are $30+ and mains are $50+, it’s hard not to expect something a little more polished. We had a good time and the setting is nice, but the food just didn’t feel worth the price. Overall, this was the most expensive yet most disappointing and forgettable meal we had in Seattle.

leads.worst_review_text:
I bought a car here last Tuesday, and honestly, the experience left me frustrated. That same morning I had a dental procedure and couldn’t eat lunch, so by the time I arrived at 6 pm I was already running on empty. I found a car I really liked, but when I asked the manager for a quote and a little time to think about it, he kept pressuring me to buy it right away.

I told him more than once that I just needed a day to think about it or at least a break to eat, but instead of understanding, he pushed harder. He even told me the process would be “very quick,” but I ended up signing papers until 2 in the morning, without ever eating that day.

I would have bought the car anyway because I liked it, but the unnecessary pressure and complete lack of care for my situation made the whole experience feel rude and inconsiderate. Buying a car should be exciting, not draining.

leads.address: 911 Capitol Expressway Auto Mall, San Jose, CA 95136, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
I bought a 2026 Hyundai Ioniq 5 from Stevens Creek Hyundai.  Love the car; my experience at the dealership - not so much.  I checked the car out in person and then went back and forth with the sales guy a few times over text before we agreed on a price.  He gives me a price, and I tell him we had a deal and I was coming down to sign.  When I got there, I was told that it was a typo, and the price was $1000 more.  (In fairness, the sales guy had tried texting and calling when he realized his error).

They come down a bit when I gripe, but it wasn't the number we agreed upon in text.  He shows me the numbers on paper, but when the salesguy took out his calculator to show how the numbers worked out, the numbers were wrong and he had to get a new printout.  I once again felt like I was being played.

After filling out initial forms, I'm then waiting for an hour for the finance guy.  End of year; I get that.  But no one checks in with me and I'm just sitting there wondering if they were playing me.

I finally meet with the finance guy, and he tries to imply that I need to buy a bunch of maintenance plans, making me wonder if I made a mistake in choosing the vehicle I was purchasing.  I know it's his job to upsell, but after seeing the numbers change so often, I was feeling extra uneasy.

Finally two hours after I had gotten to the dealership to sign, the sales guy brings my car up and hands me the key.  I ask what the paper plate was doing in the car.  He said most people don't want people drilling their front plate.  I told him when I got an actual license plate, I'd need one, so I prefer it now.  He said I'd have to come back in a few days and then he'd be happy to put the front license plate holder on.  (I didn't understand the reasoning).

He then walks away without asking if I had questions (i had a few).  I ended up sitting in the parking lot for a few minutes before I felt comfortable driving to leave.  All in all, it made me have buyer's remorse buying the car, which was very unfortunate.

I reached out to the general manager the next day explaining why I thought the experience was overall unpleasant.  He said to come in the next day, and they'd put in my front license plate holder and answer questions I had.  (By that time, I had learned what I needed to online).  He had promised to meet with me in person and wanted to ensure I left feeling good about my experience, but I never saw him.

I cannot recommend buying from Stevens Creek Hyundai.

leads.address: 905 Capitol Expressway Auto Mall, San Jose, CA 95136, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
NEVER LEASE FROM THEM if you don’t like thousands in surprise bills after returning the car.

I had leased a 2022 Chevy Bolt EUV from them and had purchased the excess wear protection plan they offered at the time. I returned the car upon lease completion with normal expected wear and tear. Their excess wear protection plan covered nothing and I was slapped with a bill of over 1000 bucks.

I called GMFinancial (GM’s finance company responsible who manages their lease plans). They told me that this dealer (Capitol Chevrolet) chose to sell to me a third party (Not GM run) protection plan so GMFinancial can’t do anything about this. The dealer never returned any of my phone calls with any useful help.
I managed to get some help from GM’s CEO office who talked to the dealer on my behalf. The dealer told them that a crack in windshield (worth $700+) was not covered by the protection plan (Fine print in the policy mentioned no such exclusion). I also purchased a tire protection plan for $200 as part of my lease agreement and that didn’t cover anything either.
The worst thing of all - there were some minor scratches and dents (worth $100 or so) which, according to the dealer, should have been covered by the plan but the only option for me was to PAY now to GMFinancial and then fight with the insurance company for reimbursement.

To me, this is what GM as a company stands for - An absolutely fraudulent dealership run by people who just want to steal your money. Never recommending this dealership or this company to anybody who doesn’t want to get deceived and stolen from.

leads.address: 3640 Stevens Creek Blvd, San Jose, CA 95117, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Service department feels like a ripoff and totally inept. Initally dropped off my car for something which I thought was a warranty claim. Upon inspection, service department told me it was external damage and would be 600 for inspection. To be fair, it was external damage and not a warranty issue. After some back and forth (see text logs), I declined the repair. Suddenly it was only 590 for the entire fix due to them mis-reading the notes.
I had given them the benefit of doubt since this could be an honest mistake, however I had become cautious of their intent and wanted them to just not do the fix. I collected the car and I should have checked the car thoroughly at that point itself, but didn't since I didnt know where the fix was done.

After I got the car back, I noticed some glaring issues.
1. The front bumper was scratched near the place where they had opened it up. It looked like a machine made scratch.
2. The T30 bolts that were attaching the tub were  half screwed.
3. The plastic trim piece hiding the internals was broken.

I emailed this to the service director when I discovered, but there was no response.

I paid for the bumper scratch to be fixed out of my own pocket.

I will not be taking my car to them for any service or fixes in the future.

leads.worst_review_text:
I was sent flowers from this shop as a gift, and I’m still in disbelief at how little empathy or basic customer care they seem to have, especially for a business in an industry built on thoughtfulness and kindness. Truly, take your business somewhere else.

Unlike every reputable flower shop I’ve ever dealt with, I was never contacted to confirm that I would be home for delivery. Instead, I received a call from the delivery driver already standing at my door while I was out. I told them I would be home in two hours, but they refused to accommodate the wait. When I explained that leaving the arrangement on the sidewalk of a high-traffic street was unsafe, I was told I’d need to pick it up myself.

Both my sender and I were then contacted by the shop and told that if we wanted the flowers delivered again, we’d have to pay an additional delivery fee. Rather than showing any compassion or even basic professionalism, the shop treated the situation as an opportunity to squeeze more money out of someone already going through a difficult time. Arranging pickup was nearly impossible due to my circumstances, and I wasn’t going to be home for several days (something that could have been easily addressed had they simply called beforehand to coordinate delivery).

When we attempted to work with them on a solution, my sender was met with the dismissive response: “I have a business to run.” That comment alone says everything!

This shop seems to be in the business for all the wrong reasons. I cannot recommend them, and I sincerely advise choosing a florist that actually values its customers and the moments those flowers represent.

I’m extremely unhappy and will never order flowers from here again.

leads.worst_review_text:
I visited this flower shop on Tuesday and purchased several peonies, eucalyptus, and a few other stems that the staff arranged into a bouquet. The peonies were $20 each, and I was told they were very fresh and would last a long time.

Unfortunately, that was not the case at all. By Wednesday afternoon, petals were already falling off. By Thursday, the blooms had completely fallen apart and were all over the place. For a bouquet that cost $100, I expected significantly better quality and longevity.

Today I went to Trader Joe’s and bought three times as many flowers for $35, and they’re already holding up better. While I understand not everyone can professionally arrange bouquets, having long-lasting flowers at home is ultimately more valuable than paying $100 for a small bouquet that barely lasts 48 hours.

The staff here was very kind and pleasant, but the quality of the flowers was extremely disappointing. Based on this experience, I cannot recommend purchasing peonies or premium-priced flowers from this shop.

leads.worst_review_text: Terrible service from the bakery department. I would NOT recommend this store to my worst enemy. I came with my 79 year old mother for a cake consultation that we had previously schedule and the staff was AWFUL. Everyone was s scrambling as if they had no idea we had an appointment, and then once someone was finally able to help she explained that she was pressed for time and that it would be best if we come back another time once we know what we want for a THIRD time. The staff member that we worked with for the consultation made it clear that this location had very limited supplies and that it not be capable of doing any major customizations… then she left me hanging at the counter and told me to come back later once I know what I want. I won’t EVER shop in this location's bakery. Thanks for a HORRIBLE experience.

Does Riverside Pharmacy not answer to anyone, like unmanaged rude, self entitled little mean-kids?  I have been known to drive the extra distance for all things Publix, my entire life. My experiences have always been that of a welcoming team that are helpful, in a clean setting. It's a polite & friendly experience with Publix employees. ....until RIVERSIDE PHARMACY!! I am genuinely floored that this is their "norm". I have very serious chronic conditions (like many of us who have go to their local pharmacist numerous times a month). I have NEVER in 30 years of constantly needing medications, dealt with such an all around unprofessionalism! Here's a few examples of what I'm referring to in my 3 months of being this locations "customer":  They're unwilling to assist with the most basic scenario. Like, literally, they will not help you. The eye rolling seems contagious behind their counter. After standing in line for 20 minutes, with only 1 person ahead of me who was being "helped", I get to the counter and here we go with the attitude because I simply was confused when they said my RX wasn't there but didn't offer any explanation. So ultimately, they sent me to another Publix that was a 45 minute one-way drive just to get there and be politely informed that Riverside sent me to the wrong location that my very important meds were supposedly waiting to be picked up at. And guess what? Then it was too late to make it to the correct Publix. Or how about how their own other locations can't even reach them because no one is answering the calls? Exaggerated sighs have been mastered. Looking people directly in the eyes with disgust that you would dare dream of asking a question is met with pushback. The actual licensed pharmacists don't care anymore than the rest. They absolutely will forget to give you all of your medications so make sure to check the bag like ya do in fast food before driving away. They'll also tell you a medication is ready, you get there and it's not, you're met with attitude, told it won't be ready for hours, only to get home when you're not feeling well, and a text says it's actually ready just as you had thought but were scolded about in person. The ever lovely consistently flippant responses. Unjustifiably arrogant staff! Talk about entitlement! Hail Almighty Riverside!! Please trust me when I say, if unless you are intentionally seeking absolutely inexcusable assistance, then don't make the the same mistake I did by transferring to this location out of convenience if you moved to Riverside as I did. And if you have serious chronic conditions, this is truly THE LAST THING YOU NEED. I truly have asked myself how many people have probably unnecessarily ended up in Emergency Room over this place. You probably thought you were going to attain the normal Publix experience but you're actually not. What I would give for any other location to train EVERYONE in this pharmacy! For that matter, a young child could teach them manners and professional etiquette far better than they are currently practicing. I have driven 35 minutes out of my way to the San Marco Publix Pharmacy who are the normal, fantastic staff that Publix is known for. However, I run a company, I don't have the luxury of lunch breaks, I work long hours, and I am in a battle with my body every single day of my life while fighting health issues that would kick the average person on their ass. So truly, forgive me if I don't have the luxury to keep doing that. But more importantly, should I even have to?

This is a copy of the email that I sent to CVS corporate about this CVS location on Dunn ave.

I understand that being a pharmacist is difficult you have people coming up demanding their meds left and right. Most of the time with no understanding of exactly what it is that you do and why it takes as long as it does.

However if a trained and licensed physician calls in a pain medicine prescription your first thought should not be this doesn't need to be filled until tomorrow.

24 hours to fill pain meds. Are you serious.

Now I don't know who told you or your pharmacists that it was up to them to decide when customers needed their medication, especially pain medication, But it's time that you retrained your staff in the way that they think.

I called at 6:00pm because my mother's medication wasn't ready and I wanted to know when it would be I was told that they weren't planning to fill it for another 24 hours.

I then informed the pharmacist that the pain medicine that my mother was prescribed did not need to be filled when they thought it should be but it needed to be filled as soon as possible.

When I called back 2 hours later I was told it's not going to be ready until 10:00 and that was the best they could do because everybody else was also waiting on their meds.

Was everybody else in pain? Waiting for medication by their doctor for acute immediate pain?

Probably.

And in dealing with your pharmacists they will probably still be in pain until your pharmacy and your pharmacist determine that they shouldn't be.

You need to do better. Your pharmacists need to do better.

I have posted this on Google maps and will not be taking it down and if I do not receive an adequate response in the time that you have stated which is 48 hours I will be filing a complaint with the Florida Board of Pharmacy

leads.worst_review_text: If I could give this pharmacy negative stars, I absolutely would!  The turn over of pharmacists and techs is ridiculous.  The arrogance and rudeness of the staff is at an all time high.  Maybe customer service 101 should be implemented in the hiring process of pharmacist and techs!  It really would go a very long way!  I miss Kevin and Taylor!!!

Started out great but after the second month it was awful. They never called when prescriptions were ready or if it was delayed for some reason. The last straw was when I went in the store and ordered my meds, was told it would be available on Monday but I was not able to get there until Friday. I was again told it would be in on Monday. When I explained that I was told that a week ago the lady said I hadn’t spoken to her. She repeated that statement several times. If I spoke with an employee didn’t I speak with the pharmacy? She was rude and unprofessional. If you depend on your medication to survive, do NOT go here. Run from these people

leads.worst_review_text: Be consistent. Just stopped by to pick up my maintenance meds and told the pharmacist that I needed to grab some insulin syringes as well and even provided the bag to show them what kind. She asked if I get my insulin filled there and I answered no it’s not for insulin It’s for a compounded medication and she said she would have to ask the pharmacist if she could sell them. A moment later came back and said no she would need to see an insulin prescription. Same associate that sold them to me probably about two or three months ago. An entire box of 100.  Extremely frustrating. Have literally never had this problem before anywhere. Kind of think I was looked at like I was a possible junkie, which if that WAS the case your idea of harm reduction is backwards. Alas no, I had just waited in traffic 45 min after work trying to get my meds.  I wonder if it would be different or any questions asked if I was an 80-year-old man versus somebody who’s just under 30. Literally any other pharmacy will take my money. What a hassle. Switching pharmacies, used to drive past Walgreens and CVS otw there because “shopping is a pleasure” but not anymore when it comes to healthcare. Missed my PRESCRIBED dose by a day and ordered a box on Amazon prime with no problem.

leads.worst_review_text: I've been with this pharmacy for years but they have been going downhill for a while now. I had enough and transferred to another Publix pharmacy that is better. Your meds are never ready on time. It used to be just every now and then but it's pretty much all the time now. How does a pharmacy operate like this? Especially when you just get out of the hospital for major heart problems and the hospital sends the scripts over in the morning but they still don't have them ready 10 minutes before they close. Then when you call to find out what's going on they just tell you they can have them ready in the morning. That's unacceptable. These are life or death drugs. Do better University Publix pharmacy before you kill somebody with your negligence. Hopefully you haven't already.

leads.worst_review_text:
Do not use this pharmacy. We have had issues since coming here. First they didn’t know how to bill Tricare for our son and lied and used a coupon instead (ex tech I know how to read the receipts). Secondly there is always a long wait. You can be the only person standing there in line and have a full pharmacy of employees and there’s always at least 10 minutes before someone greets you or acknowledges you. We would of never not greeted a customer and let them know we’d right with them. Also I love how they let the “prepaid” customers skip the line only to let them pay for their groceries?? Lol isn’t the point of prepaid being have to just grab your script and go? Also the tech couldn’t figure out if the lady had actually already paid haha so it took about 15 minutes for her to finish her “quick” transaction. Please train your staff.

As a ex pharmacy tech I have empathy but it’s been enough at this point. Publix texts me TWICE (second text was today) I have refills available okay so I request to have it filled a week ago. The bottle says 2 refills. I get there and  for the whole week since last Friday they never let me know what was going on now Friday afternoon when my medicine is nearly gone I’m being told my dr is no longer at my office and that I have no refills?? I tried to explain I definitely still had refills and show the texts they sent (which some reason the tech had a hard time reading the one sentence text and just stared at my phone for a straight minute). But you could just tell they were done helping me and had no interest in correcting their mistake or even knew what they were doing. It was like talking to a wall. I have contacted my doctor to figure what is going on and to take steps to switch pharmacies. Publix does not value my time so I will not be giving them my business. I have dealt with military and VA pharmacies for years that are notoriously bad and I’ll be switching back to the base pharmacy that’s how bad it is here.

Horrible pharmacy experience. Worst ever. I’m updating my review because today I have experienced a life altering experience with this pharmacy.  My Dr called in an increase in my blood pressure meds. I contacted the pharmacy and they told me that my insurance company rejected it until 6/1. I contacted the insurance company and they contacted the pharmacy. I contacted the pharmacy and they said that my prescription was approved and that it would be ready for pick up at 3pm on Thursday. I get a call from the pharmacy at 7:54 pm Wednesday stating that their system rejected the approval and that I needed to contact the insurance company again or wait. Until 6/1 to receive my prescription. This also happened with another medication which when picked up and the vacuumed seal package was broken by someone in the pharmacy and I asked for a replacement prescription. I contacted Publix corporate office and they blamed it on the insurance company.  Publix is playing Russian roulette with my life

leads.worst_review_text: The pharmacy tech at this store is very unpleasant, unhelpful and uncaring.  It is clear she does NOT want to assist clients with their needs.  She makes it well known that it is not HER responsibility to provide assistance to the patrons of this pharmacy.  The only advise she wants to give is to refer to the website.  The website cannot provide HIPPA information as to what series of medications or vaccinations have been given.

I was given someone else’s rx when I filled my refill ( I think it was just mislabeled but did not want to take a chance) upon opening the paper bag when I got home @ 830pm. I called the pharmacy and spoke to Cinerella (sp?) and she asked to bring back the bottle and will get my med refill ready. I told her I’ll bring it the next day as it was already 900 pm. I called the next day on the way just to confirm my med refill is ready to avoid waiting longer and this pharmacist, Phien, was so rude saying “you need to return the other medication before you can get any medicine”. I told him that I spoke to Cinerella the night before and assured me that my medication would be ready for pick up. He just repeated what he said over and over so I just hanged up and continued to drive. I get there with a long line and waited patiently. I got my correct medication and returned the wrong medication and I told the nice gentleman that helped me to let his pharmacist, Phien, know that “all I needed was to get the correct medication and he did not need to be rude to paying customers. Not only did I miss last night’s dose, I had to drive back and wait again to get my medication. No apologies and felt as if I’m the one in the wrong getting the correct medication. My husband who was also there an hour ago stated that the same pharmacist, Phien, rudely told the staff “ it’s an hour wait” when the staff was checking on flu shot admin. He again did not have to be rude about it and could have calmly said it’s going to be a long wait since it’s busy. Why offer walk in flu shots as a service if you’re pharmacist is unhappy about it and not want to accommodate. My husband simply inquired about the walk-in and appointment process. I hope this pharmacist is just a temporary worker in this location as I have not seen him before and will not go back if pharmacist is rude and unapproachable. Everyone else I have encountered in the past has been nice and courteous.

The contact tech is absolutely amazing but…the contact lens’s dept is severely understaffed. One person fitting lenses on a Thursday with no one working at front desk. Every other area is fully staffed with employees everywhere yet this is what you get when you show up at 11:30 and again at 3:30

The second trial were not right with both near and distance vision out of focus.I was also given dailes at the time despite never wearing dailies or  discussing this as an option with the doctor. Third trial I was told I would see the doctor, I didn’t. The fourth trial, I knew immediately the prescription was off. The doctor was heavily pushing me towards dailies.
I called the office to explain the problem and that it was affecting my right eye’s vision and I was concerned. I never received a call back. I ultimately called the office manager whose solution was to refund me since they couldn’t get my prescription right.
TERRIBLE customer support and service!

You can fool me once but that’s it !!! Good luck to you and have a nice life !!!

I’ve been a loyal Parkway Honda customer for years, but today’s experience was extremely disappointing.

I brought my car in with several issues that needed to be checked and repaired and was immediately told I would have to pay $200 just for diagnostics. I explained that I have an extended warranty and that I’ve been servicing my vehicle there for years without ever being charged upfront like this. I also mentioned that all of my warranty information should already be in their system.

The service representative told me it was not in the system and that I would have to call the warranty company myself to get approval. This was surprising because every other time I’ve brought my car in, Parkway Honda handled everything—verified the warranty, provided a loaner, fixed the car, and called me when it was ready.

Because of this, I decided to take my car elsewhere. I went to Nucar Honda, where I was treated completely differently. I walked in, gave them my warranty information, and they immediately inspected my car. They identified the issues I came in for plus another problem, provided me with a rental, and later called to confirm that everything was covered under my warranty, with only my $100 deductible due.

That money could have gone to Parkway Honda if the service advisor had taken the initiative to help. The dealership wasn’t even busy—I was the only customer there.

Unfortunately, Parkway Honda has lost a long-time customer, and Nucar Honda has gained a very happy one.

leads.address: 75 Granite Street Rte 37, 75 Granite St, Braintree, MA 02184, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
I purchased a 2020 Jeep Compass from this dealership in March. Just after Christmas, the vehicle completely broke down. The day before it died, I could press the gas but the car would not go faster than 15 miles per hour.

Because the vehicle was under warranty, I had it towed to the dealership. The day I dropped it off, no one even looked at the car. The following afternoon, I was told by an associate named Nicholas that it needed a new battery and that the sway bar might be covered under the warranty.

Throughout every interaction—both on the phone and in person—Nicholas spoke down to me in a condescending manner. As a woman, I felt I was not taken seriously and was treated as if I didn’t understand basic information, even though the information he provided was incomplete and unclear. He repeatedly interrupted me, would not allow me to ask standard questions, and ultimately hung up on me.

I was later contacted again and told that the sway bar would be covered, but with a $100 deductible. After that, I spoke with the manager, Dave, who did not apologize for the situation and simply answered questions about the parts, stating it would take another day to complete the repairs.

Spending three days in the shop for a battery and sway bar is unreasonable for a dealership that claims to be professional. This is not a small, independent shop—it is a dealership.

Overall, I would recommend going elsewhere to purchase a vehicle. It is ridiculous to have to pay for a battery on a car that was purchased less than a year ago, especially when the warranty turned out to be essentially useless.

Very dissatisfied with my experience.
I purchased the car in perfect condition, but it arrived with several issues and failed the inspection, which already shows a lack of care from the dealership. On top of that, I was unable to work for 8 days due to the delivery delay, and I had to lose even more days because the car kept failing inspection.

What made the situation worse is that instead of fixing the problem right away, the dealership kept telling me to bring the car back to them, even though my inspection was in Maine and I would need to drive 2 hours to do that — which makes no sense, especially considering the issue was their responsibility.

Extremely disappointed with the lack of support, organization, and professionalism. I do not recommend this dealership

- Responding to your comment, since there is no option to reply directly:
At this point, nothing has actually been resolved except the inspection issue. All the other problems with the vehicle are still pending. The lack of communication has been extremely frustrating — phone calls are not answered, messages are barely replied to, and whenever there is contact, it feels like an attempt to delay rather than provide real solutions.

In addition to that, there is essentially no after-sales support. No one from the dealership has reached out proactively to offer assistance or follow up on the unresolved issues. This situation remains ongoing and far from being properly handled.

That's completely on us - making you drive 2 hours back when we sold you a car that failed inspection is ridiculous. You shouldn't have lost 8 days of work because of our mess-up. Call me directly at the dealership so we can fix the remaining issues without more runaround.

leads.business_name: McGovern Chrysler Jeep Dodge Ram of Boston
leads.worst_review_text:
READ BEFORE USING SERVICE- This is not a bashing session but an honest account of what happened. I dropped my 2022 Jeep with about 20k miles on it off to have a few items serviced. Nothing about this place was professional-they appeared that you were always interrupting their lunch breaks or hang outs and all played the game of “I don’t know you have to ask your service advisor” for any question. I can appreciate that if they didn’t know but to give an example of what I had asked would be “Do you know what they ended up fixing/servicing or what was wrong?” - I’m being asked to pay a huge amount of money yet no explanation what it’s for. The women said “They didn’t send you videos when you dropped it off and throughout?” I said no and had no clue what she was referring to, her response was “oh they are supposed to do that.”
Anytime I called over the week plus they had the vehicle, I literally couldn’t reach my advisor due to “he’s on break”, “he’s on vacation” and my favorite “I don’t know where he is, I’ll have him call you back” ….which never ended up happening.
All in all, if I picked it up and everything was tip top shape and working, I wouldn’t have loved the way I was treated but am not a snowflake and would have been fine with it because at the end of the day my vehicle got fixed. Yet, not 2-3 days after I picked it up, the issues that were happening when I dropped it off, lights popped up on my dash and what do you know, same issues still happening. No wonder no one wanted to explain what they fixed when I asked, instead the blanket, yep it’s all fixed and ready to go was given. That sounds better than, oh we just cleared the lights and didn’t actually fix your issue.
I’ve never had such a horrible experience at a dealership and I have seen a lot of service situations over the years as I used to work at a dealership.
Overall, when you take care of your vehicle that’s a 2022 with only 22k miles on it and you spent $68k on it new, you want to be informed as to what’s going on when a service department has it for 8 days and hasn’t given you any updates. Instead this dealership treats you like you are bothering them and good luck getting in touch with anyone you are working with both during and after the process.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That's completely unacceptable - 8 days with no communication and the same issues coming back means we didn't do our job. Please call me directly so I can personally review what happened and get your Jeep properly fixed this time.

leads.worst_review_text:
I brought my 2021 Jeep Grand Cherokee (59k miles) to Quirk CDJR of Boston for a grinding noise when turning, while still under my Powertrain Warranty. The experience was disappointing from start to finish.

The service team confirmed the noise but immediately recommended a $644 wheel hub replacement — then stated it wasn’t covered under warranty, even though Jeep Corporate later confirmed that wheel hubs and integrated bearings are included under Powertrain when related to driveline function.

When I asked them to double-check, they declined and said it wasn’t covered “on my vehicle.” They also refused to waive the $180 diagnostic fee, despite the visit being initiated under an active warranty concern. Ultimately, I had to pay out of pocket just to get my car back, without any repair performed.

I’ve since opened a case with Jeep Corporate, who verified that my warranty is still active and advised me to take it elsewhere. Unfortunately, Quirk CDJR showed little interest in helping a loyal Jeep owner resolve a legitimate warranty issue properly.

I’d strongly recommend other Jeep owners confirm warranty coverage directly with Jeep before authorizing any paid repairs here.

I have been a client of Alto Pharmacy for approximately three years. From the outset, I have been thoroughly impressed by their consultations, auto-refill program, user-friendly website layout, and the promptness in the delivery of medications. I have referred several individuals to Alto Pharmacy, and I hold them in high regard, having left numerous positive reviews. I manage multiple medications, and there has not been a single issue that they have been unable to resolve. Their messaging system is exceptionally user-friendly, and their response times are commendably swift. I hold this pharmacy in high esteem.

However, I received a notification yesterday indicating that they would cease supplying my Schedule II medication, which they have provided for nearly two years. The notice did not include an explanation for this discontinuation, and as a 72-year-old individual, I particularly valued the convenience of their medication delivery service, as I prefer to avoid unnecessary travel. I am quite distressed by their decision to discontinue this particular medication, necessitating my search for an alternative pharmacy. I prefer to consolidate all my medications in one location.

At this juncture, I am contemplating whether to continue my relationship with Alto Pharmacy, given that they did not provide any rationale for the cessation of this medication. The absence of an explanation in their correspondence is concerning. This experience is unprecedented for me, as I have never encountered a pharmacy that selectively determines which medications to fill. I am deeply disappointed in their service.

leads.worst_review_text:
Really sad to be transferring my prescriptions out.
I have been filling my prescriptions through Capsule for almost a year. I really appreciated the hand courier delivery service. I was able to order my prescriptions and receive them the same day. They also were able to deliver controlled substances.
My first issues were the hours of delivery. When I first ordered in April 2022, there were three time slots from Monday through Friday: 10am - 12pm, 12pm - 2 pm, 2pm - 4pm. These times are when most people are in work and school; however, I was able to accommodate this.
Initially, when I messaged Capsule through the app, I believe I was talking to the actual staff in the pharmacy. They were very professional, kind, and quick to resolve an issue.
As of today, there is only one available time slot for delivery from 1pm - 4pm. The people that are answering my messages through the app have incorrect spelling/grammar. There is a physical location, but the primary feature of this pharmacy is the delivery service. It's been made nearly completely inaccessible to the average person.
I hope in the future I can use this pharmacy again, but until more time slots are added and there is better customer service, I don't think Capsule Pharmacy will remain in business in San Diego.

Communication was poor, and I felt like I was wasting my time waiting around with no clear updates. Buying a car is a big decision, and you expect at least a basic level of professionalism and knowledge — unfortunately, that was missing here.

I ended up taking my business elsewhere where the staff actually knew their products and treated me with respect. I wouldn’t recommend this dealership to anyone looking for a smooth, honest, and professional experience.
