That's a lot of issues and we clearly fell short. Room 109 shouldn't have had those drainage and water pressure problems - that's on us to fix. Contact me directly so we can make this right.

- Hotel Pension Baron am Schottentor

leads.worst_review_text:
Unfortunately Hotel am Beatles-Platz did not necessarily meet our expectations. As beautiful as, modern, and sharp the hotel design is, I have learned that not all fancy designed properties may not prioritize the little things… none of which were addressed when we reported them after our first night. We spent 3 nights and items remained unresolved… shower doors not closing, shower ventilation not working, to be provided with linen that is hypoallergenic... all of which hotel staff confirm they are aware of these issues. Some sort of detergent choice of the hotel made it extremely uncomfortable to sleep unless I heavily sedated myself with allergy medication. Hypoallergenic should be a priority because it is environmentally friendly and customer comforting.

We did find in our research that accommodations are not necessarily “cheap” in Germany. It’s primarily a result of covid, and the war in Ukraine what locals have explained to us. So it is difficult to find a hotel with affordable breakfast included.  However, most properties we stayed in for our two weeks of travel included coffee and tea stations in the lobby… not at Hotel am Beatles-Platz. We were told the coffee and tea we need to pay for from their restaurant, which is the same self serve machine as most other hotels offered guests access to. There may have been a misunderstanding because they did not charge us when we checked out. There was a very cute candy station in the lobby, but if you’re diabetic… this isn’t helpful which I wonder again why they offer a fancy candy station over simple coffee/team service. The toiletries were nice. However, the soap dispensers were difficult to use… it was like begging for drops of soap. We were provided with a vanity kit that was empty from day one and I positioned it for the staff yo see, but ignited every day. The body loation was never filled as well.

We understand these are small things and it’s possible small complaints that are not relevant for many people, but these are the little things we look for to make our stay comfortable. We have stayed at extremely small priorities that were over 100-200 years old, and these were never things we had to worry about.

Separately and not an issue created by the hotel… We did pay a significant amount of money for this property and as much as some European counties are proud of their red light districts, this Beatles Platz neighborhood was quite dirty, unacceptably loud until 5 o’clock in the morning each night. In North America, you are discouraged from living or staying at hotels in these bar and strip club zones but the online advertising for Beatles Platz was quite alluring… and we saw after arriving, we would have never picked here based on how bar zones are viewed in North America. Teens and youth out until odd hours singing, screaming, breaking bottles making it difficult to sleep in addition to the already challenging environment we were trying to address with the hotel. Similarly, the dining I would discourage that is offered in the area.  Endless bar food and even Turkish restaurants… but all “fast food”. Save your money and you will find much more nicer Turkish restaurants throughout Hamburg.

I don’t hate this property Hotel am Beatles-Platz, I just would not recommend it if the small things are important for you.  It was comical because we couldn’t not use the broken coat hook, but the hospitality staff would use it to hang the hotel cleaning information from… knowing the hook is broken. Ha!
leads.ai_response_draft: Amar, I'm genuinely sorry about the broken shower doors, faulty ventilation, and empty soap dispensers that went unaddressed during your three nights with us - those maintenance issues should have been fixed immediately, not ignored. You're absolutely right that the small details matter enormously, and we clearly fell short on the hypoallergenic linens you requested and basic amenities like lobby coffee that other hotels provide as standard. Your feedback about our neighborhood's late-night noise is also valuable since many guests don't realize how lively the Reeperbahn area stays until dawn, and we'll work on better setting those expectations upfront. - Hotel am Beatles-Platz

leads.worst_review_text:
This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in in my entire life.

Check-in is officially at 3:00 PM. After a very long 15-hour journey, during which I was exhausted and had not slept at all, I kindly asked at the reception if it was possible to check in earlier, even around 10:00 AM. I was refused without any effort to help, so I was forced to wander around outside. There is no proper waiting area — only dirty, uncleaned tables with cheap black plastic chairs, and extremely loud music playing above them. It is impossible to rest or relax there.

The service is absolutely terrible. I asked for water because I was extremely thirsty, and the receptionist brought me tap water in a very small cup. When I explained how thirsty I was, he said they could not provide any other water.

The room itself is awful. I will not even go into details about the bathroom — it is impossible to shower properly, especially to wash both your body and hair. They provide only two towels, and once the bathroom floor is completely wet, there is nothing left to dry it or yourself. When I arrived, the soap provided was almost empty, with only a tiny amount left at the bottom.

The worst part of this hotel is the housekeeping staff. Yesterday, while I was sleeping, someone tried to open my door. I was terrified and in shock. When I asked who it was, they said it was housekeeping and told me to open the door, saying that I was supposed to leave that day. She spoke to me in a very rude way. When I tried to speak German, she replied aggressively that she did not understand and demanded that I speak English, asking if I understood her or not. The level of disrespect was shocking.

The hotel does not provide “Do Not Disturb” signs at all. This happened again this morning. I have never seen anything like this in my life — staff opening doors while guests are sleeping without knocking or asking. It is completely unacceptable for a hotel not to provide door signs indicating whether guests want to be disturbed or not.

On top of that, housekeeping staff loudly talk on the phone, laugh, and make noise while cleaning rooms, offering no peace or rest to guests.

I am truly shocked by this experience and do not recommend this hotel under any circumstances

leads.business_name: Holiday Inn Hamburg - Berliner Tor, an IHG Hotel
leads.worst_review_text:
.Staff was extremely rude and unprofessional.
.Check-in time was 3 PM, but rooms were not
ready even till 5:30 PM. Despite multiple follow-ups, no action was taken.
.Receptionist made unacceptable comments
like, "If room service staff don't clean the rooms, do you expect us to clean them for you?"
.No complimentary water or sparkling bottles
were provided throughout the stay.
• Staff delivered luggage for other guests but refused to help us.
• Even for tap water, staff warned they would charge next time - very disappointing.
.Breakfast was the same every single day for 21 days, with no change in menu and no live counters.
.Overall, a pathetic experience — guests are
clearly not welcomed here.
.Deeply regret booking this hotel for 3 weeks.

A bleak and depressing hotel.

Negatives:
- Horrible dangerous street with so many lurking men. As women it was unpleasant to arrive or leave. Street was so noisy at night.
- This is a no go as a female traveller. We were three women sleeping in a triple room. Hotel staff kept coming into our room without permission. This happened twice. The first time we warned the reception staff. The second time we started to ask is it really an “accident”. Read other reviews for similar experiences.
- Shabby hotel, smells like cigarettes
- Elevator is terrifying
- Breakfast is the cheapest possible food
- Bad vibes

Positives: the guy at the front desk helped us to carry out bags. They gave us fresh towels every day. The room was clean.

Don’t stay here unless you absolutely have to. This hotel exists to make money not to provide a pleasant experience.

The hotel  could be used to explain   negative  structures in any language. The TV had no signal, there was no wifi in my room. Despite my regular complaints,  they never fixed it, their standard response being the technician was aware of it.
Don't know how they can be considered a four-star hotel unless sth has changed in the star system.
The only positive thing was  the room was cleaned every day and the only positive person was a wonderful lady in the breakfast room. She was in charge of the room. These stars are for her!
Located near the station frequented by the homeless and beggars.
A perfect place if you are into grumpy unhepful staff and  compulsory digital detox.

I don't know how this hotel has 5 stars and a rating of over 9 on Booking. While the lobby and restaurant look nice and pleasant, I can't say anything more positive. In the room I was given, half the light bulbs were burned out. Half! And worst of all, the shower grout was so dirty and moldy that I was reluctant to bathe. After I complained, the hotel didn't charge me for parking as an apology. I will never be fooled by this pseudo-luxury again.
leads.ai_response_draft: Anna, I'm genuinely sorry about the burned-out bulbs and especially the unacceptable condition of your shower grout - that's not the standard we hold ourselves to and I understand why you felt uncomfortable using it. We've already addressed these maintenance issues and implemented more thorough room inspections to prevent this from happening again, because no guest should experience what you did. - Hotel Atlantic Hamburg, Autograph Collection

leads.business_name: Premier Inn Hamburg City Hammerbrook Hotel
Centro Hotel Mondial München, Trademark Collection by Wyndham
leads.worst_review_text:
Fantastic location as in the city centre but this is the only positive.
Carpets were filthy, no kettle in the room (however this may be a European thing) and you have to rent one for €20 as long as your bring it back.
Our toilet constantly flushed and was gurgling and the light in the bathroom wouldn't switch on it kept flickering so had to use the bath and shower in the dark.
Went to speak to the receptionist and asked to swap rooms but because it was the weekend it was fully booked so we had to make do.
We shut the bathroom door but you could still hear the toilet permanently flushing. The bath wasn't cleaned properly and there was scum and limescale in the bath which was disgusting so clearly not looked after well.
The heating came on automatically if it was really cold so most of the time the rooms were freezing and we had no control over the heating.
Asked for a partial refund and never heard anything back.
We booked on booking.com and I was not impressed with the customer service at this hotel especially as we paid €450 for 3 nights.
I never complain but it was terrible here and at least expected some money back for compensation but had nothing.
Female receptionist was helpful and lovely but has no say in refunds/sorting complaints so not her fault.
Awful hotel, don't go here.

Terrible Experience – Dirty, Neglected, and Very Misleading

This was honestly one of the worst hotels I’ve ever stayed in.

From the moment you enter, you can already see how badly this place is neglected. The entrance area is dirty, full of dust, trash, and overgrown plants, which gives a very bad first impression.

The room itself was very dirty and dusty. I found spider webs inside the room, which shows that proper cleaning is clearly not being done. The bathroom was in poor condition and the shower was broken and barely usable.

The bed was extremely hard and uncomfortable, making it difficult to sleep. Worst of all, the hotel looks nothing like the pictures online — the photos are very misleading compared to the real condition.

Overall, this hotel feels poorly maintained, unhygienic, and absolutely not worth the money.
I would not recommend it to anyone

This was the first and last stay at this hotel. While the rooms are nice and the location is good, the bad service made the whole stay a bitter memory.
It is overpriced.
They asked for an extra 100€ for a child bed.
The worst service, and food was at breakfast,  so I recommend skipping it and just go to the next by Einstein Café instead.
All stuff, restaurant and reception, were unfriendly, some seemed hanged over or still under influence of drugs from the previous night.
For the same price, you can get much more value for your money, pretty much anywhere else.

@hotel owner, no need to comment on this telling me you’re very sorry. And I have already expressed my disappointment from the service during my stay, so I don’t need to send you another email.
Nice design is not a good enough reason to stay at your hotel. Good service should match the good design.

Very disappointing experience at Quentin Hotel Potsdamer Platz.

I booked this hotel specifically because I needed a room with a large mirror, which I clearly mentioned in advance. Despite this, I was given a room without it. When I asked for a room change, instead of fixing their mistake, the staff insisted that I immediately provide the name of a guest who was not even present yet.

I explained several times that my guest would arrive later and that they could ask her directly then. Instead, three staff members spoke to me in a pressuring and dismissive way and told me I either had to accept the wrong room or disclose personal information. I was even asked to wait in the lobby until my guest arrived, which would have taken hours.

This behavior completely ruined my mood and made me feel uncomfortable and disrespected as a paying guest. The situation was handled very unprofessionally and left me feeling sad and disappointed.
Thank you guys well done .
There is a new lady who is getting teaching to be just like the rest....
Oh by the way i asked to meet manger but he was not there .. and they said that he will be saying just what we are saying....

So bad 👎

leads.worst_review_text: I am astounded with the quality of service my child and I received at Myoptic today. This is the first Google review I have ever written, and that says a lot. My son and I were 60 seconds past our appointment grace window and were denied services. Literally one minute past. I attempted to ask for some “grace” and “understanding” as this was our last day of school, I’m a teacher, and I have two children I’m trying to manage. I was told that my 1 minute was cutting into other people’s appointment times which is a load of garbage. I guarantee you that the doctors aren’t being penalized for being 1 min late to their patient appointments. Where is the humanity. I would never have denied services to someone who was doing their best at 1 minute past. The assistant manager who I spoke with was also incredibly rude to me. They only regurgitated the same script with an unprofessional tone and body language. This appointment was time sensitive to our family. I respectfully declined when offered a new appointment.

leads.worst_review_text:
I had previously visited the Vi Café in Zurich and was not satisfied. This time, I tried the Basel location today, hoping for a better experience.

It was very cold outside, so I ordered a hot drink: a chai latte with oat milk. Unfortunately, the drink I received was clearly cold.

When I asked if it could be reheated or remade, I was told very firmly that this was “not possible.” I honestly could not understand how reheating or remaking a chai latte could be considered impossible. This is not a language issue — the explanation simply did not make sense.

At one point, the staff member touched the cup and insisted that it was warm. Even if it felt warm to them, it was not warm to me. Temperature is subjective, and what matters is the customer’s experience.

I drink coffee and hot beverages outside regularly and do not make a habit of sending drinks back. Expecting a hot drink to be hot is not an unreasonable request. Being treated as if I were asking for something extraordinary was uncomfortable and unprofessional.

In the end, I drank the chai latte only because I had paid for it. I did not enjoy it at all. This experience made me seriously question how much customer satisfaction is valued.

Never again.

leads.worst_review_text:
I chose a car from the dealer's offer. I asked additional questions in English by email. I used English because the dealer says that he communicates in this language. No one answered. After a week I wrote again and asked for an answer. Still nothing. After a few more days they reduced the price of the car I chose. But no one is answering. Isn't that strange??
I just want to clarify that my request was about a Citroen e-C4. You will surely find it in your mailbox. Looking forward for any response to my emails. Thanks.

Wanted less caffeine as it was late in the day so I ordered bancha, it’s my second time having bancha at Svedjan but to my surprise, after waiting for a while the tea still looked rather pale in the teapot and when I drank it it tasted like water. When I opened the lid I understood why - it’s definitely too juicy to charge 35kr for pure water. How horribly stingy it was for the amount of tea leaves they put there. It could be a mistake but then that would be a horrible one. The croissant tasted alright though.

leads.address: The Body Studio, Heemstedestraat 12-14, 1058 NM Amsterdam, Netherlands

leads.worst_review_text:
I attended several sessions at this clinic, and unfortunately I cannot recommend their services for the following reasons:

During treatment with Jelmer for a shoulder injury, I was referred and scheduled to see Lennard for a different issue on 12 December at 2:00 PM. However, on that day I received an automated confirmation email stating that the appointment was at 12:00 PM. I arrived at the clinic at the time indicated in the email and waited for 40 minutes, only to be informed that no appointment had been scheduled for me that day—despite having a written confirmation email clearly stating otherwise.

A new appointment was then scheduled for the following week, which proceeded as expected.

Subsequently, a follow-up session was booked for 5 January at 12:00 PM. On the day of the appointment, I received again a confirmation email—this time at 10:48 AM—stating that my appointment was at 11:00 AM, creating yet another discrepancy in their scheduling system.

I attempted to clarify this by calling four times and sending an email to confirm whether the appointment time had changed or was still set for 12:00 PM. I received no response whatsoever. Given that this was the second instance of conflicting information, the lack of communication, and the proximity to the appointment time, I couldn’t not attend it, and to avoid once again wasting time traveling to a potentially nonexistent appointment.

Despite these circumstances, I was later issued an invoice of €50 for a missed appointment—even though the confirmation they provided was incorrect and all reasonable efforts were made on my part to verify the booking.

Overall, the clinic demonstrated a lack of respect for clients’ time and availability and failed to take accountability for repeated administrative errors. Additionally, I did not notice any improvement in my condition following the sessions, which further reinforces that the service was not worth the time or cost.

Just be aware, can be you next time.

leads.address: Easter Bush Campus, Edinburgh EH25 9RG, UK
leads.worst_review_text:
The incompetence and disregard for the health of my cat is mind-blowing.  I came to see the Vet as my cat seemed to have a urinary infection and bloody urine.  After the exam and medication that was prescribed, I was asked to bring in a urine sample from the cat the next day.  I brought the sample in early Thurs morning, and it was very red/bloody. I did not get a call back about the results, so on the next Tuesday (they had the sample for 6 days) at around 10, I called. I got a call back just before 4 from a nurse who told me the BLOODY SAMPLE WAS SITTING ON THE RECEPTION DESK FOR 6 DAYS.  The nurse wanted to know if I wanted the sample sent in since it was old and the result may not be accurate.  THERE WAS NO MENTION OF TALKING TO A VET OR MANAGEMENT ABOUT THE ISSUE. AND NO CONCERN FOR THE HEALTH OF MY CAT. I had to determine what to do with the sample. I asked to speak to a manager, and she told me not to expect a call back for 2-3 days!! Not believing the message would be relayed, I called back an hour later and asked to talk to a manager or a vet. I still could not get past the receptionist. I was told to email my complaint.  THERE WAS NO ONE IN CHANGE IN ANY MANNER THAT I COULD SPEAK TO NOR COULD I SPEAK TO A SENIOR VET. I asked to have a Vet call me as I had no idea what to do and was concerned about my cat.  The receptionist could not understand why I wanted to talk to a Vet. I had to explain why I would be concerned about my cat, who had bloody urine compounded by their mistake. You would think Dicks Vet of the University of Edinburgh would be first and for most a veterinarian practice.  The bloody sample sat on the desk for 6 days, and how many receptionists saw it and did nothing.  Why when I called and the mistake discovered was a vet not consulted for advice about what to do FOR THE HEALTH OF THE ANIMAL before calling me. The whole things was just covered up! I still have not spoken to a Vet.

Update: later in the evening, I did receive a call from a Vet who was amazingly kind and understanding.  She seemed to really understand the concerns was that no thought had been given to my pet.  So I am happy with the Vet response.  I still have concerns regarding the receptionist and the nurse.

We chose Carden Park to celebrate a special anniversary and birthday, and it was absolutely perfect. The hotel is beautiful and the staff were amazing across the bar, restaurant, spa and reception. Nothing was ever too much trouble.
The food and drinks were excellent and the spa was incredible. The massage was one of the best I’ve had. Everything about our stay felt special and relaxing. We couldn’t have chosen a better place and would definitely return.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The spa massage therapists really know what they're doing. Perfect choice for an anniversary celebration.

- Carden Park Hotel

leads.worst_review_text:
This review highlights my experience and confirms the issue that is mentioned in almost all reviews.

Booked and paid for a treatment package with Dawson spa in the hope of having a relaxing time however it turned out to be a nightmare!
Booked my treatments about a month prior only for the business to call me 5 hours prior to the appointment to cancel it due to staff not being available.
As the only solution I was offered was rescheduling, I told them I would call back to schedule a new date as their call was during a work lunch and I was assured that there are availabilities at any time.
(I called back an hour later, a day later, 2 days later, a week later, two weeks later Multiple times, leaving a voice message to be called back as no one answered however there was still no answer nor call back).
I finally sent an email explaining the situation, and after multiple back and forth emails that took days, I was offered an upgrade on my package yet STILL no booking nor a question about it.

I then communicated that I am still trying to get a booking and that is the main issue.
I was asked to send dates that would be available and so I did however still no reply. I decided to go into town that Morning to the business itself and speak to them in person in the hopes that this will be sorted! Staff then told me to send an email and their manager will contact me!!! I proceeded in explaining my situation so they asked me to leave a phone number to be contacted by the manager (Maureen) once she is back.
Although I had already shared my contact information via email with her, I did that again with the staff and left. I finally received a call at 7:30pm that day to tell me that there is no availability for another FIVE Weeks.

THE TREATMENT:

The Massage was OK. I cannot say that it was bad however it certainly was not good.

The Facial was decent. I actually think that the products that were used and the technique were good.

The head massage was not good and I personally found it to be annoying as I specifically asked twice for no oils/creams to be used on my scalp/hair for medical reasons however my request was completely ignored which is very ignorant.

CONCLUSION:
I am not sure I would recommend this place as there are multiple other, much professional options in this price range.

leads.worst_review_text:
First, make sure which venue you are booking : The Merrion Day Spa or The Spa and Health Club at the Merrion Hotel. It is easy to mix up. Luckily the locations are just minutes apart.

Second, I’m afraid I cannot recommend the Merrion Day Spa. While the music was calming, the facilities were filled with plastic plants, polyester wall hangings, and clean but crunchy towels - and an odd hole in the flooring. I was hoping the massage would make up for the environs, it did not. The massage was more like someone putting on lotion for me. I did note the one area I needed extra massage but it was missed. In fairness, I did not mention it during the massage.

I wanted to like Merrion Day Spa. Sadly, there is much room for improvement.

leads.business_name: Four Seasons Hotel London at Tower Bridge
leads.worst_review_text:
We recently visited the Four Seasons for afternoon tea and, unfortunately, the experience was disappointing and fell well below the standard expected of a five-star hotel.

Upon arrival, we waited approximately 45 minutes for the tea & food to arrive, which significantly affected the overall experience.

When the food was finally served, the savoury selection was very limited in quantity compared to the sweet items, creating an unbalanced offering. Additionally, all items were served at the same time. While this made for an attractive presentation, it resulted in hot items such as the scones and sticky toffee pudding with sauce becoming cold by the time we reached them.

That said, the food itself was very delicious, which made the service and timing issues particularly disappointing. Additionally, if you are expecting a traditional afternoon tea experience, this is not the one — it felt more like all snacks being served at the same time, rather than a paced afternoon tea service.

Throughout the experience, no additional hot water for the tea was offered, which is a basic expectation for afternoon tea service. Furthermore, when we enquired about the possibility of a small savoury top-up, we were informed that this would be chargeable. This is not standard practice at most afternoon tea venues and is particularly surprising at a hotel of the Four Seasons’ calibre.

Overall, the experience did not meet the expectations associated with a five-star establishment. We hope this feedback is taken constructively and helps improve the service for future guests.

leads.business_name: Denver Health: Lowry Family Health Center
leads.worst_review_text:
Male Employee at the pharmacy is not good at all. For one prescription, I have to come three times, but still was not ready.
I received about 5 emails in last 5 days that the prescription was ready.
They are just giving hard time.

leads.business_name: Denver Health: Sam Sandos Westside Health Center
leads.worst_review_text: The worst experience I've ever had with Denver Health, I used to go to the main campus but I thought would be a good idea to switch to this clinic just because the location is closer to my home; I regret that so much, the registration staff and the nurse were very kind and helpful, but I have never in my life felt so humiliated and unheard like I did with *Dr. Sapan Shah* . Since the appointment started he showed a dismissing demeanor, like everything I was telling him wasn't a big deal. Beforehand I told the nurse that I was feeling depressed and that I suffer from social anxiety. For people who struggle with mental health is not easy to take a step forward for your own health, most of the time I rather being in pain than going to the doctor because of this kind of situations. There were several concerns that I had regarding my health issues, but he cut me off saying "we don't have time for this, If you want to talk about that, schedule another appointment or talk with the medical asistent. I'm not your primary care provider, so you should talk with her about this". If you're a woman and struggle with mental health, just avoid this guy if you don't wanna leave the clinic feeling worst than you were before.

leads.worst_review_text: I was very much looking forward to my appointment. It's a long story I had already written a review but I took down my post. I do feel writing this is necessary. I was unimpressed with the staff. I did appreciate Edda calling me to try and make things right, but of course this was after my review. So to me it felt like she was only calling so I could take my review down. This whole experience has left a bad taste. I don't trust this salon anymore the beginning was terrible. Please have your receptionist trained better. When I received the call my appointment was being canceled. The verbiage was " Edda was being pulled in multiple directions and won't reschedule me." Lots of Umms and Uhh with the person I spoke to, He was not nice at all. Very rude and condescending. This was after a 250$ deposit. A couple days later when I spoke to Edda she did apologize and said " I am sorry you were caught in the cross fire of everything". Such a weird way to go about things. Yes life happens, but I was a new client to build a report like this was a terrible way to go about it. After thinking about it, I truly just feel disappointed and I won't be returning. I hope I am the only client they have done this too. And I hope that whenever they book new Clients they don't overbook themselves since that is what happened to me. In the end I wound up finding a MUCH nicer hair salon that. didn't charge me 250$ deposit and it was way cheaper. The last thing id like to add is that this hair salon is so overly priced even for Chicago and there are many much nicer places.

leads.address: 12649 SE Division St, Portland, OR 97236, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
If I could give zero stars, I would.

Purchased a used car from them, and within six days, it needed a new radiator - leaving me stranded out of state for several days.

I was met with condescension and word salad when confronting the salesman, David. I understand the meaning of “as is” - but I would think a dealership such as this would be interested in making things right. I would even have been more receptive if I wasn’t met with attitude and a blatant disregard for the truth. They tried to gaslight me into silence. I walked in with a refund number I felt acceptable - and even said I was willing to negotiate. But no. No go.

Also, beware - there are a number of hidden fees and registration tasks they punt onto the consumer. I was SO willing to give all of this a pass - especially since the car was inspected by a third party (that’s an entirely different issue at this point).

If they step up and make a non-snarky attempt to rectify this, I will gladly remove this review and move forward. Currently awaiting a response from the manager or owner of BCR.

leads.address: 13456 SE McLoughlin Blvd, Portland, OR 97222, USA
10820 SE Division St, Portland, OR 97266, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
I am extremely disappointed in my experience with Columbia Motors and strongly advise against anyone considering doing business here.

I contacted the dealership in advance to confirm the condition of a vehicle and was clearly assured that the car had no issues that they were aware of and was in good working order. Based on those representations, I flew from Salt Lake City to Portland specifically to view and potentially purchase the vehicle.

At the end of the test drive, the car triggered multiple fault codes and a flashing check engine light, which is forgivable considering it was a used car however, while attempting to explain the situation away, the salesperson accidentally showed me text messages from their mechanic confirming that this was a known, recurring issue and that the codes had been cleared previously instead of the underlying problem being properly repaired. This directly contradicted everything I had been told prior to traveling at my own expense, and shows how Columbia Motors chooses to do business.

Despite this clear evidence, the issue was minimized as “just a software update.” After flying back to Salt Lake City and after a month of horrible communication from my salesperson I was later assured that the vehicle had been fully repaired and that the problem had been resolved.

Trusting those assurances, I flew back to Portland a second time. Within approximately 15 minutes of driving the car, the exact same failure occurred again multiple fault codes and a flashing check engine light. When I spoke to the salesman about my frustration from the lack of transparency on our first visit (the known issue and clearing the codes) he of course pretended like it never happened..... At that point, it was undeniable that the issue had not been properly diagnosed or repaired and that the assurances I had been given were simply not accurate and intentionally misleading.

What made this experience even more disappointing was the complete lack of accountability afterward. There was no meaningful acknowledgment of the inconvenience, cost, or time lost from two separate trips made solely based on the dealership’s representations. I was told that someone would follow up with a solution, yet no one ever did. Communication stopped, and responsibility was avoided rather than addressed.

This is not simply a case of a used car having an unexpected issue. This was a known problem that was not disclosed intentionally, minimized repeatedly, and then represented as fixed when it clearly was not. That level of transparency and professionalism is simply unacceptable.

After wasting about $1,500 and dealing with months of awful communication I am left without a car, solution or even an apology. After returning from my SECOND trip to Portland I am left with no response from anyone at Columbia Motors. The entire experience was frustrating, costly, and frankly disheartening. I expected basic honesty and professionalism. Instead, I was left feeling misled and disregarded once the problems became inconvenient for the dealership.

Whatever Columbia's response may be know that they do not deal in good faith.

For your own sake AVOID Columbia Motors at all costs.

leads.worst_review_text:
I would like to share my experience working with Austin Auto Planet as a 21-year-old young woman. I do feel I was taken advantage of due to my age and this being my first auto loan.
At the end of November, I purchased a 2018 Kia Sportage. A family friend and I test drove the car, and when I reached highway speeds to test acceleration, the check engine light immediately came on. There were also a few other concerns I brought up while checking out the car. When I returned from the test drive, the owner said it was a misfire and that he would fix it. I mentioned the other concerns and he brushed them off as not important. I came back later that evening, took the car back out, and the light was off, so I moved forward with the purchase (I should have walked away).
After having the car for only 12 days and roughly 500 miles, while driving to work at the same highway speed (around 70 mph), the check engine light came on again. I immediately called my dad, and he advised me to contact the dealer and try to return the car since this was my first loan. I stopped at AutoZone, where they pulled code P0234, which indicates a turbo overboost condition that can cause serious engine damage if not fixed.
When I brought the car back to the dealership, the owner immediately told me this was a new issue and once again said it was not important. I have him on recording stating that he cleared the original check engine light because the codes were “history,” and while we were test driving the car together, he cleared the check engine light again right in front of me.
Although he offered to fix the car, my bank advised that I try to give it back. I went back and forth with him asking to return the vehicle, but he undermined my concerns and repeatedly brushed them off by saying, “I said I fix it for you.” I ended up leaving the car with him on December 4.
On December 6, he told me he needed to order a part and showed me a part listing from eBay. He said the part would arrive between December 10–13. The part arrived on December 16, but it was broken, and the car was not returned to me until December 20. He had my car for 16 days (December 4–20)!!!

During this time, I had to Uber to work while working two jobs. I spent $613.72 on Uber while my car sat at his dealership. It wasn’t until the day before the car was fixed that he agreed to provide a loaner vehicle.

This is not an honest dealership. The owner admitted he does not run safety inspections on his cars and said I should be glad he was “honest enough” to tell me upfront. However, his website claims he sells quality vehicles and performs a rigorous multi-point inspection, which was not my experience at all.
After getting the car back, I took it to my personal mechanic again, and they encouraged me to sell the car and not have anything further to do with this dealership.

Please be aware of who you are dealing with before purchasing from this lot.

The current way of hospitality is completely contrary to the original intention of starting this business.

I took my child to the store, hoping to test his eyesight within the three-month warranty period and consider whether the lenses need to be adjusted. Because my child was recently diagnosed with very poor eyesight in one eye, we need to pay great attention to the change in degree. When I was getting glasses, a VIU employee reminded me that there was a three-month warranty period and we could come back for inspection at any time. But when we went to the store today, we only felt the staff's attitude of refusing to serve and asking us to pay extra for it. We have paid nearly 500CHF for a pair of frames and a pair of myopic glasses (the other one is plain glass).
I didn't feel the business philosophy that VIU claimed during its founding. The price does not have any advantage, and the service is even not as good as the classic Swiss optical shop. So, I don't find any reason to continue to consume in this brand. And this is not the first time I have been to VIU, nor the first time I have felt an uncomfortable consumer experience.

Warning: Avoid Emil Frey Münchenstein!

I bought a brand-new Jaguar from Emil Frey Münchenstein 12 years ago, expecting it to be my lifelong companion and an old-timer for my grandchild. Twice a year, I entrusted Emil Frey with all maintenance and revisions, ensuring the car was always in top condition.

Despite this diligent upkeep, my car recently started coughing. On March 18, 2025, after an “endoscopic check,” Emil Frey shockingly informed me that one cylinder is rusted—making the car irreparable! Rust takes years to develop, yet this issue was never detected during their inspections. Their excuse? Probably a “manufacturing defect”—after 12 years of flawless performance!

Instead of a fair resolution, Emil Frey’s only offer was to scrap my car for parts—but only if I bought another car from them! Unethical and unacceptable.

⚠ Emil Frey sells you a dream, only to take another bite of your wallet later. Beware of their unreliable service!

Unfortunately I did not have a good experience at all with this Volvo reseller, I would recommend to use any other one in Switzerland. The car itself was fine but the service offered by this dealer at the end of the leasing was very poor. I was invoiced a huge penalty (almost 13'000 CHF) for having driven 26'000 KM more than agreed in the leasing contract. This turned out to be far above the real value decrease when verifying market prices on different second hand web sites like autoscout24.ch. Furthermore, I was told that my insurance would not pay any of the chassis parking damages but when verifying, nearly all reparations were paid. They also refused to de-register the car at MFK before I signed their cost proposal, which blocked me more than a week from using the registration plate on my new car. At last, when finally buying the car for the rest value instead of paying the penalty, I got no transport of the vehicule to my office, nor was I allowed to pick it up myself by using a temporary registration plate. (U-Nummer)

I was excited to try this café after hearing good things, and we decided to ask the waiter about their hot chocolate. He explained it’s made from milk and chocolate mixed together, so we expected something rich and comforting. Unfortunately, what arrived was a rather weak cocoa—not what we had in mind. While the café has a nice atmosphere, I hope they can improve their hot chocolate to match the rest of the experience.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That's fair - our hot chocolate should be richer than what you got. We'll work on making it more like the real deal you were expecting.

- Café Bazar

leads.address: 1251 North St, Dresden, ON N0P 1M0, Canada
leads.worst_review_text: Called and left several messages,  went to the lot, no one available.  Says reads messages daily when u call. After a week and a half of leaving messages,  got a phone call finally, oops sold. 😬

This is a summary of my 8 years worth of experience with this branch. Not all my experiences there are bad. But, most of them are.
1- When i bought my car, the salesman there told me to contact him if i have questions or issues. But, he didn't reply to most of my emails after sale.

2- I went to buy another car. I asked a few questions that another salesman didn't have answers to. He promised to ask and send me back. It never happened.

3- After 8 years and only 65000 km, and in the span of 3 months, i paid ~3500 Euros in repairs for stuff that just broke in the engine and horn; nothing from reckless use or anything. And, the sad thing is; in some of those visits, i couldn't speak in English with my appointed person even though they know English! I try with my little German to bridge the gap. And, i don't see them try the same to help me understand what's wrong with my car. I pay a lot of money, and i deserve to know what's wrong with my car.

4- After one repair in the motor, which cost me the ~2600 Euros, my motor couldn't start the motion of the car smoothly anymore. A friend told me to switch from e10 to e5 benzine. It made things better. But, still i went to BMW because this problem only appeared after they repaired my car. I had the following conversation with them:

Me: my car wouldn't start smoothly with e10 anymore after you repaired my motor. e5 works fine, but not e10
They: yeah, e5 is better because blah blah blah...
Me: but, it's written on the tank opening that the car may use e10
They: yeah, that's just for the regulations and law in Germany.

I was speechless. I know the guy must be wrong of course, because it's a serious problem if BMW uses this kinds of tricks. And a big name like BMW wouldn't do that for sure. But, how can I respond to such idiocracy when i hear it?!
They told me that nothing is wrong with my car. Later afterwards, even the e5 benzine wouldn't make the start of the motion smooth anymore. The car would kinda jump or hump before it moves; after only 65000 km!

5- As i left the branch one time, i got a feedback form from a person at the counter to rate my experience. I put in a bad feedback about the branch and about her. I asked her where to put the form. She said that she'll take it and pass it on. How on earth would i trust someone I'm complaining against to pass on my feedback to their superiors? Of course, i didn't get any call back from BMW to see why their customer wasn't satisfied.

That's only from top of my head. If i remember more experiences, I'll add them to my review here.

I bought the car from this Company  and the car didnt come with equipment that the sailsman in email told me that it have. When i try to contact them they replied to me that the car have every thing from the equipment list,i said ok, but i asked them does the car have addicionalny this 2 things and they confirmed me in email that it has and now they are not even replying me anymore.

Alot of billed hours i had to pay for compared to how little they actually did. Would choose any other company. If you are satisfied with theese guys, you probably havent tried ANYONE else, and havent check what thety actually bill you for. STAY AWAY!!

This customer experience has very confusing and costly for me, and I would not recommend this agency. This includes a lack of response to inquiries regarding clarification of what tasks the agency was supposed to perform and most recently with the issuing of an invoice without any requested task having been completed. It was ultimately me who was given extra work in connection with registering and paying invoices to avoid even more work in connection with the follow-up of a potential legal conflict.

Terrible service. I showed up for my appointment on time, but the reception was unmanned. I tried calling their phone number but it’s just an automated message saying to email them. No answer to my emails, so I left after waiting 25 minutes. I’ll be going elsewhere.

Should apply for a subsidy for fixed costs in connection with corona. Dantaxi has made a large customer agreement that they would help companies, but they do not answer numerous emails or calls. How difficult is it to announce that help cannot be obtained? Waste of valuable time. Not impressed with Accountor.

leads.address: C/O The Rehab, Staldgade 22, 1, 1699 København, Denmark

leads.worst_review_text:
This bakery is one of the best in Brussels. It’s always busy, and I’ve been coming here for years, even though I don’t live in the city but visit often. Their products are great.

Unfortunately, the service can be less than friendly and rather inefficient something not uncommon in Brussels, you get the feeling that your presence is more of an inconvenience than a welcome visit.

For the last issue, they scam you, if you speak English they will charge up products, consistently. I never understand why things end up being so expensive. Whenever I ask for a receipt, I notice they’ve either charged me for pricier items than what I actually got or increased the prices. I’ve attached photo of me buying almond croissants for over 200% markup, and buying the cheapest bread and getting charged for a more expensive one instead. This is a consistent thing.

If you buy here, always ask for the receipt, they consistently will try to scam you.

leads.address: Av. de la Couronne 75, 1050 Bruxelles, Belgium

leads.worst_review_text: My experience with MyFid was very disappointing: the accounting software is not very intuitive and the approach remains very administrative, lacking any real strategy or in-depth understanding of certain professions like communication, translation, and copywriting. Since joining Accountable, the difference is striking: strategic support, regular follow-up, practical advice (copyright, incorporating, etc.), and a true balance between AI and human support. With their webinars and coaching, Accountable is clearly positioning itself as a growth partner for freelancers.

I visited the spa for the first time today for a rewilding facial treatment. The therapist Sandra was brilliant, talking through all the products and steps prior to entering the treatment room. It was such a relaxing atmosphere and I can hands down say the best spa experience I've ever had. Afterwards I was given a lovely probiotic drink.
I'd recommend the spa to anyone, it's a lovely atmosphere and makes you forget you're in the middle of a busy city!
leads.ai_response_draft:
Sandra's great at explaining everything before you start - makes such a difference. The probiotic drinks are a nice touch too.

- Lush Spa Birmingham

leads.address: 2655 Lane Park Rd, Mountain Brook, AL 35223, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
The good: beautiful facility, friendly reception, and lovely area.

The not so good: everything else

The details: My friends and I booked massages followed by a wine tasting class at the hotel, and we had been looking forward to it for weeks. Two of us even took vacation days, and our third friend had just been laid off, so we were all counting on a relaxing, much needed day together. The plan was to ride together and make a whole day of it.

About 40 minutes before our appointments, the temporary spa manager called to say they didn’t have enough therapists. They were trying to find someone, but one of us would need to come in immediately for an earlier appointment instead of all three of us going together as scheduled. After scrambling to figure it out, the friend who lived closest drove separately to take the earlier slot.

From the beginning, the session felt awkward, clunky, and unprofessional. Even after asking Chris for more pressure, it was so light I joked to myself that a cat could have pressed harder. He stayed in the same spot for so long that I genuinely wondered if my skin was going to be rubbed raw. It was as if he had never been taught, had seen, nor received a massage before. He only moved when I finally asked him to, and each area was the same uncomfortable and ineffective pushing of skin. I even considered stopping the massage altogether, but I kept hoping it would improve with more communication.

When it ended, almost abruptly, he simply pointed down the hall and told me to change “down there.” I had to ask someone else for directions. Meanwhile, my friends were in the lounge sipping mimosas and raving about “the best massage of my life,” complete with warm booties and thoughtful parting instructions. I didn’t want to ruin their mood, but they immediately noticed something was wrong. They were upset on my behalf and got a mimosa from the front to cheer me up.

At checkout, I explained what happened. The receptionist apologized, removed the deep tissue upcharge, and said the manager would contact me that afternoon to offer a massage redo. That call never came.

Months passed with no followup until today, when I got a text saying they “missed me” and would love to see me again. I couldn’t help but laugh, and decided it was finally time to write this review.

I have used my Google account that does not list my name. If the spa would like to verify that I was actually there, please check your appointment calendar for April 25, 2025 around 9AM.  There were appointments for Melissa, Julia, and Kelsey.

leads.business_name: The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte hotel
leads.worst_review_text: Had the best stay here. Beautiful building. The concierge team, especially Jose, truly looked out for me— even helping me with my bags to the train! The front desk and restaurant staff, like Kasia, went out of their way to make me feel welcome and remembered my breakfast orders. This is truly a 5-star experience— book now!
leads.ai_response_draft:
Jose always goes the extra mile - he'll probably remember you next time too. Glad Kasia took good care of you at breakfast.

- The Balmoral, a Rocco Forte hotel

His claws were trimmed despite having a groom prior so I didn’t think it was his nail, the trimming resulted in cutting it to close and cutting my dogs quick and it would not stop bleeding, a nurse had to also come it’s to stop it. I know it was an accident but the root cause of the irritation wasn’t found and he came out with another problem. Was an awful experience to see him howling, trembling and crying in so much pain. leads.worst_review_text:
This place has been trying to silence me since my cat contracted ringworm at the clinic. I will not let my voice be silenced. On the trip to fix the issue my card declined which began the humiliation tactics. The receptionist started laughing at how poor I was. Me and my wife are local teachers. She kept waving a handbag in my face saying "it's a HERMES bag. it's a HERMES bag. if you can't buy something like this, don't get a cat." Hermes? I think that lady is Her-Mean. My wife and I work as teachers...we don't always have money but are full of heart, thats why we pulled a kitten out of a puddle on that cold dreary night so one more soul could have a safe home. I never knew it would end with a handbag being waved in my face. I've tried posting this many times but they keep taking it down so their business can continue booming in their new location.

Rest In Power 🕊️ - Mittens (ringworm)

The masseuse was extremely rough and even had the nerve to ask for a tip afterward. I mentioned that my right side was experiencing some discomfort, but she completely ignored my concerns. It was the worst massage I've ever had! I will never return to this spa for a massage again.orst massage I've ever had! I will never return to this spa for a massage again.

leads.address: Titanic Spa, Low Westwood Ln, Linthwaite, Huddersfield HD7 5UN, UK
leads.worst_review_text:
For what we paid for this so called  totally relaxing experience we found ourselves deeply disappointed.
Upon arrival we were given our robe and slippers. When we got changed our robes were still wet which immediately left us not only cold but feeling unclean.
We decided to dip in the pool which was so cold we had to leave shortly after. We though we'd then give the hot tub a go which was another mistake. 1 hot tub for the entire facility was unbelievable and we never actually got to use it.
Our room was filthy, dated and run down with broken doors and mould everywhere.
Without going Into too much detail I found myself stuck on the toilet without any toilet roll provided. After this horrible incident I then decided to have a shower to clean myself properly.
I was at a loss after showering to find there wasn't a single towel left for us to dry ourselves with and had to dry myself with a hairdryer.
At this point I was tipped over the edge and fealt the whole experience was a complete disaster.
I will not be visiting Titanic Spa again any time soon!

leads.worst_review_text:
There is nothing worse than this store. They do not allow a wife or husband to enter the fitting room, which means that if you choose 10 items, you have to change clothes 10 times. Each time, you have to go in and out just to see whether your spouse thinks the clothes fit or not. This feels like a fashion show process.
It’s honestly ridiculous, and I don’t understand the purpose of this restriction.👎
leads.ai_response_draft:
That fitting room policy is frustrating - you're right about that. We've had complaints about this before and I'm pushing to get it changed. Email me directly at the store and I'll see what we can do.

- TK Maxx

leads.worst_review_text: The Plaza at Buckland Hills is an excellent open-air shopping destination with a wonderful variety of over 30 retail, dining, and entertainment options. It's incredibly convenient, offering a great mix of businesses like Trader Joe’s, Chick-fil-A, and Starbucks all in one spot. The area is well-maintained, clean, and pleasant for a family outing. There is a massive parking lot, but be warned: the plaza gets very crowded on weekends, and traffic around the exit can back up slightly. Overall, a top-tier place for shopping and grabbing a bite!
leads.ai_response_draft:
The weekend crowds definitely get crazy - that exit backup is real. Glad you found everything you needed in one spot.

- The Plaza at Buckland Hills

leads.worst_review_text: While my service was great, my experience was not. They could not find record of the gift card I was using, despite being able to show them the book it came in and transaction with the CC number, date and amount. I stood in their lobby for over 30 minutes while they tried to locate it and never found it. All the relaxation of my service was undone, and the wait also left me late for holiday festivities.

leads.business_name: Hand & Stone Massage and Facial Spa
leads.worst_review_text: One of the worst massage I ever experienced in my life !!!! Charged me 206$ for scratching my back🤬 it was a deep tissue massage and she was just rubbing oil on my body and keep rushing a session by saying she have an another appointment soon . Didn’t even clean the oil from my back and told me towel are there clean your body . I will never come back and suggest everyone not to waste a money here . 60$ Thai massage is million times better than this place. Whoever the owner is please change the name of your business from msssge place to Tickle place

We forgot to check the holiday hours so walked up ten minutes before closing. The lady at the door said “ WE ARE CLOSING IN TEN NO” in an extremely rude tone. We are not unreasonable people to walk in if it was closing in ten, especially during the holiday season. She could have been polite. So much for Holiday Spirit!!
Super fun. Great for kids and adults. There are plenty of games to choose from. We did the 90 minute package but 60 probably would have been long enough. Teen boys liked it.
leads.ai_response_draft:
90 minutes can be a lot - most people find 60 is the sweet spot. Glad the teen boys had fun.

- Hacienda Crossings Shopping Center

leads.worst_review_text: When i went to the register this guy with a receding hair line scanned my item twice to charge me double and I asked him to remove it he was rude about it and yelled "NEXT" even though i didnt get my receipt. I asked for my receipt and he told me to "wait"; so why did he yell "NEXT"? This was register: 4 transaction: 3667 Assoc: 2463034. 11/22/25

The 30-day return policy is misleading and pointless.

I tried to return an item after just 16 days, well within their advertised 30-day return window.

Instead of honoring their own policy, the store manager argued with me and even asked, “What were you doing until 16 days?”
Honestly, that’s none of your business. Customers don’t owe an explanation for using the return policy you advertise.

She then insisted they can’t accept the return because the product was opened and used. How exactly is a customer supposed to know whether a product works without opening it? That logic makes no sense.

If the store refuses returns on opened items, then the “30-day return policy” is nothing but false advertising. Don’t promote a policy you have no intention of honoring.

After unnecessary back-and-forth, they finally agreed to take it—but only as store credit instead of a refund. Completely unacceptable experience and very poor customer service.

leads.address: Amador Plaza Rd, Dublin, CA 94568, USA

leads.business_name: Four Seasons Hotel London at Park Lane
leads.address: Hamilton Pl, Park Ln, London W1J 7DR, UK

leads.worst_review_text: Used the self service to buy paracetamol and because I had to get staff approval, I looked around for help. A small thing which has never been a problem but on this occasion I was continuously ignored. Even though staff members had clocked me, and were standing in groups of threes and fours talking to each other, they looked away to talk or do something else rather than come over to me. And this went on for ages! I called out, waved and one staff member raised their hand and looked like they were going to come but then changed their mind. Finally someone did come over, but he turned out to be so condescending in how he spoke to me, it left me wondering if the Boots staff, at this branch, had been trained in ignorance, racism, sexism and ageist techniques rather than effective customer service!

We booked four rooms nearly a year in advance to accommodate our family for our wedding in Zurich. During the booking call, we clearly insisted that all rooms should be located on the same floor — a request that was confirmed by the manager.

Upon arrival, we discovered that the rooms were spread across several floors, without any prior notice. Some of our guests were minors, which made this separation even more problematic.

It then took almost an hour at reception before anyone provided an answer — with no real solution or follow-up. Despite several email exchanges, no apology was offered and no commercial gesture was made, even though we had breakfast at the property on Saturday morning.

The manager merely stated that the rates were “competitive for Zurich in high season,” even though the issue had nothing to do with price, but with poor organization and lack of communication during the booking process.

In summary: decent rooms (but without private wc 1 room out 4!) , but very disappointing customer service, a total lack of empathy, and no consideration for a reservation made a year in advance.
I truly do not recommend this place, especially for groups or families. Very disappointed by the service and the lack of professionalism.

We stayed at this Ibis before and it was good, I have no idea what happened.
Upon arrival, we were assigned a room where there was lots of hair in the shower drain which caused it to clog, so we requested a room change.
During our 3 night stay, there was no cleaning service, no towel replacement, no toilet paper refill.
When we asked about this, we were told the hotel is part of a program where the money is donated to a cause. While I can understand and appreciate this initiative, guests should be clearly informed in advance and allowed to make their own choice.
leads.ai_response_draft: Adina, I'm genuinely sorry your return stay fell so short of what you experienced before - finding hair in the shower drain and going three nights without basic housekeeping is completely unacceptable. You're absolutely right that our sustainability program should be clearly explained upfront so you can choose whether to participate, rather than discovering it when asking for fresh towels and toilet paper. I'm personally reviewing our check-in process and room preparation standards to ensure this doesn't happen to other guests. - ibis Wien Mariahilf

leads.worst_review_text:
Honestly, quite disappointing.
The breakfast costs 22 euros, yet the coffee is surprisingly low quality. We came for a conference, and they even applied a higher rate. The rooms are below average, and not even a bottle of water is provided daily.

I paid 310 euro for 2 nights, without breakfast, which is an insane price for a hotel in Hamburg which is not in the city center but in an industrial area. Breakfast costs 20 euro extra per person. The hotel did not specify in the booking.com that the sauna IS NOT included but need to pay 10 euro per person entry.

I had to check out one day early because the room was extremely very hot and stuffed despite the temperature outside around 9 centigrade. There was no air ventilation and opening the window did not help. This is unacceptable for health reason. The provided fan in the room did not really help. I could not sleep AT ALL in this old hotel.

The male receptionist (a middle eastern descent who speaks German) was also very rude. There is no concept of hospitality to him. I had a friend guest wanted to visit me for a drink in my room and he purposely forbid him from even entering the elevator and the room. And he allowed him only to stay in the lobby area and talk. Is this Germany or somewhere else primitive? I paid my room for two guests and in the end my friend had to fill in his identification detail. This is very freak and ridiculous service I ever encountered in Europe.

For a good and pleasant sleep and stay, please avoid this hotel. There are plenty of much better hotels with more civilized hospitality in the city center.

The hotel has a truly stunning panoramic view of the city, and the room gets plenty of natural light. Unfortunately, everything else made the stay quite unpleasant. The bed was extremely uncomfortable. I couldn’t sleep properly and kept waking up multiple times throughout the night. The pillows and blankets are very low quality, and one of our blanket covers even had a huge hole in it. The room also wasn’t very clean, especially the bathroom, and we even found items left by previous guests under the bed, which is simply unacceptable. The service is also practically non-existent. If you need anything, you have to go to the reception yourself.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The torn blanket cover and items under the bed - that's completely unacceptable. We're replacing those mattresses and retraining housekeeping this month. Reach out directly and we'll comp your next stay.

- IntercityHotel Hamburg Dammtor-Messe

leads.worst_review_text:
Although the rooms are visually appealing, the beds are rock hard and there’s no air conditioning. Also, the windows cannot be opened in the room to cool it down.
It was a sleepless night for me, with a feeling of panic and not getting enough air. I called the receptionist and was informed that there unfortunately weren’t any options and that all rooms were the same. Therefore, this hotel cannot be recommended.

Stayed here during Oktoberfest - there is a bus 2 min away that takes you to Oktoberfest. 15 minute walk to the nearest train station - there are about 3 nearby. Not too long to get into the city by train.

The room itself was overall terrible. Space was decent but no basic in-room amenities including fridge, kettle or tissue box. The beds were 2 king single beds pushed together and pillows were terrible - I woke up with a sore neck as a result. The worst part of the room was the bathroom. This was room 110 - stay clear of this room unless they renovate the bathroom. Anyone who has stayed in this room would understand. As mentioned in a previous review with photos of the same bathroom, the bathroom is extremely outdated. Feels like a bathroom that belongs in a nursing home/aged care facility. There was also a very musky sewerage smell that was wreaking from the bathroom - basically smelt like urine especially if the door is kept closed.

To top off this terrible experience, there is no sort of ventilation in room 110 - no fan and no air conditioning. As a result, we needed to leave the window open for air flow. This proved to be a very bad idea. We quickly found out that room 110 is directly above the entrance of this hotel. This meant that we were constantly smelling the waft of cigarette smoke and can hear every single conversation that was being had downstairs. This room was extremely noisy and should be decommissioned until the bathroom is renovated and air conditioning is installed.

We walked past some other rooms that were directly opposite ours and they looked totally different - renovated, refreshed and welcoming. Unlike our outdated and uncomfortable room that made you feel like you were living in an aged care facility.

Housekeeping need to learn what the Do Not Disturb sign means.  We put a Do Not Disturb sign on the door today.  Housekeeping waited for us to leave the room for the day, and then went into the room whilst we were out so they could "clean".  When we got back everything was rearranged but it didn't seem like it was any cleaner than how we left it.

We stayed at the Boutique Hotel Atrium while visiting Munich for the Christmas markets. While we appreciated the ambiance of the lobby and the location, the WiFi was very spotty and the fact that the 6th floor doesn’t reasonably allow an adult to stand up on one half of the room felt like an unacceptable room to provide or pay full price for.

We asked to change rooms on our first night and were told that there were none available and we should have checked in earlier or told them how tall we were in advance (5’11” and 6’3”). I feel that this should have been disclosed to us upon booking and we also stored our bags starting at ~11am so they had already seen us much earlier in the day to plan accordingly. Noting that the elevator also only goes to the 5th floor (so you must walk up a flight of stairs with your luggage to get to 6) and that the hotel also only provides air conditioning in the summer; with heat rising it was very warm on the 6th floor — I recommend if you stay here doing anything you can to not stay on the 6th floor.

On December 22nd between 8:00–10:00 PM, I had a very frustrating experience with the front desk regarding a simple request for a kettle.

After calling to ask for one, I was told someone would come to my room to check. I waited 30–40 minutes, then called again and was told the staff had already come and knocked, but I was in my room the entire time and did not hear any knock. I then asked if they could come again and was told it would take about 30 minutes. To avoid any misunderstanding, I opened the door and sat next to it for 50 more minutes, still no one came. I called the front desk again; the phone was answered and immediately hung up without allowing me to speak. So I went downstairs in person and was told there was no kettle and I should wait until the next day. I explained that I had already waited nearly two hours after being told someone would come. Only then did the front desk go find a kettle for me.

What makes this experience unacceptable is that a kettle clearly was available, yet the front desk just didn't wanna solve problem for me. Throughout the entire process, there was no apology, and the staff’s attitude was unprofessional, impolite, and disrespectful (I have recordings). I am not asking for special service, but basic honesty and professionalism. If kettles are not provided, guests should be told directly instead of being made to wait for hours.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That's completely unacceptable - making you wait two hours for something we had available is terrible service. I'll be addressing this directly with the front desk team tomorrow because that's not how we treat our guests.

- H2 Hotel Berlin-Alexanderplatz

leads.worst_review_text:
Here is my experience, hope it helps you:

Went in unaware of what a "branded" title is, which is another name for a salvage title. Check the interest rates they give you if financing with them, and if financing independent from the dealership ensure that you can get a loan for a branded title vehicle. Some insurance companies and banks/credit unions will not support you for a branded title.

The "free delivery" on the website is only if you are located very far away, I made a 2 hour trip to the dealership and when asked about getting the car shipped they said I didn't live far enough away. So it is free shipping, at their discretion.

Was given a hard time when I asked them to remove bad tint from moisture problems, but eventually they did. Within 24 hours of getting the car, I found out why there were moisture problems; it rained and I had a leak in the rear roof from the taillight above the rear window not being installed  properly. I took it in to get fixed, only to find instead.of installing the light properly they pushed it into place (cracking the light) and used some caulk or putty to seal it. Guess they couldn't fix it the right way. Bumper also wasnt fitted correctly.  I gave up on trying to get help from them since I had to drive 2 hours each way and would need a rental vehicle while they spend an undisclosed amount of time "fixing" each issue that popped up. Not even an offer for a loaner vehicle after needing to take it back after already making multiple trips. They felt helpful in the beginning but it became clear they sold me a problem car and would only band aid issues as I mentioned them, I dont know why they couldn't have checked the car for quality prior to sale. I guess the less they have to fix upfront, the easier it is for them.

Its been a couple of months since then, took it to a reputable shop and got most of the problems addressed, including some other minor (but irritable) problems that were found. Overall, the car is fine. Probably wouldn't recommend anyone go here unless you like to gamble! Do your research,  ask questions, and don't buy the same day you look is my advice. Three stars seems fair to me since the Branded Title situation felt sketchy and overall they didnt feel transparent with the condition of the car and providing band aid fixes instead of proper fixes for issues such as the water leak from the poorly installed, and then broken, tail light. Some cars may be in better condition than others and you wouldn't have the same experience as me, just be diligent! If you buy from here I hope it goes smoother than my experience.  First dealership I've bought from that left a bad taste in my mouth.

leads.worst_review_text: Contact lenses wearers be very weary. I was very excited to get new glasses and contacts at a convenient downtown location was very disappointed in the customer service I received. The doctor was excellent and after a very thorough exam, my contact prescription for both eyes was downgraded significantly. When I went to order new contacts from the front desk they did not have them in stock due to my strong prescription and I received a wait time of 3-5 days, which is totally reasonable. I let them know I only have contacts in the wrong prescription and have a new glasses appointment scheduled there for later in the week. Most people know wearing the wrong contact prescription can cause strain on your eyes and severe headaches which I was experiencing. I reached out again hoping I could receive a trial pack of contacts in my correct prescription even if I had to pay extra so that I would not have to deal with intense headaches and eye strain during the work week. Front desk assured me this was not possible and there was nothing they could do for me. Despite my pleas to contact the doctor, I was never allowed to. No other attempts were made to accommodate me. Unfortunately, apathy seems to be the standard now for medical care in the city. I would look elsewhere like Dr. Arick and his caring team at Visualeyes very close by.

leads.worst_review_text:
BUYER BEWARE - SCAM LIKELY

We found a beautiful low mileage Mazda CX-7 that was listed for sale at PDX Motors in December of '24 and went to go check it out.

First impressions were good. We did not have an appointment, but Jared grabbed the keys and was able to let us test drive the vehicle while he was waiting for an appointment to show. We ended up liking the vehicle enough to move forward with the purchase, which Jared was able to help with. He even mentioned their extended warranty to cover any issues or repairs that the car may need, which we also added at the time of purchase. This interaction was cordial and friendly, we left happy and had a new vehicle.

Unfortunately, these are the last good things I can say about this dealership.

Immediately after purchase, the vehicle threw a check engine light for a faulty thermostat that needed to be replaced. We took the vehicle to a Mazda Dealership as directed by our "warranty", only to find that the thermostat repair would not be covered by this program, nor would they cover any of the other service items that the vehicle needed as recommended by the inspection. This caused an additional out of pocket expense that we were not expecting based on the sale of our extended warranty coverage. For an additional $3,000 on top of the purchase price of the vehicle, the expectation was set that repairs would be heavily discounted or paid entirely by this program.

After this experience and paying for the repairs out of pocket, we went to attempt to cancel this warranty. This is a process that can only be initiated by the dealer, so we needed to reach out to PDX Motors directly. We contacted PDX Motors to cancel this warranty in writing on 4/9/25. PDX Motors sent the refund for this warranty to our lender on 5/30/25. From the time that the warranty was originally requested to be canceled to the time the refund was issued took nearly 2 months, and countless calls and emails that went unanswered. Had I not have continuously followed up, we may still be waiting. When speaking with the warranty company, they confirmed cancelation on 4/25/25 and confirmed that they issue payment within 5 business days.

Lastly, while waiting for this warranty refund to be issued, the vehicle caught fire during a road trip while stopping for gas. The car burned completely to the ground without warning and was a total loss through insurance. While I don't necessarily blame PDX Motors for this, it certainly doesn't inspire buying confidence when coupled with check engine lights and other hidden repairs being needed.

If you are going to purchase a vehicle from these people, make sure you get an independent inspection. I went against my better judgement, skipped one with this vehicle, and quite literally got burned.

leads.worst_review_text: Bought a Honda Fit from Santos. So far I am happy with the car I bought. I'm leaving a 2 star review for two reasons. First off, I originally came to look at the Honda Fit that I ended up purchasing. However, Santos suggested another Honda Fit. He was trying to entice me with the paint-job and interior. He didn't suggest a test drive for this one. Red Flag. When I took it for a test drive, it had obvious mechanical issues and it didn't have working AC. ALSO, when we were test driving, he didn't tell me to go on the freeway. On the test drive for the other Fit, he insisted on going on the freeway, but he didn't with this one. And as soon as we hit the freeway, you immediately noticed the mechanical issues. HUGE red flag. It was also a year older than the Fit I was originally looking at, and it had more milage. On top of all of that, it had paint damage, cloudy lights, and very bad rusting under the hood. despite all of these things, BOTH Honda Fits were the same price. I told Santos that I didn't like that he even suggested a car to me that had machanical issues. Santos told me that they 'have a lot of cars on the lot' and said something along the lines of 'he doesn't know every issue with every car'. Okay, but you're suppose to? If you sell me a car, you're supposed to know everything that's wrong with it. Second, after I bought the Fit I ended up going with, the trunk wouldn't open because the lock was broken. They told me to come back and they would fix it for free. I told them to put it in writing and they did. That part was more acceptable. This dealership has better ratings than others in the area, but frankly if you're a buyer and you're reading this, ALL used car lots I've ever dealt with are semi-sketchy, unfortunately. It wasn't really SURPRISING that as a woman who went to a car dealership alone, they would suggest a car that clearly has mechanical issues, expecting me to not test drive it or inspect it at all. If you’re buying a car from these people, you need to fully inspect the car and take it for a long test drive!!!! EVERY USED CAR LOT HAS GOOD AND BAD CARS, AND EVERY USED CAR LOT WILL TAKE ADVANTAGE OF YOU IF THEY THINK THEY CAN!
