leads.worst_review_text:
I want to begin by sharing that Dr. Shah was excellent. She is thorough, professional, has great energy, and explains everything clearly during the exam. I’ve seen her several times and have even referred friends because of the quality of her care.

However, my experience during the glasses checkout portion of the visit was disappointing. I’m used to being walked through my insurance benefits, pricing, add-ons, and what is or isn’t covered. Instead, I was immediately asked to pay my copay, and I had to clarify that I was also getting glasses.

The staff member assisting me wasn’t rude, but she felt checked out and made several assumptions, as if I should already know the process. I gave her polite feedback, and while she was initially defensive, she ultimately listened and apologized. She explained she assumed I knew everything since I’d been there before. I shared that I only come once a year at most, and I still expect to be guided through the standard steps—especially because insurance benefits and pricing change frequently. The interaction ended respectfully.

Unfortunately, as I was leaving, one of the receptionists gave me clear attitude when I said goodbye, signaling she was displeased that I had offered feedback to her coworker. It was uncomfortable and unprofessional. I stepped outside, sat in my car, and debated whether I should let it go or report the behavior. I decided to go back in. As I re-entered, the same receptionist walked out and again gave me attitude, which led me to feel even more frustration. The situation felt unnecessary and unprofessional.

I then asked for contact information for the doctor to formally share my experience, but the staff did not have a clear method for connecting with her. At that moment, the original staff member I had spoken with told me she had actually forgotten to take my measurements, so I needed to sit back down to complete a step that should have been done earlier.

Overall, the exam with Dr. Shah was wonderful, but the checkout and front-desk experience left me feeling uncomfortable and dismissed. I’m sharing this in hopes that it can be addressed so future visits reflect the same professionalism and care that Dr. Shah provides.

leads.worst_review_text: We been Henna Chevrolet customers for over 6 years we haven't had any problems with the sales department, but the service department it's a joke, the service advisor Randy Eschoener doesn't know how to communicate with his customers, I dropped off my vehicle in a Friday and they said it may take 3-4 days to get a diagnosed of my vehicle, it was Wednesday of the next week and I had not heard from him, so I called he said that my vehicle was getting diagnosed next thing in the morning, so I called Thursday afternoon and Randy was with other customer so I left a message but he never called me back, I contacted him about 10 times 4 out of those 10 left a message or a voicemail and he never called me back, the lack of communication with him was just wrong I need it my vehicle I was aware of the 3-4 days for a diagnosis but it was already a week and no diagnosis, finally on the 8th business day my vehicle got diagnosed we find out because we receive a text message with the problems of the vehicle not because Randy called to notify us. I have visit Henna Service many many times and their staff it's always super attentive and friendly but Randy had other things on his mind or he just doesn't care about his customers, I even try to get a rental car and he just keep saying your vehicle will be ready next day so I couldn't get a rental, I was without a car for 2 weeks, the last day I got tired of his lies and like he said that my car was going to be ready by the end of the day I went to the dealership and waited there until the end of the day for my vehicle, I was literally the last customer, they had their lights off and everything ready to closed and Randy couldn't wait with me for my vehicle he left another service advisor with my car, all of the staff was super friendly and they are always super attentive and they care about their customers but for some reason Randy it's not part of that staff. I would recommend Henna Chevrolet but not the service you will receive from Randy.

leads.worst_review_text: We’ve always had positive experiences at CarMax until this visit. We were a walk in without an appointment (same as all our other visits). leads.worst_review_text:
I’d like to thank and 100% recommend working with Robert Tenny at Toyota of North Austin.

I had been to umpteen dealerships, dealing with a lot of people, researching a variety of different types of Toyotas. I had come in exhausted after avoiding a lemon at another dealership. I had a fairly narrow budget and specific interest type for a car (Camry, post 2014, ~15k). Robert worked fast and intently with me to find me the perfect fit — cars that weren’t even on the lot/website full yet. He worked with my budget perfectly. Completely kind, patient, and amicable throughout. The whole process was efficient but not rushed. He taught me about hybrids. He messaged me cars that fit my bill as they came in and offered many ideas.

I am so thrilled with my new car, that we ultimately matched me with, that it’s made me grateful that I’ve had to get a new one!

Thank you again Robo!!
leads.ai_response_draft:
Robert really went above and beyond for you - he's great at finding the right match even when the car isn't on the lot yet. Glad the Camry worked out perfectly.

- Toyota of North Austin

leads.address: 6200 S I-35 Frontage Rd, Austin, TX 78745, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Purchased a new truck in mid-July. Before leaving the lot, I noticed a cosmetic defect and pointed it out to both the salesperson and their manager. They asked me to bring the truck back another day since it was late — which I agreed to.

Since then, I’ve been in contact with the salesperson, manager, and a service advisor, but I’ve received nothing but the runaround. It’s now late September and I’m still “waiting” for approval on a supposed General Motors claim.

The service advisor insists it isn’t a defect, but I have video (taken by the salesperson before I arrived) clearly showing the bumper was not clipped on correctly. They want me to pay labor just to realign the clips — or pay for a new bumper if needed — because the general manager allegedly doesn’t want to cover the cost.

I’ve repeatedly called and texted the service advisor on the personal number he provided me, but I get no response. At this point, I will not be servicing my vehicle here and cannot recommend this dealership.

leads.worst_review_text: Today I walked in to this coffee shop. This would have been my third time here. The first couple times it was a pleasant experience the service was good, the food and coffee were great too. Unfortunately I walked in today and was greeted with a disgusted face from the atendee. As I walk up to the counter I greet the guy sitting there and tell him "Hey how's it going?" And I don't get any response back. I already knew something was off as I had already identified his disgusted "I don't feel like working today face." He didn't ask me to take my order or what I needed. He just stood there and waited for me to place my order, I pause and I tell him, "you know what, I'll come back later." He just nods and I go about my way. Very poor customer service by this guy. I get it, it was a Monday and he may not had wanted to be there but I'd rather take my money where it serves better. I hope you guys have a better experience than mine.

Phenomenal place! Don't have to worry about parking if its slower since they have a small parkinglot next to the building, which was already a treat. Then when we got in, the people were extremely nice and quick with their service!
I ordered the Queso & Chips & Salsa, and was baffled by how much queso they gave when most places would give you only half that amount. And it was so good! My sister and I kept joking how we should stop eating it so we had room for our entrees but just couldn't put down the chips.
Then for the entrees, she got the croissantwich, which with the jam was so freaking good. I got the voodoo burger (which I included a picture of) which was so mouth wateringly good. It wasnt too spicy and just had a small kick due to the spices.
After the meal, my sister and I absolutely agreed to go back since everything was awesome.

leads.worst_review_text:
Great environment and employees. But, I have a question about their sandwiches.... Please explain to me how a sandwich that my child can make better is almost $10 dollars.  I'm sorry, whose making these prices?

It had one slice of cheese, like three slices meat with mustard and mayo lol.

I recently came here for my first time for a client meeting on a Sunday morning. It was early enough where parking wasn’t a problem. There were plenty of tables and seating areas to pick from. The right side is mostly the seating areas for drinks and the left side is mostly for the food truck seating. You can walk up to the bar and it is nice and air conditioned. There are seating areas in the air conditioned as well. There are so many drink options to choose from. It is both a bar and a coffee shop in one. The cashier was very friendly and let me know my order would be called when ready. Once I got my coffee I found a picnic table with shade and enjoyed the waterfall sound next their fish pond. It is was the perfect spot for my meeting. Price is fair and I will definitely be returning. I do believe there is a parking problem for the later crowds and people were waiting for my parking as I left.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That fish pond spot is perfect for meetings - glad you found it. Early Sunday timing was smart with the parking situation.

leads.worst_review_text: I'd like to give 0 stars, but unfortunately that's not possible. First - even though I had said several times during the consultation that I needed computer glasses - they made me reading glasses. Well, eaten, it can happen. So I went again. Mr. Fromberger - I think that's the boss's name - measured my eyes again and gave me computer glasses. Unfortunately, I could see the screen at work worse with the new computer glasses than with my 13-year-old glasses from before. And that for around 560 Swiss francs. Unbelievable. So I went again (for the 5th time in total, I don't know... or something???), because it can't be true that the new (explicit) computer glasses are worse than my 13-year-old long-sightedness glasses. The boss - I think his name is Mr. Fromberger - had no desire at all to make me glasses that fit. He came straight to me with the reimbursement form and was rather rude to me at first. After a few minutes of consideration—I've actually been wanting to finally get a pair of glasses that fit for almost six weeks and five or six visits to the office—I got the refund form because I didn't want to put up with the boss's rude attitude. Once and never again. A wide berth from this sleazy shop and its arrogant boss.

Just had one of the most uncomfortable shopping experiences I have ever had in an eyewear store. Upon entering, I was immediately approached in an overly intrusive manner, without the chance to look around or get a sense of the selection. I came in simply to browse, as I have been searching for suitable glasses for quite some time, but instead of being given space, I felt followed and pressured. The staff member continued to stay close to me throughout, which made it impossible to look at the frames comfortably or make my own decisions.

It is not enough to create a visually appealing brand presence in the city or to collaborate with events like Art Basel to appear relevant. The world is changing, and I believe that eyewear stores like this should adapt as well.

I went there for a normal check, and I also asked them to have a quick look why my car made a strange noise.

They did the check and told me the noise was a bigger problem that would cost me around 4000 CHF to fix. The garage man told me I should think about it, and decide if I want it fixed or not.

Since it was such a high cost I went to another official garage to ask a 2nd opinion.
This other garage found the exact issue in 5 minutes (a broken bearing), fixed it in an hour, and charged me 500 CHF.
They also told me that it was good that I came to fix this, since it could've broken (potentially resulting in a wheel breaking off) if I drove long distances (which I often do).
❗AMAG KLEINBASEL DIDN'T WARN ME ABOUT THIS, BASICALLY ENDANGERED ME❗

1000km later I say for sure that the other garage fixed the problem.

To me it is clear that AMAG Kleinbasel was trying to rip me off, and that they didn't warn me of potential danger.

I have good experience with AMAG, however, not with this one.

The services are good.
If you need to book an appointment you have to do it one month in advance at least!
I am working with them since 2019. Since then for every scheduled service the price doubles or triples exponentially for a small category car. They should revise pricing

leads.worst_review_text:
ATTENTION!!!
I purchased a new Audi S6 Avant e-tron (2025) from the authorized dealer Porsche Graz-Kärntnerstraße. Immediately after delivery, serious defects appeared – in particular, the repeated error message "High-voltage electrical system: malfunction," which prevents the vehicle from starting and the charging ports from opening, as well as the sudden failure of the left digital exterior mirror while driving.
These defects pose an acute risk to the health and life of the vehicle's occupants. If the digital mirror suddenly fails while driving, safe maneuvering or reacting to traffic is impossible. The risk of an accident is real.
Despite several visits to authorized Audi workshops, the defects persist. Furthermore, the service employees cannot specify exactly which problems the planned software updates are actually intended to resolve, which gives the impression of a trial-and-error approach.
This approach is unacceptable to me as a customer. With a new vehicle, you expect a functioning and safe product – not an immature experiment.
I am seriously considering withdrawing from the purchase agreement, but have initially granted a reasonable period of grace. As a customer-friendly solution, I prefer a buyback from Audi AG or, in the worst case, a replacement vehicle without defects.
Unfortunately, I cannot currently recommend Audi or this dealer. It seems that immature vehicles are deliberately sold – with all the consequences for the end customer.
My trust in Audi is currently zero. When switching from another premium brand with three letters, I had significantly higher expectations. Instead of a premium experience, I experienced a rude collision with reality.
If anyone is interested in video recordings of the documented defects (also in connection with media publication), I would be happy to provide them upon request.

An appointment was scheduled for a repair and to address other issues. The car was dropped off at 8:00 AM, and a loaner vehicle was provided. At 1:00 PM, I was contacted and told the car was ready. When I picked it up, they didn't explain what had been done. Only after I inquired did I discover that the technician hadn't been there, nothing had been done, and they simply wanted the loaner car back. They told me to schedule another appointment. This wasted time is unacceptable; customers shouldn't be treated so half-heartedly.

leads.business_name: motioncars gmbh Ihr Gebrauchtwagen Spezialist in Graz Umgebung mit KFZ Fachwerkstätte
leads.worst_review_text:
Careful, update 1. Below.

I had the pleasure of dealing with Fabian from KFZ Hödl, first of all, communication was possible in English and Fabian was extremely understanding of all questions and supported through the process. Extremely professional staff, product portfolio on a high level. Overall highly recommend and will definitely come back in the future 😊!

Update 1. I have had issues with the chain tensioners on the car, this was noticed during the inspection. I sent the car to a professional workshop for diagnosis, they have provided a cost estimate and now I am waiting for nearly 3 weeks for a response from KFZ Hödl. Let’s see.

I bought a car there with 8-point winter tires that were completely worn out, even though summer and winter tires had been specified. Additionally, the service was terrible. During the warranty period, I had to make sure he didn't charge me anything extra. Nevertheless, he tried to rip me off at every opportunity.
Don't buy a car there! Scammers!!!

Sadly terrible customer experinece.
I called two days ago in the morning and asked for a price of service for my Mazda after I have provided VIN code. Lady was really polite and said her colleguae will call me in 1-2h. Noone called. I called again at afternoon, and another lady told me someone will call me tomorrow and tell me price. Noone called.
I called again yesterday, and they told me someone will call me back soon and tell me price. Guess what.. Noone called! Too bad..

Unfortunately really bad costumer service. Sales Agent seem bored and rude. Tried to get some information. First sales agent said he would be with me, he just needs to print something... 15minutes Kater he was still playing around on his laptop. Second sales agent I approached was more knowledgeable, but still had bad manners. This place could really use some basic training for their employees. Sad, otherwise it’s a good dealership, but I would like to treated with respect when I go somewhere to buy a car.

This one was one of the worst food we had. A group of 6 people today… at 17:00 out of beef on a Saturday. Our food did not taste like Thai food. I asked gut spiced fresh chilly and they don’t have fresh chilly. So how can you cook Thai food and don’t have chilly. Service was bad as well… going tithe bathroom and looking in the kitchen said it all.

Dining above Graz' rooftops!
Whenever I have visitors in Graz, I guide them here. The restaurant is located in the very heart of the old town of Graz with a perfect view of the castle hill as well as the marvelous city hall.
I've been here several times for breakfast, which has been on point every single time. There is sth. on the menu for every taste:  whether you want pancakes, poached eggs, muesli, French toast or other culinary combinations. Besides the great taste and truly good pricing, I love that they use fresh and mainly regional products.
Also very recommendable is the coffee - and I say that as a coffee lover. But if you are more in the mood for champagne or a "Spritz" - I'm sure you'll find some tasty options too.
Hot tip: if you would like to visit this place on the weekend, make a reservation well ahead of time, especially if you would like to sit on the beautiful terrace.
Last but not least I enjoy it very much that the service treats every customer like a queen/king. I emphasize this because not only the "normal people" meet at Freiblick, but also the "Upper classes". You just feel comfortable and welcome here, no matter what you look like.
In conclusion: a visit here is a big fat recommendation!
leads.ai_response_draft:
The castle hill view really is something special from up there. Glad we're your go-to spot for showing off Graz.

- Freiblick Tagescafé

leads.worst_review_text:
I arrived this morning with two small children to grab some coffee and breakfast. I ordered two coffees and two cinnamon rolls, expecting something soft and fresh like the cinnamon rolls I usually get in my country or other places I visit as a tourist.

I saw one cinnamon roll on the counter with other cakes, so I assumed we would receive the order right away. No one informed me that I would have to wait 15 minutes for the roll, or that it wasn’t freshly baked but frozen. When it finally arrived, the kids were excited—it looked nice with frosting and some fruit on top. But the moment we took the first bite, we realized it was hard as a rock and very dry—impossible to cut with a fork.

To me, it felt like a three-day-old pastry that had just been reheated and topped with fresh frosting. I wanted to say something right away, but there was a long queue at the bar. I didn’t want my kids to eat it, but they were too hungry so they ate half of each. When I eventually spoke to the staff, they told me the roll wasn’t old—it had been baked, frozen, and possibly overheated. They offered another cake as compensation, but we didn’t have time and didn’t want anything else to eat after that so we left.
Since we paid 17 euros for two coffees and two cinnamon rolls, I felt I had to share this experience for future customers. And to the manager and staff: I’m not here to teach you how to handle these situations, but the least you could’ve done was cancel the order and offer a refund.

Also, let’s be honest: a reheated cinnamon roll can never compare to a freshly baked one. I wonder—have you ever actually tried the cinnamon roll you’re selling for 4.5 euros? If you want to serve it this way, maybe consider half-baking it and finishing it fresh for each order. But most importantly, customers should be informed that it’s not fresh and that it requires time to be reheated.

leads.address: Europark, Europark Salzburg, Europastraße 1, 5020 Salzburg, Austria
leads.worst_review_text: Incompetent. Waited 12 days for glasses due in 5 days. I said they were wrong they insisted they were OK. When home found one lens coated the other not!. When returning a rude man said I need checking again and changed the values. Promised delivery in one week took 14 days. Neither eye correct vision. Gave up and took my money back...

The worst optician in the city experience! Very rude and full of disrespectful ego. The female staff member was okay, but the male staff the man with glasses was absolutely disgusting—rude, unprofessional, and completely lacking basic manners. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

The short description of this experience is that this place has really nice vibes, and is good for a coffee, not much more.
The ambience is quite cosy and well curated, but as a place that offers brunch, the tables were too small to accommodate the dishes used. Normally one would put together another table for 3 people having brunch, but since the tables are bolted, it's not the best way to have a meal all together.
I'm from Italy and when asking if the panino with prosciutto was with a prosciutto like jamon serrano, the reply from the waitress was that it was raw bacon. Not the best wat to explain it.
The waitress also sat down at our table at a certain point while taking our order and that was a new thing...
We ordered the ham and cheese panino, the dolce vita breakfast, the Sacher, and the tiramisu.

The tiramisu was too sweet and heavy, the cream was supposed to be more fluffy than what was presented. I also think the fridge it was kept in altered the smell of the tiramisu so it was not the best.
The dolce vita meal had a butter Croissant, butter, jam, a chocolate cake with cream and some fruit. The fruit was in a big shot glass and was not a lot and didn't feel super fresh. The single croissant was nice with some added jam but I ended up ordering some bread for the butter and jam as that made more sense.

The Sacher cake was good but a bit dry and the mam and cheese toast  was warm but the cheese didn't get the time to melt as the slices were still seperate in the cross section of the toast.
In conclusion, I feel that a lot of things can be done to make the experience better, I hope there will be more improvements.

We were planning to order, but ended up leaving due to the service. The barista was not friendly and made comments such as “I do not care” and “oh my God,” along with visibly unhappy facial expressions toward guests. He even commented on one of the guests using the toilet that it is not for public use. All these made us feel unwelcome. Because of this experience, we didn’t stay to try the coffee and are honestly not sure how this place has such a high rating, as service is a key part of a café experience.

We searched for the best hot chocolate in town, we were expecting a luscious , decadent , rich hot chocolate .. the reality was hot milk with cocoa powder , I am absolutely certain my 7 years old daughter with her eyes closed can cook something much better than what we got .  On the other hand the Mozart cake was very good . The staff doesn’t speak good English and there are no lactose intolerant product , on their menu there was an almond milk listing , I asked for a hot chocolate made with that milk, the answer was no.
I would recommend going somewhere else .
leads.ai_response_draft:
Our hot chocolate didn't meet your expectations - that's fair feedback. The almond milk thing is confusing since it's on our menu, I'll check what happened there.

- Café Tomaselli

leads.worst_review_text: Looks like the employees here just take one look at you and decide if you can afford a certain brand of Spectacle or no. All my husband asked was how much are those spectacles on the other side of the shop, and the shopkeeper says and i quote “oh that will be too expensive for you”. And all the extra scrutiny only on us when we are going through the products even though there were other customers in the shop. Why? Looks like the employees here prefer catering only to Europeans. News flash - the products you told would be too expensive for us, we can very well afford it and more. Just because some people like to live frugally does not mean they are not well off in life.

leads.worst_review_text:
I am Auto dealer myself from Tirana and the way they treated is UNPROFESSIONAL, first they gave us wrong iban infos and we waited in hotel at dresden 3 days more to remake the payment and they didn't even said sorry,second most important it's been over 40days after the purchase and they are not resending the tax free 19% back to us(the car was outside EU the next day by Herceg Novi boarder with automatic scan)
We try to contact and they always find excuses, no email responds no phone repsonded. This Is a shame and a damage for us cause they keep out money without reasons(they promised 10 days maximum after EU check out)
This was the worst auto dealer I could possibly find.

Anyone wanting to buy a car here should ideally be there yesterday! Unfortunately, we don't live right around the corner and couldn't drive there right away due to family reasons. I sent a WhatsApp message, but no response.
On Monday, I called them and made an appointment for Friday. We would have loved to have the car.
But the day before, I suddenly got a call saying the car had been sold!!! The super nice gentleman's response was: "We don't reserve cars!" So why does this dealership make appointments with people if it's just going to be sold? I find this simply cheeky. During our first phone call, the gentleman could have pointed out that they had other interested parties and that they couldn't promise us it would still be there by Friday!!! One star is still too many.
Just 7 days after a maintenance at Sachsengarage, I had a car breakdown. Ford Assistance service is not good, I should have been a member of ADAC, they react faster.

I did have a contact with seller last week that agree to sell with me this blue Golf 7r 2019 62'500km 27'995€ but Mr. M. R. refuse it. At the beginning they say that it was because of the distance with the risk on the road for coming back to France. Then I explain that AM Importation company will cover the car by the return with their Full VO guarantee option in case the engine has an issue. Other risks are covered by my private insurance. And finally they say that it is because I'm French and they only sell to company.
I spend close to two weeks trying to buy this car without any negociation on the price but Mr M.R. refuse it at all cost. The boss from AM Importation, Moritz Wiedemanntry tried to convenience him with his big experience and knowing me now since 5 years as customer but nothing move. We, Moritz and I were very surprise about this kind of attitude.
I buy every year cars without any issue like this with big companies.
If it was really an issue to sell to French person why big company like Tiemeyer gruppe is currently selling a RSQ3 tomorrow to my friend Hervé Henrioux ? I don't think that Mr M.R. represent correctly the brand by his attitude and by his decision.

They are nice people but they never told me that the car I was buying was rebuilt. I even asked if there was anything I needed to know about the car and they told me no. I've had it only 2 weeks and already had to put money in it.

not on the spot: the establishment employs people with disabilities, and it’s noticeable. They essentially don’t provide service in English, and the food is average. The carpaccio is tasteless, sticky, and comes with a pathetic imitation of truffle.

Something good: descent strudels and interior

Stopped in for lunch on a nice fall day. The restaurant has a nice outdoor section, as well indoor seating.

I had the Original Wiener Schnitzel served with potatoes, a salad, and a cranberry mix. The veal schnitzel was tender and crispy. Every bite was enjoyable.

The service was outstanding. Very welcoming.
leads.ai_response_draft:

leads.worst_review_text:
Cold inside.
No adequate toilet. In a cold season?? Making visiting a toilet uncomfortable for 99% of your clients?..
Not possible to order drinks using a QR-code.

A tasty filtered coffee and a cheesecake.

Only vegetarian breakfasts? You could inform us before we enter a cafe. Like you serve eggs, but no avocado or fish? Strange…

No normal cakes. Either gluten free or vegan 🥺

We walked in and had such a pleasant breakfast experience, we visited again the next morning! Timely service, cute atmosphere, and delicious menu items. Our waiters also spoke English which was highly appreciated. Vielen Dank!
leads.ai_response_draft:
Two mornings in a row - that's what we like to hear. Glad our team could help with the English too.

- Café Milchmädchen

leads.business_name: eyes + more - Optiker Leipzig, Promenaden Hauptbahnhof

leads.worst_review_text:
I was there recently to inquire about different lens colors for glasses. When I asked, I was laughed at because there were no sample frames available, which I hadn't realized beforehand.

When I then said I was interested in buying glasses, they simply laid three models in front of me without offering any assistance or advice.

Overall, I felt unwelcome and certainly won't be going there again.

Very rude and unprofessional behavior from an employee towards me when I went to return contacts that were drying out my eyes. He was immediately disrespectful, at one point even saying that I was wrong for thinking these contacts dry my eyes because he uses the same ones and they don’t dry his eyes? He even said they are the best contacts in the store and implied I was lying about having problems with them.

The contacts were opened and I had used 2 of them (they are dailies and I had ordered 30 pairs). He essentially said it was ridiculous for me to try to return them when I had opened them. We spoke a bit more, all the while he was insulting and belittling. I left the store with no solution.

I have since spoken with Fielmann customer service and returned the contacts by post. They said it is completely fine to return contacts even if they have been opened, you simply tell them the reason for the return and that’s it. They also mentioned that all employees know that you are able to return contacts even if they are opened.

Hopefully in the future this employee will behave more professionally and respectfully as it reflects poorly on Fielmann.

I am giving two stars in total: one for the customer service, and one for a younger employee at the Fielmann branch who was kind and helpful

Very dissatisfied that the shop could not make the glasses I ordered, I had to cancel the order.

I made an order on 26 August 2023, a salesperson promised me verbally that my glasses will be made within 2 weeks. My partner went there to ask about my glass on 12th day, the shop told him that my glasses will arrive either the next day or early next week. I did not hear anything, I did not receive the glasses within 2 weeks.

On 16 September, I went to the shop to ask about it. The other sales person, who I found not friendly, told me that my glasses is supposed to arrive by 21 September 2023, but not within two weeks. This was not what I told. Luckily, the salesperson who sold the glasses to me was there too, and he confirmed that he promised that my glasses was supposed to arrive within two weeks. The salesperson told me something was wrong in the factory, and he promised again that the glasses will be done by 26 September (within 1 month).

Unfortunately, my glasses did not arrive within 1 month as the salesperson promised again. So, a few days later, I went to the shop to cancel the order. We visited the shop 4 times without the glasses made, so, wasted a lot of time there!

In my view, price is very high here, I would not buy any glasses here if it is not 50% off.

Extremely disappointing. I was charged over €650 for a service on my Opel Corsa E, which isn't even two years old – for what I consider questionable and, in some cases, unperformed services.

After complaining, I was told over the phone that a refund might be possible. Since then: complete radio silence.

To this day, no one has contacted me. Customers are simply being ignored.

This is definitely not the kind of service you expect from an authorized dealership. Not recommended.

I wanted to share my experience trying to buy a used car from this dealership.

At first, I couldn’t reach a salesperson, but I was promptly called back. The salesperson was very professional and quickly sent me the requested battery certificate. Two days later, I paid for an independent inspection, which went well, and was ready to buy the car. After the inspection, however, I couldn’t reach anyone - I called the salesperson multiple times, contacted the main number (I was promised a callback twice), and emailed, but received no response.

After more than a week, I gave up. Very disappointing, especially since the initial interaction had been so positive.

We are very disappointed. The salesman, Mr. H., ripped us off.
1) You can only finance for a minimum of three years. Then the car loan department would give you a three-year guarantee. That's not right. You can repay the loan whenever you want. Only if you repay the loan within three years does the seller receive less or even no commission.
2) We were told that our car would still be inspected.
That wasn't the case either. And Auto.de isn't willing to take care of that.
Supposedly, everything was taken care of. I went to a specialist workshop and they determined that nothing was wrong. Unfortunately, I only have a verbal agreement. It's definitely a rip-off. I've bought a car here twice.
The first and last time.
I would advise everyone against it.

The café itself is undeniably beautiful, with a charming atmosphere and an impressive display of cakes. At first glance, it looks like the perfect spot. Unfortunately, the reality does not match the appearance.

The cakes, although visually appealing, were extremely dry, dense, and not moist at all, far from the quality one would expect. The bruschetta was also very disappointing: just a slice of bread with chopped tomatoes on top, not even toasted.

The service was, unfortunately, one of the worst parts of the visit. If you are not from here, do not trust the positive reviews. The staff was very unfriendly and unhelpful. When they did not understand what we wanted, they sighed loudly and made us show photos of the cakes instead of simply allowing us to point to them in the display. When we tried to describe the cake, the staff refused, saying they only accept orders by the exact name. Even then, when they didn’t understand the name, they eventually allowed us to point, but only after much insistence. To add to this, when ordering bruschetta, the staff corrected our pronunciation. This was ironic since we are descendants of Italians and know the correct pronunciation, which makes us wonder how other guests might be treated if they happen to pronounce something differently.

It is also important to note that the café was almost empty at the time of our visit, with only three other tables occupied besides ours. We were there before 9 a.m., so the poor service cannot be explained by the place being busy or overwhelmed. And even if the café had been full, that would not excuse the lack of courtesy and professionalism we experienced.

Overall, while the setting of Kaffeehaus Riquet is beautiful, the food is of very poor quality and the service is unwelcoming at best. A disappointing experience that we would not recommend.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That service you described is unacceptable - correcting pronunciation and making you show photos instead of pointing is just rude. We clearly failed you and I need to address this with the team immediately. Please reach out to me directly so I can make this right.

- Kaffeehaus Riquet Café

leads.worst_review_text: I had a nice brunch time in Luise on the weekend. The staff are very friendly and they also brought water for our dog!! So kind! I would definitely visit again!  And there were already many people who were sitting outside on the weekend for brunch, so it’s better to book if you want to sit outside :)
leads.ai_response_draft:
The water for your dog - our staff love doing that. Yeah, weekends get busy outside so booking helps.

- Café Luise

leads.worst_review_text: Quite a nice place with a cosy vibe. The food also good but they are putting reserved on every table and just allowing more than 2 persons to sit on those tables . Also this coffee is not baby friendly, no stroller allowed inside and there is no baby chair .

leads.address: Stenersgata 1, City Senter 3. etg, 0050 Oslo, Norway
leads.worst_review_text:
We order 2-3 times a month from them, the same cake. Costs about 665kr. We usually get if from Foodora or Wolt. This day they sent us this. It is dry and old cake. You can see from the consistency and the taste was stale and sour. We buy this cake all the time. We know how it's supposed to look and taste. For some reason they sent us stale cake, even though we know they keep them frozen. How did you manage that? Of course no refund from Foodora, just a voucher for 135kr.
But at least be careful in the future. This is disgusting and disappointing. Of course we are throwing it away. We tasted 2 pieces and we regret it. We though it didn't taste right because it was still frozen, but no. It's just cake that has gone bad and it was sold to us for 665kr! Very very disappointed. Obviously we are never buying again. Which is a shame, since when it's fresh it's really yummy. But it's not worth the trouble.

leads.address: Tordenskiolds gate 12, Rosenkrantz' gate 25, 0160 Oslo, Norway

leads.worst_review_text:
What a letdown! We went for the Google reviews.

But if you're here for the pastries... run away!

• We ordered several things and everything was super stodgy and dry.

• The filtered coffee was sour and too cold🥶

• Staff is a 10, super friendly!

Worst company ever. They use incompetent accountants with incredibly poor communication skills. They have scammed me out of so much money that I had to close the company.
It is absolutely incredible how they even keep their licenses. If you are interested in spending an incredible amount of money on a job that you will have to get other serious accountants to fix anyway. Then this company is right up your alley.

Very skilled accountants. Absolutely hopeless annual price adjustments, far above indexation. Added a whopping 345,- in administration fees at the annual settlement. And added 70,- in administration costs at the shareholder registration task.

Makes zero sense to make money on such small amounts. When the people in the company are good. Shouldn't they focus on delivering good value to the customers? This is not good customer service for a holding company that has virtually zero activity.
Poor communication and unclear on many fronts.  Has ended up costing me much more than necessary.

Very shady place, and operate with a complete lack of understanding. I got a text in 2022 saying my appointment was X date, then I get an invoice for not showing up as it was apparently the day before? Then I called to discuss with them and they would not accept that they sent a wrong appointment time, nor work with me to reschedule - said that I'd have to pay the invoice and then pay again for another appointment. Very shady business, and I would not trust them. Choose another place for your needs. Now, years later, I get an invoice from a predatory collection agency for NOK 3,500 from an initial 675 NOK payment for services never received. What a horrible business decision choosing to sell a discounted invoice to a collection agency instead of a life-long customer relationship - idiotic of Apex and Marius. BEWARE

Great place for everyone who likes a decadent cake. They are big, delicious and it’s perfect to share a few as it’s hard to choose! You can be seated both indoor and outdoors.
And there is blankets if you are cold. Do try their red velvet croissant, it’s so good! But they all are..
They have several locations, my favourite is the one at Rådmansgatan.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The red velvet croissant is one of our favorites too. Rådmansgatan has that nice outdoor setup with the blankets.

- MR CAKE

leads.worst_review_text:
We reached an agreement, but they didn’t hold up their end of the commitment, and their work quality was poor—our new accountant noticed the issues right away. Lucas withheld access to our Fortnox account until payment was made, which was far from ethical. Hiring them was a big mistake.

When they issued invoices at twice the agreed-upon rate, Lucas just brushed it off, saying, “It is what it is.” As Erik put it: careless, arrogant, and overpriced.
Bad information when booking

Went to Ella, who I unfortunately do not recommend as it felt like the focus was on making money and not helping me. I asked for example how I could prevent the injury and what I could do myself, she said I should not think about it as I would only rest for the time being and that she would give me exercises another time. After that she wanted to book me in for several rounds of shockwave treatments and sell me insoles.
Helped me reschedule an appointment but didn't inform me that I had to cancel the other appointment so now I have to pay for it because I missed it!

Most useless visit in my entire life so far. I got a referral from my doctor about knee pain. My doctor wanted to do an ultrasound and decide on a rehab plan. Once at the visit, the most strange thing was talk about me "walking the wrong way", "sitting down the wrong way" etc. I asked if we should do an ultrasound on my knees and got the answer "no, I don't think we need to" I got 2 exercises drawn on a post it note at the end of the visit.

A week later I went to another clinic and the first question I was asked was if anyone had done an x-ray or ultrasound on your knees.

Then the therapist asked EVERYTHING about what happened, checked my shoes, soles in my shoes(!) and has booked 4 more visits. At the next visit we will go through my different shoes and check if I have the right shoes and soles at all. After that I will learn to train my knees on machines in their premises before I can start self-training at the gym.
Feel the difference!

Unfortunately the sliced cheese we were served had mold on it. When I politely pointed it out, the staff tried to convince me it was “supposed to be like that,” which I don’t agree with. The cheese was being stored unchilled in a warm room in a plastic container, which makes this even more concerning. I know the difference between cheeses where mold is part of the product and mold that clearly shouldn’t be there. The rest of the food was nothing special either. The only real highlight was the cool atmosphere/ambience.

If you’re looking for a taste of Danish history and nostalgia, this place is an absolute must-visit in Copenhagen. Founded way back in 1870, Conditori La Glace isn’t just a pastry shop - it’s Denmark’s oldest and most iconic konditori, serving up beautiful cakes and sweets for over a century.  ￼

From the moment you step inside, you feel like you’ve stepped into a slice of history. The classic interior and tradition-laden atmosphere instantly whisk you back to old Copenhagen days, where afternoons were spent sipping coffee and savouring rich, lovingly crafted confections.  ￼

Their cake selection is legendary. Don’t miss trying their famous layer cakes - especially the traditional Sportskage and other time-honoured classics that have delighted generations of locals and visitors alike.￼ Each bite feels indulgent, rich, and beautifully balanced - like a nod to the past with every forkful.

Whether you’re here for a cosy coffee break (they only have filter coffee) or to relive childhood memories through taste, La Glace offers historical significance, charming nostalgia, and truly amazing cakes that make every visit special. Highly recommended for anyone exploring Copenhagen’s culinary heritage!

Always arrive 20 min before since you might have to stand in line, however it’s worth the wait.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The Sportskage really is our crown jewel - been making it the same way since 1891. Good tip about the 20 minute buffer, especially on weekends.

- Conditori La Glace

leads.address: 11113 Washington Blvd, Culver City, CA 90232, USA

leads.worst_review_text:
Quite possibly one of the best bakeries in Copenhagen. So good that we went twice in one day!

Good service at the counter. In the morning they had a wide selection of fresh pastries available. In the afternoon there were savory baked goods, foccacia sandwiches and dessert treats for sale.

There's limited seating available inside but if the weather is good there's enough seating outside.
leads.ai_response_draft:
Twice in one day - that's a record! The afternoon savory selection is my favorite part of what we do.

- Andersen Bakery

leads.address: Sankt Peders Stræde 29, 1453 Indre By, Denmark
leads.worst_review_text: This bakery is absolutely incredible - we tried 4 items and each one was its own distinct delight. ~ 10 seats inside and there will be a line, wait in it - you would be a fool to do otherwise. Great coffee, lovely staff who were happy to describe the items in English, despite the busyness. We came for the cardamom bun, which was everything we hoped for, but the raspberry & poppyseed pastries were even better! Got back in line for a pumpkin seeded roll - snacked on it all day - heaven!
leads.ai_response_draft:
The cardamom buns are what we're known for, but those raspberry poppyseed ones are pretty special too. Thanks for waiting in line twice - that's dedication.

- Skt. Peders Bageri

leads.worst_review_text: Honestly Juno the Bakery is worth the hype and the queue. The vanilla custard bun was one of the most amazing pastries I have ever had with no exaggeration. I also loved the cardamom bun, it was soft and the spices were on point. The coffee was not special. But it is by far one of the best bakeries I have tried in Denmark.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The vanilla custard bun is our baker's pride - glad it lived up to the hype. Fair call on the coffee, we focus more on the pastries.

- Juno the bakery

leads.worst_review_text:
Extremely unprofessional!
They have approved an account where both the management report is lied to and the accountant has moved entries.
But Grant Thorton's representative wrote NO COMMENTS and approved the account.
When asked how he will explain that there are lies, he says "I think it's a question of how you discuss it".
And then he says thanks and walks away.
NEVER use Grant Thorton!

Waste of time. I tried the app for a couple of hours and faced many functions that do not work correctly, and many tasks are working correctly. Especially the bank reconciliation was changing the articles which were already reconciled. I do not recommend the software at all.

I can only assess them as PIT compliance specialists - all fine at the begining but when left Denmark and had to settle taxes with SKAT it turned out that my Deloitte proxy had forgotten to join my settlement with my wife as they did for the first year. In result, I spend hours to modify the settlement and still cannot be sure if the correction will be accepted.
To sum up, I do not recommend Deloitte in respect of PIT  compliance

As to building architecture - nice interiors, in particular the hall inside. Does not change my opinion on the performance, of course

Extremely poor advice and bordering on extortion with the amount I ended up having to pay for simple bookkeeping (among other things, they have invoiced me for asking questions about outdated and old descriptions that they acknowledged were no longer valid). I am still struggling with the consequences here after 7 months, and they have fully exploited the fact that I can do nothing as a sole proprietorship compared to their large business. The partners promise gold and green forests and are extremely sympathetic until you enter into an agreement with them. Then I was fined at box 1 for poor advice, overcharged bookkeeping and poor service.
The worst thing about the whole experience is that this is completely unnecessary for them to do to their customers, and it almost takes more energy to do it so badly here than to behave properly and only charge for real work.

EDIT/Addition, since I cannot answer directly to the following: I HAVE already talked about the process with you. What is anyone going to gain from doing it again when your conclusion is that yes - you should have fixed your things based on the errors I have found for you in your work, but I still have to "pay you for it" by paying the invoice as it is. And thus I am tied hand and foot, because you know my finances enough to know that I can't do anything and just have to transfer the money. And then you conclude by saying that I can always come back as a customer another time if I need help laughing or at least a little too cheerfully on the phone. I am seriously speechless...

leads.address: Gunnar Nu Hansens Pl. 11, 2100 København, Denmark

leads.business_name: Elitefys - Fysioterapi og Osteopati i København
leads.worst_review_text:
I went to Elitefysio for recovery treatment after disc prolapse surgery. At the very first consultation I was given exercises that included bending and stretching forward. This surprised me as bending forward was the one thing my orthopedic surgeon told me to avoid doing as it can potentially lead to another prolapse.
Luckily I didn’t do it and double checked with the orthopedic doctor who confirmed this is likely to cause harm so soon after surgery.

I shared the feedback with Mathias who treated me and he unfortunately waved it off with the argument that the surgeon likely got it wrong as he is probably not up to date on pain management and training.

Both the treatment itself and the reaction to my feedback was very disappointing and based on this I cannot recommend Elitefysio.
My surgeon is highly specialized in back injuries with extensive experience. I choose to trust his judgement and believe physical therapists should too.

Great physiotherapists.

This review concerns the training centre.

No one answers the phone, you can try and call 15 times a day, it will give you a recorded message in Danish then hang up.

The training app is the worst app I've seen in a long, long time.  I'm actually going to use it as a case study on bad app design.

It forces you to give all your bank details to book a 'free' sample session, and agree to the terms which don't load, but you have to agree to an empty page of terms to proceed (illegal). Then you must book in the app, which has a setting for English, but it only half works, so it is in some (bad) english and danish.  When I try to do anything in the app, it gives me a pop up message in danish which then disappears after a few seconds, so i can't translate it.
Absolutely useless.   It tells me that I'm on a waiting list of 9.  What does this mean? Does it mean that I have to wait for 9 people to not turn up before I get a place? Will I be notified? Why would it let me book if there are already 9 people waiting for a class?  It tells me I'm on a wait list, but also that I'll be charged if i don't attend and when I try to cancel the session, something in danish pops up then disappears after a few seconds.

Of course I've tried to call, but cannot get through.  The person that I spoke to previously wouldn't let me book over the phone, she insisted that I use this terrible app, and now I have it has all my bank details, is warning me that I'll get charged for something that I can't attend.  I'm so angry, I've been trying to book a class for hours, and I have absolutely no idea whether I have a place in the class or not.  All I know is that I will absolutely never ever use this centre, book a class, or give these people my money.

I hope with all my heart they go bankrupt.

leads.worst_review_text:
I thought about giving my review for a long time because I thought I was being a "difficult customer" but seeing the comments of other people I know it wasn't my fault at all.
I had many issues communicating with the firm, there was a lot of anxiety and gaslighting, the information was never clear and every tu e I tried ti clarify they charged me extra 80€ per mail just for answering simple questions, I always had the feeling it was passive- agressiveness in every reply just by asking normal things that every freelancer asks when you don't know the system and I identify now that the major complaints come from foreigns. They should limit their company to locals then, so you don't waste money and time. I'm still paying the consequences of working with them, to whom I gave my complete trust but I ended up paying exaggerated ammounts of money for a service that gave me more questions than answers, and several visits to the psychiatrist because of anxiety and panic attacks.
It's a shame that their whole team is paying the consequences of having an emotional unstable leader, who has lots of communication issues, who can't take criticism and behaves negligent and discriminatory towards his own customers.

leads.worst_review_text: I’m very disappointed with this bakery. The pain au chocolat is inconsistent in size — sometimes decent, but most of the time tiny, weighing only around 60g. To make matters worse, they recently raised the price from €1.90 to €2.10 without any improvement in quality. It feels unfair and frustrating. The bread itself is okay to good, but still highly overpriced for what you get.

This place sells only one thing: the Chocolate Cookie. No other items, no variety, just one SKU—and they have mastered it. There’s always a queue or they are sold out, so you better be there early to try one. The cookie is nothing new or extraordinary; it’s simply baked to perfection. It was a bit too sweet for my taste, but I still ate two without a second thought! 😂
leads.ai_response_draft:
The sweetness level is tricky - we've heard that feedback before. Two cookies though, so we must be doing something right.

- Van Stapele Koekmakerij

leads.worst_review_text:
Excellent experience in Amsterdam.
The location is perfect, right on a pedestrian street, and from the outside you can already see the waffles being freshly made, which immediately draws you in. The shop is very charming and everything feels fresh and well cared for.

Highly recommended the chocolate pistachio waffle. They make it fresh to order, add caramel in the middle which is absolutely delicious, then a layer of chocolate, and finally the pistachio. Truly extraordinary. The chocolate waffle with strawberries is also incredible. The strawberries are clearly selected one by one, fresh, flavorful, and spectacular.

The staff is super friendly and everything is made on the spot, which makes the experience even better.
Definitely a must try experience when visiting Amsterdam.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The chocolate pistachio with caramel is my personal favorite too - glad you noticed we make the waffles fresh to order.

- Hans Egstorf

leads.business_name: FinWoo Bookkeeping & Tax Amsterdam | Accounting | Bookkeeping Services Netherlands

leads.worst_review_text: DO NOT HIRE this company!!! They are liars, unprofessional, and simply disrespectful (they ghost their customers). ZERO professional ethics!!! After working ok with them for a couple of times, I don't know what happened last year that everything changed. Zua dragged both my husband and me for almost a year with false promises, without doing our taxes, and to make matters even worse, Zua and all the people we spoke to at the firm also ghosted us on and off for months on end, even though we called Zua MANY times, left countless messages on WhatsApp, directly at the office, and sent emails with several people on copy...it was a total nightmare and a very stressful situation to be in. It was April 2024, and our taxes for 2023 were not even done! And to top it all off, Zua simply disappeared towards the end, never saying sorry or even acknowledging how horrible he had treated us for 11 months, even though we were really patient and understanding for a very long time. DO NOT trust this firm!

leads.address: World Trade Center Amsterdam, Tower, Zuidplein 88, H, Floor 10, 1077 XX Amsterdam, Netherlands

leads.worst_review_text:
I started ACL rehab at Fysiomed and unfortunately didn’t realize until later that my initial care was below standard. For the first few weeks, I received a static exercise plan with no adjustments, despite raising frustrations about my recovery. It wasn’t until I switched to another physiotherapist that I realized how static my plan was and how behind I was - by then, I had lost crucial recovery time and in my 6 week checkup the doctor raised concerns that I might have scar tissue buildup in my knee.

To make things worse, I was repeatedly told Fysiomed was contracted with CZ (my insurer), only to later find out this wasn’t true - forcing me to pay hundreds of euros from my own pocket. The miscommunication and lack of proper oversight significantly impacted my experience.

Update:
I initially reached out via email to express my concerns. In response, they called me and asked, "What do you want us to do?" They also suggested that "perhaps the miscommunication was the reason the original physiotherapist’s contract wasn’t extended."

Following my six-week checkup, I sent a follow-up email asking whether they believed my initial recovery plan had been appropriate and if the care I received met the expected standards. I did not receive any response.

leads.address: Tweede Jacob van Campenstraat 11, 1073 XN Amsterdam, Netherlands

leads.worst_review_text:
I recently accompanied my sister to her ultrasound appointment, and the experience was deeply disturbing.
The ultrasound provider, Alla, made multiple racist and inappropriate comments, apparently assuming we were white (we look Caucasian). Hearing those remarks in a medical setting was shocking and completely unprofessional.
No patient—or family member—should ever be subjected to biased or discriminatory comments while receiving care. This experience left us uncomfortable and upset, and it seriously impacted our trust in this practice.
I hope management takes this seriously and provides proper training and accountability.

leads.address: 14201 Hayden Rd Ste C-4, Scottsdale, AZ 85260, USA

leads.worst_review_text: This was the closest gym that provided a daycare. My friend said they give unexpected charged not to go there. I decided to try anyways. 3 months later i had an emergency surgery w another coming up and cant do any physical exercise for a couple months. Called and explained this to customer service. They did explain freezing but unsure my timeframe so they said it would be fine theyll only charge me 25 to cancel and it was couple days before my next cycle theyll waive it manager approved and i said id come back. Than got charged 142 TWICE. Since the customer services cant keep straight stories acted like theyll waive 25 and nothing else. Will NOT be coming back. Not to mentioned i tried the day care only hand full of times. Always way above capacity. My kids come home with black knees, feet & hands. They mix crawlers and infants with older kids. When i tried mentioning certain child care state questions they denied me. Twice my kids got hurt and they were unsure what happened even w a bump on my one year olds head. They are lazy and keep them in strollers half the time too. Or let older kids pick up babies and dont pay attention on their phones. Staff kids have special trestments eating treats and fast food around the class, etc.

leads.business_name: MultiCare Indigo Urgent Care - Seattle - 45th St.
leads.address: 118 NE 45th St Suite A, Seattle, WA 98105, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
the front desk girl was extremely nice and patient and she’s amazing!!

my visit was extremely rushed. came in with a bunch of symptoms. they tested for strep, came back negative, sent me on my way. $37 copay down the drain. didn’t care to test for anything else.

it’s been 6 days and all of my symptoms persisted and got worse. i finally had to go to the ER today after calling a nurse hotline last night and them telling me i needed to be seen immediately. they ran more tests and it came back as RSV.

i just think the provider here needs to actually listen to the patients and do thorough tests and actually try to help the patients. i’m asthmatic and RSV can be very more serious because so. i’ve been feeling like i’m on my deathbed this week and was just doing what the provider told me to do which led to no relief and me getting worse. now i’m having to take steroids and other medications that were never on the list the provider gave me and everything i had been taking was just making it worse and not helping in the slightest.

2 stars just because the front desk girl is very very sweet and that’s the only solid staff you got in that facility.

leads.business_name: Neighborcare Health at Pike Place Market
leads.worst_review_text:
Mean call center. And they don't respect your time or care about your general health. This place once closed fully with me in it. I had a 3:30 appointment, and they made me wait 1 hour in the waiting room and 1 hour in the doctor's room without being seen. I thought, there's no way this was happening in a medical setting, where people come to get their problems solved. She came in, huffing and puffing all stressed, and rushed me out cause she wanted to go home. I then found out all the staff left, and they LOCKED me inside without receiving care...so I wasted my whole day waiting for this very traumatic experience.
Why go to school for something if you don't want to do it? Why work in this field if all you do is cause more stress and anxiety to the public due to your unprofessionalinsm?

leads.worst_review_text:
The lawyer I am working with shared a list of places that provided immigration medical exams and this place was near my job.

Making the first appointment was easy enough and went smoothly.

However, after completing the blood work requested, I was told to email them the results (despite the fact that they have a secure portal). I shared the results and asked about a vaccine I needed. They proceeded to ignore my email and calls for 1.5 weeks. When they finally picked up, they said all the paperwork was ready for my to sign. I reminded them that didn’t make sense since I still had a question about the pending vaccine which made it clear that my results were not viewed at all. They also called me from 2 different #s and neither assistant coordinated what they were saying (one would say one thing and the other contradict or not have details about my file) which made communicating with them super confusing and frustrating.

After getting the necessary vaccine, we agreed upon a time for me pick up the finalized paperwork. The assistant I was speaking with wasn’t there and the new one said she didn’t know where the paperwork was. After waiting for a bit, she found them and I was finally able to leave.

Overall, they had really poor customer service, were disorganized, delayed a time sensitive process and despite having me register for their patient portal - they didn’t do the bare minimum to ensure the security and protection of the information requested.

leads.worst_review_text: These people are awful! It's hard to get somebody on the phone. They don't call back when you leave a message. Their customer is terrible. When you go into one of these offices it looks like you're in a 3rd world country some where! I saw the doctor and she barely addressed my problems and pushed me out of the door! The staff is super unhelpful! They didn't take my insurance because they failed to report to anthem that the doctor on my insurance card doesn't work there anymore and hasn't for TWO YEARS! So I had to pay cash and then they referred me to a list of doctors that don't take my insurance!!! So what did I pay $45 for? When anthem called them back to correct the mistake they didn't refund my money nor did they forward the referral codes to the doctor they referred me to that didn't take my insurance and I had to find that out on the day of my appointment! These people are the worst! Do not do business with them! This is a total scam! You're not going to get good health care if you do business with these people! If anything bad happens to you after you deal with them, it's 100% your fault! You have been warned! Hopefully it's not too late. This place needs to be shut down immediately!

leads.worst_review_text:
I called to make an appointment with the OBGYN. The person I made an appointment with said due to the severity of my health issues, I didn't need a referral. I got a call this morning from someone saying I needed to make an appointment with a primary care physician for a referral AND that I needed to change my primary care physician with my insurance in order to be seen by one of theirs. I called back to get further clarification and was told to call back at a time that I am working to make an appointment with the primary care physician and that I do NOT need to call my insurance to change it and that my appointment tomorrow afternoon, set at a time that works for me, was cancelled. This third person said an appointment was available at 8am tomorrow for the primary but I'm not able to make appointments during my work hours because I am in a 90 day probationary period so I'm not allowed to ask for time off.

I haven't been to a doctor in over a year because I lost my coverage and lived in a state that wasn't capable of helping me. I don't know if the people here need to go through retraining or what, but apparently no one knows what the policy for making appointments is.

leads.business_name: Anne Loveland, Realtor Loveland Carr Group Hancock Park Real Estate Agents
leads.address: 251 N Larchmont Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90004, USA

leads.business_name: Ian & Kimberly Rhodes, Real Estate Agents & Advisors
leads.address: 1660 Hillhurst Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90027, USA
2148 Green Springs Hwy, Birmingham, AL 35205, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
I’d like to start this review with the fact that I am a Tuskegee grad as well and I don’t like posting negative reviews on businesses esp on people that are from my alma mater however my experience with this clinic today didn’t sit well with me (the lady at the front desk this evening and the groomer are exempt). The morning started with me dropping my dogs off for a groom and some annual shots, to which one of my dogs got nervous and pooped in the floor. I asked the young lady that was a student for something to pick it up with and was given tissues. As I was going to place the tissue filled with poop in the public toilet I was told not to do so and was given the office trash can to place the waste in. To my surprise when I was there to pick my dogs up this evening and pay, why do I see a “Biohazard Waste Fee”! I’m the one that cleaned up behind my dog and was given the office’s trash can to throw it away in!!! Mind you there was a pile of old dog poo right in front of the front door of the establishment (that was not left by my dogs as I don’t do that) that was there from the time I dropped my dogs off that morning to the time I picked them up!!!

Also I was charged a $7 medication fee for giving my dog insulin which she did NOT receive, as per the evening staff, she didn’t eat her food (which they threw away). So my dog went all day without her needed insulin. Now I ask, would you do this to your kids, grandparents, or even your own beloved pets? Cherry on top, my diabetic dog threw up slimy phlegm and then drank multiple bowls of water as soon as we got home.

To the doctors at Red Mountain Animal Clinic, please ask your staff to practice more empathy and care, as your vet hold people’s precious animals in your care. Please also work on communication with pet parents, as sometimes they too like your staff, can be overwhelmed and overstimulated and all the unexpected fees can really come as a surprise to your customers. Thank you

(Disclaimer: this is not my first time using the vet for grooming services and vet care. This is just my first experience with subpar service. I would’ve brought the issues up more with staff but I got the feeling they really didn’t care.

This is only my experience)

My family switched over to this veterinary clinic a few years ago after our previous vet retired, and words cannot express our disappointment. If I could give this clinic zero stars, I would. PLEASE READ

For 2 years, our dog had multiple symptoms that led us to believe that something was wrong. We took him to appointment after appointment trying to get to the bottom of it and Dr. Schwartz repeatedly dismissed our concerns, telling us that our dog was "just old". Our dog turned 10 this year and became sicker than we had ever seen him. Again, Dr. Schwartz dismissed our concerns and prescribed an antibiotic to our dog without even seeing him in person. Because our dog's symptoms were so severe, we chose to get a second opinion and found out that our dog had Stage 4 Spleen Cancer. Because the cancer was detected so late, he could not be saved. Our dog died in our arms this past weekend and our hearts are broken. We will NEVER bring another animal to this clinic again.

leads.worst_review_text:
Super super disappointed!!  I booked a massage for myself and my daughters on Tuesday 11/25 At 11 am. My friend from North Alabama also had booked a massage at 11 with us too.  Woodhouse spa confirmed our appointments a week or 2 in advance and made sure we were aware that if we cancelled anytime within 24 hours we would b charged the full massage.  Pls keep in mind none of the 4 of us have ever been to Woodhouse spa. I took the day off from work and drove 1 1/2 hours for this massage. I received a call at 9:45 am on Tuesday 11/25 from the spa when I was already in Birmingham when we had 4 appointments at 11 am informing me that the painters that were supposed to have finished the night before did not finish and that they would need to reschedule our visit.  I explained that I had taken the day off of work and driven an hour and
a half and she just said she was sorry. Not let me fix this for u or your next massage is half off or even free.  Nothing but I’m sorry.   I understand things happen but do not accept I’m sorry when I took the day off and drove 1 1/2 hours to get to our appointment.  I had already spent $190 for half of our appointment.  Not impressed at all!   Super disappointed.

Long time shopper (in store) of Nordstrom Rack. Other than crowds, a pleasant experience and quality products. Based upon these experiences, I made a purchase of a sports coat the website indicated was in stock (color and size). Made the purchase 14 days in advance of event I needed it for. Seven days after the order was placed, I get an email stating shipping was being delayed (inexcusable for items sold as in stock). Eleven days after the order, I finally was able to get in touch with a customer service rep (forget chatting online even though that is an offered method of contact - after initiating a chat, it always says no one is available). Barbara was very customer service friendly and that was appreciated. I explained I wanted to cancel the order due to delayed shipping and need of item in 3 days. She advised she could not cancel the order but would send it to the shipping dept. - NOPE I have already had a processed payment, waited 11 days on an item - I am not waiting to receive the order and then having to go through the hassle of return shipping since Nordstroms sold me an in stock item that they could not fulfill/deliver. Barbara stated she would expedite the cancellation and explained how to contact shipping if I had not received correspondence within 24 hrs. I appreciated Barbara (certainly not her fault), but the experience has soured me on Nordstrom business practices regarding online orders.
ONLINE PURCHASERS BEWARE!!!!!

Not a true German Christmas market, not even Glühwein. Extremely disappointed ☹️
We brought our mugs all the way from Germany to only find out there is no Glühwein.

leads.worst_review_text:
So having arrived in brum by train we went to explore the ode bullring. I tell you what pal but the place was absolutely heaving for saying the weather had taken a turn for the worse and it was raining, the city is definitely a sleeping giant!
We joined the many blues, sky blues, villans and old golds in checking the place out.
I tell you what pal but I've never seen a primark or primarni as I call it so big, this bad boy of a store had 4 floors with a cafe, a greggs and even a pre loved section! It really was inspirational and I've not seen or been in another primark like it anywhere it really is an eye catcher baby massive kudos!
Had a nosey in the body shop and I tell you what pal but the ode sugar pumpkin 🎃 section was absolutely banging it was a beautiful scent, hand cream, shower gels the full shebang people were going mad for it, reckon this stuffs the new best seller in brum land and the lady working there loved a good natter she was a good egg pal!
Ended up getting a my cookie dough from one of the pop ups. It wasnt cheap pal, but i went with the cookies and cream with ice cream and oh my god pal talk about yummy yummy in my tummy or what. It was massive and very tasty indeed pal, I'll let you into a little secret but im sure I put 4 pounds on eating that bad boy!
Walking back to the ode train station we were greeted by ozzy the mechanical bull, what a creature, what a construction all 33ft of him, definitely worth a look 👀
The other thing i noticed round ozzy, it absolutely stunk of wacky backy to the point that when I got back on the train my head was nearly touching the roof I was that high on the whiffer!
Alot of trains cancelled today however no problems for us and we managed to get 2 seats together on the return journey but again that was a little bit whiffy as someone kept letting tommy squeakers off.
A cracking day out though and definitely a sleeping giant there 😴 keep up the fantastic work you brummies 👏
leads.ai_response_draft:
That 4-floor Primark is something else isn't it pal. Glad you spotted Ozzy on the way out too.

- Bullring

leads.worst_review_text: I’ve never met a pharmacist as helpful, knowledgeable, and genuinely caring as Stefan. His professionalism and kindness truly stand out. Thank you for taking the time to care and to share your expertise.

And ICR were the one closest to me and my new vet doesnt have a night vet, they didnt want to help and made it very difficult. I then called Braid vets on Mayfield road, where i am also NOT registered, and they were so kind! They said, of course you can come, but it will cost a lot so tell us what's up. I told them. They gave me some great advice and what meds I could give for the allergic reaction. For free. Because they care. Honestly IRC vets have become commercial and rigid. Was quite upset about it all.

leads.worst_review_text: I have a tortoise who needed her beak and claws done and my usual exotic vet left so I was hunting for a vet who sees reptiles. Thank God I found Leith vets were I met with Richard. There are very little to none vets who see exotics. So I was really happy. The practice was clean, warm and the staff were very pleasant.  He was very knowledgeable and gave me some good advice.  He done a fantastic job with her beak and claws and he weighed her.  What a very pleasant guy he is. So I would highly recommend this vet if you have an exotic pet.  Very happy no concerns during my visit with my tortoise scooby....thank you so much.
