leads.worst_review_text:
This is a mixed review because we liked the vets at Braid Vets very much but we became increasingly concerned & dumbfounded by the poor communication & incorrect information given by the reception staff; e-mails which reception staff acknowledged they had "missed" containing urgent infomation for which they did apologise; poor communication which on one day necessitated me having to phone 3 times to clarify how to request a repeat prescription & being given 3 contradictory sets of instructions as the first 2 reception staff had given wrong information; the final straw came when I was told by one member of reception staff that, "the law said" my dog had to be seen by a vet every 6 months. No such law exists.

It is concerning that as veterinary practices are being bought over by corporate organisations & vet bills spiral we have responsible pet owners who are struggling to take animals to be seen by a vet without the scaremongery of being told "the law says" we have to take our pets for a health check every 6 months.
So as I say a mixed review;  terrific vets, corporate management & extremely poor communication & many training needs at reception level.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The reception communication issues you've described aren't acceptable - especially the wrong prescription instructions and that misleading "law" comment. We need to fix this properly so reach out to me directly and I'll sort it.

- Braid Vets Hospital

leads.address: 4700 85th Ave N, Brooklyn Park, MN 55443, USA

leads.worst_review_text:
Called about my cat because he had diarrhoea but no other symptoms at all. Very hydrated, eating well, cuddly and comfortable as usual but wanted to phone just to be safe. It was new year’s eve at 6pm ish, so our usual vets was closed and not taking any calls.
The receptionist was rude and fear mongering. she recommended Arlo get seen immediately despite being completely fine other than diarrhoea. I told her he’s a very anxious cat and bringing him in might just make him worse, she had none of it and firmly suggested we get him in immediately for examination. I was honest and mentioned we didn’t have a way of bringing him in, she was dismissive and suggested getting a taxi. A consultation alone was expensive, nevermind medication they might prescribe, a taxi on top of that is just not something we could afford, she was completely dismissive of this. I told her I would discuss this and call back ans she was quite rude about this and seemingly disapproved.
We then managed to get a call back from our usual vets which was reassuring, and they reassured us completely that for an anxious cat this can sometimes be normal and the fact he had no other symptoms they weren’t worried at all and unless he started throwing up or had excessive diarrhoea there was nothing to worry about. This was the complete opposite of what this vet said and I believe it is purely due to being so money focused having read other reviews. Two days later Arlo was back to his normal self completely. This vets caused so much unnecessary worry for our family and they did not have any sympathy for our situation or even for little anxious Arlo, which i’m sure now would have been terrified going to a new place for no reason at all.
Having read other reviews regarding money grabbing and general negligence, I would never ever take any of my pets here and i’d suggest you do the same.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That call didn't go how it should have and I'm sorry we added stress when you were already worried about Arlo. Our emergency protocols can sometimes feel pushy when you know your pet best. Glad your usual vet could reassure you and that Arlo's doing better.

- Vets Now Edinburgh

leads.address: 163 St John's Rd, Corstorphine, Edinburgh EH12 7SD, UK

leads.worst_review_text: bad hospital, my pet budgie was dying and they kept on asking for unnecessary details and acting stupid, my father asked them “so if my pet is dying these unnecessary details are more important?” And they said yes, do not go to this hospital in an emergency. They wasted all of our time and our budgie sadly passed away
leads.ai_response_draft: Zufash, I'm deeply sorry about the loss of your budgie - losing a beloved pet is heartbreaking, and I can only imagine how frustrating it must have been to feel like we weren't acting with the urgency your situation needed. What you experienced goes against everything we stand for, and I want to personally review our emergency protocols to ensure no other family faces what you went through. Your budgie deserved better from us, and so did you - Edinburgh PDSA Pet Hospital

leads.business_name: The Caledonian Edinburgh, Curio Collection by Hilton
leads.worst_review_text: A rather disappointing stay at the Caledonian in Edinburgh... The location of this hotel offers a great advantage to tourists as it is close to points of interest and the old historic center of the city. From the outside, the hotel building is very striking and well maintained. The rooms were nice and spacious, but unfortunately the beds were very uncomfortable. Finally, the service during breakfast was poor and unprofessional. It took at least 15-20 minutes for a cappuccino to arrive at the table. Sometimes waiting was not enough and you had to get up from the table to ask for the same order again. The hotel offers spa services to guests. The pool was cold (despite it being winter) and the Turkish bath was out of order. The sauna worked but was too small.

I've visited PURE Spa for Contrast Therapy and left unsatisfied. It was supposed to be a 60 minutes hot sauna with contrast cold plunge treatment. The sauna was basically 26 degrees Celsius and didn't heat above that. I'd been waiting for 15 mins and ended up with cold legs and just warm sauna. If this is related to the fact that I was the very first customer for the day and they open at 10, I'd suggest to not have any slots for 10am for sauna if it's not properly heated.
Staff was nice and welcoming, apologised and refunded straight away, so thank you for that!
Don't think I'll pay another visit to PURE Spa
leads.ai_response_draft: Sam, I'm really sorry your contrast therapy session started with a sauna that hadn't properly heated up yet - being left with cold legs when you're expecting therapeutic heat is the opposite of what should happen. You're absolutely right that we shouldn't offer 10am sauna slots if our equipment isn't ready, and I'll make sure our team allows proper warm-up time before the first bookings of the day. While I'm glad our staff handled the refund quickly, I understand this experience has put you off returning and I completely get why - PURE Spa & Wellness (Lothian Road)

leads.address: 1 Saint James Square, Edinburgh EH1 3AX, UK
leads.worst_review_text:
The spa was perfectly lovely, but I want to make a special mention for therapist Sarah. I'm almost reluctant to say this because she was so good, and I don't want her to get booked up even further in advance, but wow, she is the most unbelievable massage therapist who just knows what she is doing and listens. Very rare. Really, really lovely relaxing massage. Absolutely fantastic. And I will definitely be back.
Other staff present were very nice too. Seemed short staffed trying to juggle a lot, so hopefully management can help, but they were doing their absolute best and were very professional.
leads.ai_response_draft:
Sarah's booked solid for good reason - she really does have that touch. We're working on the staffing thing too.

- AWAY® SPA

leads.worst_review_text:
I stayed at the Sheraton Grand Hotel & Spa in Edinburgh with high expectations, based on my previous experiences with Sheraton properties around the world. Unfortunately, this stay did not meet those expectations.

Noise & Soundproofing:
The biggest issue was the lack of soundproofing. The rooms are not well insulated, and I could clearly hear noises from the corridors, doors, and general hotel activity. I raised this concern twice with the staff, but unfortunately, there was no improvement. This level of noise is not acceptable for a hotel marketed as a five-star property.

Breakfast Experience:
We paid for breakfast, but no one informed us that there was an à la carte menu available. We only found out after asking ourselves, which indicates a lack of proper communication and service awareness.

Service Level:
Overall, the service felt average and did not reflect a five-star standard. There was limited attention to detail and a noticeable gap between the brand’s reputation and the actual guest experience.

Overall Impression:
While the hotel carries a strong international brand name, the experience did not align with what I would expect from a Sheraton at this level. Based on my stay, the hotel felt closer to a four-star experience rather than a true five-star one, especially considering the price.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The soundproofing issue is frustrating - we've heard that feedback before and are working on it. You're right about the breakfast communication, that should've been explained upfront.

- Sheraton Grand Hotel & Spa, Edinburgh

leads.worst_review_text:
I visited the UNIQLO Edinburgh store today and was treated unfairly in the fitting room. A white customer before me said she had 2 items, and the staff gave her a tag without checking. When it was my turn, I said I had 4 items, but the staff member took my clothes from my hands and counted them herself.

When I questioned the difference in treatment, she only replied, “This is our policy.” If this is truly the policy, then it should apply equally to all customers. The inconsistency in behavior felt discriminatory and disrespectful.

This was my first negative experience with UNIQLO, and I hope management will address this unprofessional conduct
leads.ai_response_draft:

- UNIQLO Princes Street

leads.worst_review_text: A staff member at the fitting room has an attitude and was extremely rude to me. I only tried out 4 items and when I came back out and “said I will be taking two items”. She said “put those items you don’t want back onto the hanger and give it back to me”in a commanding tone. (Isn’t it her job? To put to items people have tried out back into place). It was like 6:30 in the evening so there wasn’t like a big queue of people, in fact there wasn’t anyone else waiting behind me. I would’ve happily done what she said if she requested me in a pleasant tone, but no it was said in a condescending manner. Anyway, I’m not a confrontational person so I complied with her unnecessary demand and put those items into hangers. I’m an asian international student so I’m fairly used to the racism and side eyes but still totally ruined my day for sure.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That's completely unacceptable and I'm sorry you experienced that. No one should be spoken to that way, especially at our store. Please email me directly at [manager email] so I can address this with my team immediately.

- Urban Outfitters

leads.worst_review_text:
No price tags on the unprocessed or cheaper option products. This happened consistently in the food hall. See photo attached as an example - there is no price tag for the chicken breast.

The same items and brands you get in other supermarkets, are much more expensive here. See Tennents as an example, usually it's £1 per can. It's £14 for 12 cans at M&S. See photo as proof.

Also messy and unpleasant as the food hall is in the basement. Avoid.
leads.ai_response_draft: Alina, I completely understand your frustration with the missing price tags on our chicken and other products - that's unacceptable and I'll make sure our team does a thorough check of all food hall pricing today. You're absolutely right about our premium positioning meaning higher prices than other supermarkets, and I can see how the basement location doesn't create the best shopping experience. I'm personally looking into improving both our pricing clarity and the overall feel of our food hall - Marks & Spencer

leads.worst_review_text:
First-floor women’s self-checkout, around 1–2pm.
Older dark-haired woman, bad BO and very stale lip filler, hovering over me and ( trying) to counting my items like she was loss prevention 😭 Full micro-aggressive behaviour. She was just being nasty on Christmas Eve. I understand you have to work but that’s not my fault…

Ironically, the two white teens right behind her were openly stuffing their bags at self-checkout. I was genuinely in shock because she was so focused on me while not actually doing her job.

I’m not working class, so I was honestly just confused. I don’t know if her job encourages racial profiling of mixed-race/brown people or if that was a personal choice — either way, it was deeply disturbing and unprofessional and embarrassing for someone who probably doesn’t get paid enough.

Also, not to put her down — because I genuinely believe in treating people with respect regardless of their education level — but while she was trying to bully me and being a little nasty racist, she was struggling to count, I only had 10 teams….She was struggling to count the items I had scanned, I ended up having to help her count my own items that I had already scanned and paid for… while she was actively trying to be racist towards me.

Honestly, I thought I was being pranked or that I’d wandered into some kind of social-experiment for TikTok. I feel bad for her, but I also hope the manager retires her soon, because that was genuinely painful to witness.

leads.address: St James Cres, Edinburgh EH1 3AD, UK

leads.worst_review_text: I visited Edinburgh in October 2025 and bought a Dune bag from this John Lewis store. I am not based in the UK. Unfortunately after only using the bag for a few days the stitching on one of the sides of the main zipper came apart which now leaves me with additional costs for repair. I have contacted customer services in regards to this and I highlighted that I am not based in the UK. Their response was that they could only help me if I physically visited one of their stores. As a tourist I'd advice to only buy from John Lewis at your own risk as their customer service is not helpful at all towards tourists. I would have expected a postal return option or a partial reduction to help cover cost of repair. Very disappointed.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That's completely unfair - a bag shouldn't fall apart after a few days and we should've offered you a postal return option. Email me directly at the store with your receipt photo and we'll sort out a refund or repair cost coverage.

- John Lewis & Partners

leads.address: 30-34 St Andrew Sq, Edinburgh EH2 2LL, UK
leads.worst_review_text:
We arrived at the bar for cocktails at around 18:40 on Sunday 27th July following an excellent meal at Fazenda.

We were greeted by the lovely  maitre d’ who showed us to our table in an unusually quiet restaurant.

When we enquired about sitting out on the balcony,  we were told that this area was closed for the evening, even although there was around another hour left of service and instead were sat in the bar at the window which is equally as nice,  but not on a hot sunny day.

We were shortly served by the waitress who reminded us at around 18:45 that they closed at 8pm as she took our drinks order.  Our drinks arrived at around 18:55 and by 19:15 we were approached to say that last orders are being taken.

We made another order for cocktails and we seemed frowned upon for making this choice even although the bar is open until 8pm.

No sooner had the drinks been placed another waiter came over around 19:25 and placed our bill down and fetched the card machine for payment, we both felt rushed and more so as the staff started assembling behind us in their outside clothes and sighing loudly!

We were really disappointed by this, as we are regular visitors to the bar and have never received service like this previously.

There are other more friendlier bars nearby that I’m sure will be welcoming of our custom.

leads.worst_review_text:
I have avoided writing this review for years because the experience is still painful to think about, but I feel it’s important to share.

Years ago, my dog was diagnosed with a heart murmur by Dr. Corinne Lemay. As many pet owners know, a murmur can be an early warning sign of heart disease, and early referral to a cardiologist can make a meaningful difference. Unfortunately, Dr. Lemay never recommended a cardiology referral at that stage. Instead, we waited until my dog was already in heart failure before a referral was finally made; long after she could have been evaluated for early-intervention medications that might have helped delay the progression.

Throughout the months that followed, I often felt dismissed when I asked questions or expressed concerns. Any time I asked something heart-related, I was met with, “I’m not a vet cardiologist, so I cannot answer your heart questions,” delivered in a tone that made me reluctant to ask anything further. Because of that, during appointments I only brought up issues unrelated to her heart; not because I was in denial, but because I was trying to respect the boundaries she set.

One appointment stands out clearly: I brought my dog in because I suspected an upper respiratory issue (she was later diagnosed with asthma). Dr. Lemay looked at me and said, “You know what I think? I think you’re in denial that your dog is in heart failure.” It was one of the most hurtful comments I have ever heard from a veterinarian.

I was not in denial, I was living in constant panic, managing an exhaustive medication regimen (Flovent inhaler, Hydrocodone, Prednisone, nausea meds, Torsemide, Sildenafil, Spironolactone, Benazepril, Vetmedin, vitamins, and more), monitoring her symptoms 24/7, and doing everything in my power to keep her comfortable. I rarely slept. I never left her alone. I even risked my job once by bringing her to work because I refused to let her struggle without me. The suggestion that I was somehow ignoring her condition was not only inaccurate, it was cruel.

That comment, combined with the lack of early referral and the overall dismissiveness, was the moment I knew I could no longer bring my dog back to Manchester Animal Hospital. I needed compassionate, proactive care, and unfortunately, I did not receive that here.

I wish I could write a different review. I wish this experience had been supportive, collaborative, and respectful. But it wasn’t, and sharing this is the only way I can help other pet owners advocate for their companions.

leads.business_name: Fox Creek Veterinary Hospital at Manchester Avenue

leads.worst_review_text:
We brought our cat in due to some breathing issues she was having. We were there for almost 12 hours (see picture of check in time and discharge instructions time…I am unfortunately not exaggerating). They were severely understaffed it seems, as from what I could tell there was only a single vet on staff. And while I understand that is not their fault, I wish they provided better communication.

After being checked in at about 6:30pm, it took an hour or so to get into triage. After triage we were in the lobby until 11pm, which at that point the girl at the desk offered us a room so our cat could stretch her legs. We did not have any contact again from anyone at all up until 1:30am. The vet tech that came in listened to her breathing and bumped her up the list. The vet did not come in the room until 3:30am. At that time our cat was taken back for testing and diagnostics, which I understand takes awhile. The vet wrapped up with us around 5:30am.

I understand this is an emergency vet, and since our cat’s vitals were stable, she kept getting bumped down the list when critical emergencies came in. But hours went by without any contact, recheck, or communication.

I am giving 2 stars because the vet, Erica White, was indeed great. But the rest of the experience was not great. They should have more than one vet on staff, and they shouldn’t let pet parents sit there for HOURS without communicating a single word.

We were really excited for our New Year treatment and spa visit, but the experience was mixed. On arrival, there were no gowns or slippers available, which immediately caused some confusion. The treatment itself was lovely and relaxing.

However, the spa facilities were disappointing. The relaxation area was overcrowded, leaving us sitting on chairs rather than loungers, which didn’t feel particularly relaxing. The room was also quite chilly. There is also no swimming pool, which was a major letdown. Describing this as “spa facilities” feels misleading when it consists solely of a sauna- we had expected at least a steam room and pool.

To make matters worse, another guest was loudly talking on the phone in the relaxation area, and there was no staff presence to manage this or maintain a calm environment, as everyone was occupied with treatments.

On a positive note, the restaurant service was excellent and the food was delicious. The team kindly moved our restaurant booking an hour earlier when we decided we’d had enough of the sauna and noise, which we appreciated.

leads.business_name: Orchid Thai Massage and Spa Manchester

leads.address: 4 Cheetham Hill Rd, Cheetham Hill, Manchester M4 4EW, UK
leads.worst_review_text:
Went with a groupon voucher bought for me as a gift in June , availability was a lead time of approx 3 months and not good choice of times
, had to pay a supplement for a weekend  - all good though  . However , having been before I can say I would never go again , this is not a spa , it’s a hotel pool with treatment rooms . A spa day used to be “a day “ you now only get 3 hours . Hotel restaurant used to serve food through the day , now only serves food from
3pm . The spa itself offers no facilities for food or drink . Groupon voucher included Prosecco - this was not offered or mentioned by the spa ( only remembered after the day) . Changing rooms- non existent - it is a very small room with. 2 showers and 2 toilets only so communal changing and a very small room the size of an average kitchen to give a guide ! I don’t think it’s appropriate to not have a private cubicle. Hotel guests and children allowed after 4pm  - no offence to children at all (I have my own !) but I go for a spa day to have a little peace and when the spa only offer the afternoon 3 hour session to groupon voucher guests feels a little like they don’t deserve some peace. Guy on reception so friendly and helpful cannot fault at all and he deserves employee of the month for his working attitude . Treatment staff - just felt a little formal attitude when you go in the treatment room but the treatments were good so cannot fault them  . Cleanliness - clumps of hair around the pool floor not nice . Pool - ok temp but not warm to be comfortable . Overall I would not go again as to me this is just a pool and not a spa day , been for spa days at other places who have the facilities and staff to provide what a spa day should be

leads.address: Unit 3c, Wing Yip business centre, Cassidy Cl, Manchester M4 5HU, UK
leads.worst_review_text:
*Edited my review to add this - the owner has replied to say they mentioned something about my emails going into their Junk folder - this is just a lie, no-one on the phone mentioned a junk folder or apologised for ignoring my emails, now you look worse for lying rather than just owning it*

I bought a voucher for my wife for Christmas 2024.

Fast forward to October this year and we decide it's time to use it, not realising it's a 6 month expiry and not 12 months.

Completely my fault, didn't realise.

I email Youth Spa to see if anything can be done, no reply. I wait a week and email again, no reply.

Finally 2 weeks later I thought I best call up, in case I'm getting the email wrong only to be told that they did receive my emails but the expiry date is a hard rule.

This rating isn't because they couldn't do anything with the expiration date, that's on me. This rating is because they ignored my 2 emails rather than just letting me down gently.

Its a real shame I didn't get the chance to experience the spa, I can see lots of good ratings, but I can only go off the service that I received.

leads.worst_review_text: I visited today, Sunday, November 30th 2025. It wasn't decorated for Christmas. Apparently the new owner is behind on a lot- including the holiday season. A few of the vendors I spoke with are very unhappy. The morale of shoppers and vendors honestly seemed lacking. Like everyone was just going through the motions and getting the shopping done. No one looked excited to be there. It's a shame, because the carousel/food court is really cool. They have great restaurants and cafes in that area, the carousel, playscape family area, games... It's on another level. It was created with the intention of being a place you want to hang out at. Other malls should honestly take notes on how a good court and lounge area should be. This credit definitely can't be given to the new owner. Rather, I'm concerned the new owner will ruin something really special that the Buckland Hills Mall has that no other mall does. I usually don't leave bad reviews. But, this new owner is treating his/her investment like they want it to fail. It's sad.
leads.ai_response_draft:
You're right about the Christmas decorations - we're way behind and that's not acceptable. The carousel area is special and we won't let it decline under our watch.

- The Shoppes at Buckland Hills

leads.worst_review_text:
I wouldn't normally go to this shop, but my brother wanted something so in we went. I needed to go to the toilet. I'm sorry it's closed, you'll have to go to the top floor. Up we went. The access to the toilets including the disabled one was down a extremely narrow corridor if you can call it that. You couldn't drive round the corner, luckily I can walk a short distance & my scooter is a lightweight one with a good turning circle, I had to physically manoevre the scooter or I wouldn't have got round. I sat outside the disabled loo for over 5 minutes. There's a weird system where there's a red light on to tell you if someone is in there & I couldn't make it open.
As I can walk short distances, I abandoned the scooter outside and went into the ladies toilets.
Then we got the lift down to the ground floor, getting out of the lift I had to reverse out into a very narrow area with very steep stairs! Really?? That's not a safe thing to do.
They very obviously only expect people not to need to use a disabled toilet or a lift. I'm totally disgusted with how it made me feel like I didn't matter.
I hadn't been to a Harvey Nicholls shop before and after that experience I certainly wouldn't bother again.

A disaster in every sense of the word!!@I ordered a breakfast, I was served fried egg in a sticky pan and charcuterie in dribs and drabs.
Then, bread that dated from the day before...all that for 10 euros...
The best is for the end for a tourist like me, I was refused credit card payment because the machine did not work, I had to withdraw and the waitress ran behind to get my ID, supposedly to be sure i come back....
A shame, a scandal, an ignominy... no one can reach such baseness in customer satisfaction, I note -5/20, to flee :(

Lovely store and food hall.
I visited on 3rd January 2026.
Complained to a manager regarding the ladies toilets which were, the only word for it, quite filthy.
Obviously had not been cleaned all day  even though the manager assured me they had. Did not believe him  or he just dud not have his eye on things.
Dirty toilets, toilet papers all over floors, sink dirty.
It ruined the shopping experience completely.
leads.ai_response_draft:
Those toilets were unacceptable on January 3rd. That's completely on us and I don't blame you for not believing they'd been cleaned. I'll make sure this gets sorted immediately.

- Marks & Spencer

All in all had a great walk around and we were really impressed with the Winter Village so well worth a visit to Cheshire Oaks

leads.worst_review_text: I am under the impression that you Kristi didn’t accept my case even though I had a car accident on Dec 12th that was not my fault. Driver and I exchanged the information. I told her that I couldn’t miss a doctor appointment because I had been waiting after 6 months. Told her she would hear from me through my insurance and lawyer. I arrived little late and I apologized for the delay. I also informed her of the accident that morning. She wrote a report and told me to see neurosurgeon as soon as possible since I had neck and shoulder surgery 2 years ago if not it would lead to paralysis after accident. I made an appointment with my neurosurgeon he’s on holiday vacation until January the first week. I’m cautious about the possibility of a balance and fall. I begin to notice that I have dizziness. I will go to the hospital near Orlando if getting worse. I don’t live in Chicago but I’m a Florida resident!! Accident happened in Trinity, Florida at 6:23 AM because of SafePilot and photos that showed up the location of the accident and the time!! I told several professionals that you DENIED to take my case. Florida lawyers at Disparti are one of my favorites and you WANTED me to find another lawyer. Not one of other lawyers besides Disparti!  I thought I would help you make money against the driver and she was on the phone while driving!! Nice of you denied taking my case even though she has a different insurance company. I thought I would depend on you and your handling the car accident and my injury. Now I am disgusted, disappointed and beyond my shock at the time of the accident. I feel very discouraged and rejected by you!! I am not going to find another lawyer that sure wastes my time. Disparti is located in New Port Richey area. I spoke to sheriff about the accident and he said since traffic that morning would delay at least an hour, he was pleased that we weren’t arguing about the accident. Oddly, the driver and I live in the same city driving towards Tampa!! I like the sheriff for his time to talk to me, he looked at my car and said it looked pretty bad especially the door that can’t open. I have panic attacks since the accident, I worry about driving! I saw my daughter who is a head registered nurse and explained my symptoms and anxiety to her. She couldn’t understand why you rejected me.  I am not going into the details. In the future, I am not sure that I trust you again because of rejection. I used to recommend anyone to come to your firm not now I would tell them I would check with my friends. I wish you well. This name is my nickname.

leads.address: 3901 Santa Rita Rd Ste. A, Pleasanton, CA 94588, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
We’ve taken both our dogs, Ellie and Lolli, to Animal Medical Center for vaccines and routine care — and have had repeated issues with professionalism and consistency. Take your time to read the other low reviews.

First, they gave Ellie the wrong vaccine due to a clerical error. Mistakes happen, and we let that slide. Later, during treatment for Giardia, they kept performing unnecessary and premature tests and kept her on medication much longer than needed. A second opinion from another vet confirmed this and helped resolve the issue properly.

Most recently, when we went back for Ellie’s annual vaccinations, we were told we couldn’t be seen because we hadn’t followed “compliance” on the Giardia case — even though we had completed treatment with another licensed vet. We were told to bring proof, which we did — both printed and emailed. Despite that, we were refused service again and spoken to rudely and dismissively by the staff.

It’s one thing to make a medical mistake; it’s another to treat customers disrespectfully and refuse service after they’ve followed instructions. This practice clearly values internal ego over professionalism and compassion.

There are many vets in the tri valley area who are more competent, organized, and ethical. I strongly suggest taking your pets elsewhere, even if it costs a little more

leads.address: 203 N La Salle Dr #2100, Chicago, IL 60601, USA

leads.worst_review_text:
I had just adopted a 6 year old rescue from the local county shelter and wanted to schedule a first appointment checkup.

When I called I was on hold for 20 minutes so I scheduled the appointment online while I was on hold for 1pm on 5/5. Around 11am before the appointment, I received a call that the doctor needed to leave and the receptionist asked if I could come early. I said yes I can come right away after picking up my child from school at 12. At 12:20 received another call rushing me in if she is to be seen. The receptionist told me I need to arrive by 12:30. Luckily I arrived at 12:29, I was then checked in but after taking her weight was told that I would have to drop her off and leave her there for a few hours or reschedule. I wasn’t ok leaving her for hours as I just adopted her and she had spent the last month locked up in the shelter. I was also told that they couldn’t see me because the previous appointment needed X-Rays and they didn’t have time to see my dog and do the other dogs X-Rays. In summary, due to being asked to come in earlier than my appointment and then Dr. April Yvonne D’Monte no longer having time because her previous appointment took longer than she expected, my dog was not able to receive the care she deserved.

The whole experience was extremely unprofessional!

I was told that cremation return and euthansia at my regular vet would be 450.00, with no charge for the euthansia  I called Sage and was told it would be 495.00. leads.worst_review_text: I would give less than one star. Do NOT take your sweet pet here! I started bringing my dog when the practice first opened in 2011 and loved Dr. Keri and Dr. trippi.  The practice was bought out by a conglomerate.  The office staff and Dr. Burns are unbelievably rude and uncaring.  I have 3 dogs and our new puppy got very sick after getting a vaccine there yesterday. I called asking to bring him in as he had non stop diarrhea and vomiting.  He wouldn’t drink or eat. I asked if we could bring him in for fluids and anti nausea meds, they said they’d call me back.  They didn’t so I called them and was placed on eternal hold.  Then told they’d call me back again.  I told them that he was very weak and needed help.  She refused to have him come in & hung up on me.  I called back 2 more times and was hung up on. I expressed my displeasure on how they were treating a long time customer with a sick puppy from a vaccine they had given the previous afternoon. Dr. Burns called, accused me of swearing, told me the calls had been recorded, wouldn’t let me speak and threatened to prevent me from being a client there.  She lied!  I never swore! She actually said that she was trying to help, when in fact they didn’t call back, didn’t offer to see him or treat him. She and her staff are liars, she actually said I that her staff said I don’t want treatment.  Why would I call and ask to bring my dog in twice for treatment?  Obviously they are liars! They don’t care about you furry family, and have horrible customer service.  I have been going there since 2011 - we love Dr. Keri, but the practice has gone down hill.  You can’t be seen when your pet is sick and have to go to the ER. What’s the point of having them as a vet? they have too many clients and too few doctors.  Dr. Burns is horrible!!!!  I am getting my records and going to find a new vet!  Beware!  If you love your pet, don’t take them here!

leads.worst_review_text: Scheduled an appointment for a Swedish massage online and paid online.  I was told they were busy and when I tried to set up another appointment they told me to call them.  The fact that they don’t check their own website for appointments and couldn’t reschedule me when I was there in person was unprofessional. Won’t be coming back.

I usually don’t ever review. And even this place I wasn’t gonna review even though I wasn’t really happy with my massage. But after my interaction when the masseuse really complained to me about my tip!!! I came in for a 90min massage ($108) most the time I would give atleast $40 tip for 90mins. And im a really generous tipper too! So for me to even give $20 after below average service was alot for me. The massage was very mid. It felt like auto pilot she was repeating the same motion and not adjusting to some of my tense areas that needed more attention because my back been tense all week from my workouts. Half way during massage I just wanted it to end already. With that being said maybe it’s her first time w me so whatever. As I’m walking out I gave her $20 and she gave me a nasty look and said “that’s it?” “You can’t give $10 more?” “Usually 90mins is atleast $30 for tip” and I was like what?! First of all that’s really rude! Then I told her “trust me I usually give at least $40 tip for 90min service but I wasn’t happy w your massage” she same something under her breath then walked away and didn’t even say “thank you” or “have a good day” or anything. I can’t speak for other masseuses here but the one I had ruined it for me.

leads.worst_review_text:
Absolutely ridiculous experience. My friend just had a newborn, and we carefully planned a surprise gift to arrive a week before her expected delivery date — sending our love from overseas. Weeks later, she still hadn’t received anything, even though the tracking system showed “delivered.”
I had clearly provided my friend’s mobile number, yet no one from the courier even contacted her on the supposed delivery date. After chasing them for answers, they claimed the parcel was “delivered” to a driving school! Seriously? Then they had the nerve to say the €57 parcel is considered lost and that they cannot arrange to redeliver the same items.
Their only “solution” — potentially a refund after 10 days, while we’re forced to repurchase everything ourselves and wait again, hoping it won’t end up at another “driving school.” No compensation. No apology. No sense of accountability.
Utterly disappointing, unprofessional, and insulting. Will never purchase from NEXT again.

leads.worst_review_text: Sadly an awful experience. I took my old cat to revision because I noticed he was acting weird. After being seen and taken a blood and urine samples on Monday, the laboratory called me on Wednesday to communicate the cat has thyroid and I had to collect medication for him. I went same day and I gave the cat his medication. However he didn't improve not even a little, so I called to the emergency number, on Thursday morning, explained the situation, and I asked for an appointment for a same day as  matter of urgency. The kid that was at the phone said that wasn't possible, and he only offered me a vet call next day evening, also I had to paid for the consultation. Sadly during the night I had to see how the cat suffer, and I see him exhale Friday morning. He suffered, he couldn't find peace that night. I feel responsible but I really would have appreciate if someone have heard that was an emergency. I explained the cat wasn't look good at all, and I was worried, and I need it a vet appointment. Also I believe the cat didn't get the right diagnosis from first day and then their "emergency number "clearly doesn't know what's an emergency. I just wanted to prevent people and get a second vet opinion if you belive your pet is sick and don't trust completely their first diagnosis. I truly thought they knew, and i trusted but I am sure the cat has more conditions, not only the thiroid. ( the cat it was a stray cat that I took in home)  I know this is a charity, but I think they should care a bit more a the patients, the pets. I would have preferred to put down my cat instead of seeing him suffer as he did. That will break my heart forever.

leads.worst_review_text:
After reading past reviews and being told about this place, I stopped by for an Alert message diagnosis on my 2010 GL Mercedes.  I specifically asked office manager Corey why they would charge $188 for initial diagnostic, and whether it was simply connecting their diagnostic scanner, and I was told that they spend time with the car, and that it's much more than simply reading the scanner. After walking around for an hour, I came back to see they hadn't moved the car into the bay, and I went for another walk about.  After 45 more minutes I received text alert from them that the car is "all set" and a picture of the scanner with an alert message was included. I walked back to find the car in the same exact spot (I had marked the spot) and was told that the repair would cost between $1500-2000!! They charged $188 for connecting the scanner and sending me a picture of it. That's it, probably took them 5 -10 minutes. They hadn't moved the car one inch and kept me walking around for nearly 2 hours to justify the rip-off fee they charge for diagnosis.  It's a scam, and they're liars and cheats! I don't know if they're good mechanics or not, but I know they're untrustworthy and should be avoided.  Your local repair shop, gas station mechanic has the same device and will likely give you the diagnostic reading at no, or very little, charge. Buyer beware!

PS The issue with the car is stability control program (ESP) and even the dealer charges $800-1000 to fix it, not $1500-2000. A recent alignment may have caused the sensor to be malfunctioning and may be corrected by re-doing the alignment.  Will report back.  Either way, lesson learned. $188 cost to avoid falling into a much bigger trap at Ming's Auto. Shame on them.

leads.business_name: London Regional Veterinary Emergency and Referral Hospital
leads.address: 41 Adelaide St N, London, ON N6B 3P4, Canada
leads.worst_review_text:
Brought a very injured suffering raccoon to this clinic last night around 9pm to be euthanized - I called prior and was advised I could bring him here - also confirmed with multiple wildlife resources and OPP as well.

The two girls working the front desk last night were completely prepared to turn me away and did not want to take him in, even after I expressed how he is suffering. The one girl advised they don’t take wildlife and expected me to leave with this raccoon with no further info.  I asked her if they’ve ever taken wildlife before and she said yes, I then again told her I called and was advised by multiple places to bring to this vet. She tried again to turn me away and said sorry can’t help you.

It wasn’t only until I pushed back further she decided to go and check in back with someone. She then sauntered back over to me and said okay we can take him.  Absolutely unacceptable. This poor animal!

At this point I was pretty upset and said this is ridiculous that you would turn me away.  Then the other girl started chiming in and said a phone call to LACC for consent was required and they were all of a sudden well versed in the process to admit the animal.  When I asked them why they didn’t just do this in the beginning instead of going back and forth for 10 min and trying to get me to leave, they said there was a breakdown in communication.

As an EMERGENCY vet the front staff should be doing everything in their power to HELP not turn people with their animals away.  Especially animals that are severely suffering, wild or not.

I hope the facility manager sees this and contacts me if further information required.

The lady who did help from the back, I think her name was Jenn?  FANTASTIC. Empathetic and not rushy like the two girls on front desk. THANK YOU. 🙏🏼

leads.worst_review_text: There are stylish clothes, but IMO too expensive for what they are. You’re paying for the brand and name, not the quality. Even when goods are on sale, nothing I can buy that is worth the price tag, unfortunately.

The Food Hall layout needs a rethink, particularly the Organic section. Salad items and fruit and veg right next to RAW meat, not just offensive to vegetarians but totally wrong and unhygienic (potato’s next to raw chicken, lettuce and cucumbers right next to a rack of lamb, what the heck??). Also shelves are too high causing wastage (example organic blueberries on top shelf not displayed properly and hard to reach).

Westfield London Review

Staring Primark and John Lewis

Despite the declining appeal of high street shopping. Westfield offers excellent shopping facilities.

Always places to sit down without having to spend money.

Toilets are immaculately kept and always clean.

Brilliant family rooms and free water fountains.

Superb natural light, for a very pleasant laptop working environment.

It's a shame the performance of the retailers let Westfield down.

Behind the fancy shopfronts and big names, the shopping experience is poor.
You're better off finding a nice comfortable place to sit and shopping online.

Shopping staff do not know enough about the products they sell. That's if you can find a member of staff to help you.
They simply process your purchase and that's it. You might as well buy online, with that level of service.

The food is overpriced and nothing special. You can't find a seat in the affordable mcdonald's. If you're wealthy or are having and extravagant day, you will probably find somewhere good to eat. Otherwise go to the Wetherspoon across road or bring in your KFC.

The shopping experience is not as enjoyable as it used to be. But this is not down to Westfield, but the retailers.

Primark and John Lewis are the stars of Westfield. Right next to each other, but at opposite ends of the shopping experience.

With Primark, it cheap and cheerful, you get what you pay for.
With john Lewis, staff actually say hello to you and are available to help and answer questions. Old fashioned shopping experience.
leads.ai_response_draft:
Good point about the retailers vs the facilities. John Lewis does set the bar for service compared to most of the other stores.

- Westfield London

leads.worst_review_text:
Generally the store is OK but the restaurant on the top floor is not.

There was no queue for the restaurant.
There were lots of customers sat at the tables and there were quite a few tables free but dirty.

When we purchased our items, we looked for a free table. A lot of the tables (not the long table) had dirty plates/cup etc the floor was also dirty.

The photo I have uploaded where there is food on the floor, it wasn't ours. I used a stool to cover over this mess as we sat at this table as there was no other option for a table of 3 free. It really was just disgusting.

The long tables were free but not many people wanted to sit there, I guess no one wants be centre of attention in the open. People mainly sat at the smaller tables, which is what we wanted.

We sat near the till and watched new customers encounter the same problem as we did.

When we took some metal spoons to use, we noticed they were so dirty, they had not been cleaned properly.  Due to this and the lack of cleanliness in the restaurant, I decided to speak to the cashier.
The answer I received was, they were short staffed and she requested me to complain on the first floor at customer services, which is what I did.
We went along to the first floor and spoke to a man who said he will pass on my complaint to the manager the next day, when he was in. Who knows if this was passed on and actioned.

It was very disappointing that there seemed to be enough catering staff on the counter areas but not enough staff on the floor to clear up. It doesn't make any sense.

I wanted to take more photos but there were people sitting at the tables nearby and I didn't want to invade their privacy.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The restaurant state you described is unacceptable - dirty tables, food on floors and unclean cutlery isn't the standard we want. I'll personally follow up on whether your complaint reached our restaurant manager and make sure we get proper floor staff scheduled.

- John Lewis & Partners

leads.worst_review_text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Harrods is not just a department store — it is an experience, a destination, and a masterpiece of luxury.

From the moment you walk through its iconic doors, you are immersed in a world where elegance, craftsmanship, and excellence live in perfect harmony. Every floor tells a story, every detail feels intentional, and every visit feels unforgettable.

The restaurants and food halls alone are worth the journey. From refined fine dining to beautifully curated international cuisine, each space offers exceptional quality, impeccable service, and an atmosphere that feels both indulgent and welcoming. The presentation, the flavors, and the attention to detail are simply world-class.

The shopping experience is unparalleled. Whether exploring haute couture, timeless fashion, exquisite jewelry, home décor, or beauty, Harrods offers an extraordinary selection that reflects the highest standards of luxury. The staff is knowledgeable, gracious, and attentive without ever being intrusive — making every interaction feel personal and elevated.

What truly sets Harrods apart is the way it makes you feel: inspired, pampered, and transported. It is a place where tradition meets innovation, where heritage and modern luxury coexist effortlessly.

Harrods is not something you simply visit — it is something you remember.
A must-experience landmark in London that continues to set the global standard for luxury retail and dining.

✨ Absolutely unforgettable.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The food halls are something special - glad you experienced that side of Harrods too.

- Harrods

leads.business_name: International District Medical and Dental Clinic (ICHS) - International Community Health Services
leads.worst_review_text: i am writing this review with deep disappointment and troubling experience after our recent visit to this clinic, which occurred despite our punctuality in arriving at 9am for my two years old brother’s appointment. i have to question whether the medical staff in this clinic are fully aware of or practicing the relevant laws and regulations. this is especially concerning after the excessive blood draw from my two years old brother, which was beyond pediatric guidelines, and the lack of proper communication and informed consent. telling me that there is a significant lapse in following legal standards at the clinic. we anticipated the usual long wait times but were unprepared for the shocking and potentially harmful treatment he received. what transpired was far beyond our expectations and has left us extremely distressed. despite the fact that my brother is a toddler, medical staff proceeded to draw an excessive amount of blood from my brother—four full sized bottles. that clearly seemed like they were more than 2ml. this is not only against pediatric guidelines but also poses a significant risk to a child his age. the recommended amount for a blood culture bottle is the child’s age in milliliters, which should have been no more than 2ml for my brother. yet, the amount taken was clearly far in excess of this limit. throughout the process, the staff seemed indifferent to our concerns, showed a lack of concern and provided no justification for their actions. they never mentioned to my mom or me about my brother having draw four bottles of blood. my brother, who also suffers from amnesia, was subjected to this traumatic and dangerous procedure without any consideration for his well being. the fact that he must undergo this every three months is deeply concerning and raises questions about the long-term effects on his health. drawing such a large volume of blood repeatedly could worsen his amnesia and weaken his immune function, not to mention the trauma this will inflict on a young child. while the clinic staff did apologize and mention that they will inform us of the number of blood bottles to be drawn next time, seeking our consent, this does not fully address the concerns raised. the focus should not be on merely seeking consent for potentially excessive procedures, but rather on ensuring that the procedures themselves are medically necessary, safe, and in line with pediatric guidelines. while the clinic staff did apologize and mention that they will inform us of the number of blood bottles to be drawn next time and seek our consent, this does not fully address the concerns raised. the focus should be on ensuring that the procedures themselves are medically necessary, safe, and in line with pediatric guidelines. the clinic needs to conduct a thorough investigation to determine why the excessive blood draw occurred and review and revise their protocols to align with established pediatric standards. i don’t know why this even needs to be said, but clinic staff should receive comprehensive training on handling pediatric patients with care, sensitivity, and proper communication, prioritizing patient safety and well being. also, the nurse only informed us that the medical staff had added two blood draw orders after we questioned them why they drew four bottles of blood. leads.business_name: NextCare Urgent Care Phoenix - E. Thomas Road
leads.address: 1701 E Thomas Rd A-104, Phoenix, AZ 85016, USA
leads.worst_review_text: If I could give 0 or negative stars, I 100% would. I went in a few days ago as a Type 1 Diabetic having an emergency hypoglycemic episode and uncontrollably throwing up. If this is the only line you read, DO NOT GO SEE PAC YEN LUU. When I arrived there was no sense of urgency nor a care in the world. I was waiting for about 10-15 minutes to been seen, which seems like a short time, however when you’re hypoglycemic there needs to be more urgency. The PA decided I needed glucose gel, however she had no idea if they had it in clinic nor any other glucose available. Ridiculous for an immediate care to have “nothing.” She eventually found a source of glucose and administered it, then called 911 after I asked her not to on 3 separate occasions since I knew I just needed glucose. She called anyway and I respected her medical opinion. The EMTs arrive and instantly know exactly what to do to calm me down and actually HELP, meanwhile the doctor is checking in every so often and making comments about me instead of helping. She walks in and I am just drained physically and emotionally. I sweat a lot when I’m urgently low and instead of walking in, noticing it, and helping me wipe it, she walks in with a disgusted look and says “oh you’re like really sweaty.” I was thinking “…okay, help me wipe it or don’t comment on it?” My episode was so bad I was unable to speak, continued slurring my words, couldn’t think, walk, or do anything independently, and she’s going to make a comment like this about me? I tried to move past it and just focus on what’s going on in the moment. She was acting with NO sense of urgency whatsoever. Even the EMTs got snappy with her to do her job faster. She didn’t know how to print a report and instead of trying to figure it out, she stood in the doorway of my clinical room. Literally just standing. When I was leaving, I declined going in the ambulance which EMTs stated was fine. The doctor didn’t agree with my decision, as I was exiting the room the ENTIRE nurses station was staring at me saying things like “look at her, she looks TERRIBLE” and similar statements. Are you kidding? I know I probably look terrible, I FEEL terrible, but why are you commenting on it? I’m 5 feet away from you I can clearly hear you all. I felt extremely disrespected the entire time I was there by staff. The only “nice” one to me was the security guard in the lobby who gave me a box of tissues to help clean myself up after I vomited in the lobby. I only went to this location because it was the only one open at the time I went in. Never again will I visit this location, even if my life depends on it.
leads.ai_response_draft:
This is completely unacceptable care for a diabetic emergency. PAC Luu and our staff failed you when you needed help most, and those comments were unprofessional and cruel. Please call me directly at the clinic so we can address this properly.

leads.worst_review_text: Made an appointment to get a medication refilled that I had previously had filled at the same location. She acted like I was in the wrong or that the whole situation was somehow my fault and didn't back off until I reminded her that I hadn't personally done anything. I understand the protocols they have and am not even upset that I have to go through other channels to get my prescription, I'm upset with paying money and taking time out of my day to be chastised for something I had no control over and then leave with nothing more than an unnecessary order for lab results so they can bill my insurance and get paid. She insisted by the way that I get the lab work done and made it sound like 6 months is a long time to go without a visit, which if you've ever regularly gone to a general practitioner before, it's not. It was a money grab on my way out to make sure they could at least profit off of this waste of my time. No wonder this place has such low reviews across the board.

**Update: This manager is still sending me texts defending herself and tells me “a little kindness goes a long ways”. Too bad she didn’t practice what she’s preaching.

leads.worst_review_text:
The front desk asked what I was coming in for and I mentioned abdominal stomach issues. Once I got to see the provider, the provider explained that they don't have access to diagnostic tools beyond a urine dip test. I was then offered a Maalox drink and suggested I go to their 660 bannock adult urgent care the next day if I wanted to get a more comprehensive diagnosis.

This location should have been more transparent upfront that their location had limited tools to help diagnose abdominal pain. I would have gladly gone to their 660 bannock adult urgent care had I been advised before starting the visit. I expect to be billed $175 since I saw the provider. Inconclusive visit, a quick buck for the organization, and a poor use of my time and money.

I have been coming here for 2 years for treatment. I have received mixed experiences from providers. For the most part the doctor visit part has been great (except for one weird interaction where the doctor was clearly annoyed with my questions). Libby was great but she’s no longer there.

I’m writing this review because this is the 3rd time that my supposed primary care physicians office (more the admin team) has made finding out information about my own health extremely difficult. All in all, I could keep going back, but at some point you have to ask yourself when enough is enough.

I called 3 times about the same thing and was told 3 different things by 3 different people. It resulted in me having to rush to an urgent care untimely when all of the rushing could have been avoided if they just actually did/communicated what they were actually doing instead of lying about it?

Weird for doctors offices to not tell the truth and not even call you back when they fix their mistake. Had to find out from the pharmacist lol.

leads.address: 1660 S Albion St #619, Denver, CO 80222, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
If you are a homeowner considering working with Colorado RPM for their rental management services please reconsider. Over the one year they managed my rental property the following happened:
- Delayed communication
- I was charged $150 for a plumber who found nothing wrong with a toilet the tenants claimed was not working.
- I was informed the current tenants decided not to renew their lease 23 days before the lease ended. Tenants are contractually obligated to communicate their intention not to renew 60-days prior.
- The tenants moved out after one year and the house was filthy, the carpet needed to be replaced, there was a couch in the garage, the yard was overgrown with weeds and appeared to have not been tended to at all during the emote year.
- After leaving the house in this manner they told me the cost for having the lock box picked up was $45 and if I wanted to keep it was $30.

What tenants do and do not do cannot be controlled, but if the tenants do not comply with the rules they set forth in the lease it is the company's responsibility. At least don't charge me $45 for a lockbox pick up. Customer service!

Addition as of 7/08/2025
As per CRPM's response to this review, the photos speak for themselves. This is the state in which the house was returned to me after only one year. It is costing me nearly $6000 to remove junk, landscape and deep clean to the property's previous condition.

Please read other reviews on google, Yelp and the better business bureau to get a fuller picture. My pain points are shared by many others.

I am not a business professional. However, common courtesy and common sense go a long way. You do not have to have an MBA to know that the way to mitigate a situation like this is to 1 - acknowledge a mistake was made, 2 - take responsibility for the mistake and 3 - apologize/compensate.  Continuing to antagonize an unhappy customer by getting defensive and justifying mistakes online is not good business or good common sense. Also, pointing out that charging $30 for a lockbox is "standard protocol" when I've shared pictures of a house that will cost approximately $6000 to bring back to pre-tenant condition demonstrates the stinginess of this business. A wise and savvy business would offer this nominal voucher to the client as an apology. Because losing $30 will not break the bank for this business. But, losing multiple potential future clients due to a bad review and a defensive response could result in thousands of dollars of revenue in the long term. Again, I'm not a business person, just someone with some good old common sense.

leads.worst_review_text: This is an extremely disappointing Life Time Fitness and I’m frustrated that Life Time corporate has let this location sink so low. The front desk staff were rude, chatting amongst each other, and didn’t acknowledge me upon entering. The weight room has zero natural light and scant mirrors. The layout of the equipment is odd. The men’s locker room was deplorable — very little light, my locker door was missing a hinge, there were missing towel hooks in the men’s spa area, there were towels overflowing the towel return, and there was no water pressure in the shower. I pay a fortune for my Life Time membership and fortunately live closer to Denver West which is much nicer. Don’t be fooled by its location, there is nothing Cherry Creek about this Life Time. leads.address: 2253 S Monaco St Pkwy, Denver, CO 80222, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Update in January 2026 - still no hot water for showers!!  I pay for the more expensive membership so I can swim.  When you get out of the pool soaking wet and cold, you need a hot shower.  But once again there was no hot water this morning.  I told the front desk staff who made the same excuses I've heard before (the gym was busy and the hot water heaters can't keep up).  Well it wasn't as busy as it can easily get and instead of making excuses, why not get water heaters, or a system, that can keep up with demand?  Or stop selling memberships until you can keep enough hot water for your members who are already paying??  And yesterday's shower fun was having to pick up a big wad of hair that was clogging the drain and throw it away.  All the other showers were full so no chance to move.

Earlier review from December:

I left my last gym because they were not taking care of the equipment.  At first Chuze was good about this, but now this gym has gone way downhill (writing this in December 2025).  I routinely point out bikes that do not work, where the lever that tightly closes on the handlebars and seats and keeps them in place has gotten weak and no longer snaps into place.  This is so dangerous as I have had a bike part collapse on me before and I was injured.  At best, it’s annoying for the seat and handlebars to rock back and forth all through your workout.  These bikes do NOT get fixed, but sometimes get moved around.  The accessible shower in the women’s locker room was out of commission for months, only got fixed for a short time and is now unavailable again.  There are already lines for the shower; just imagine when January hits!  One of the shower heads is broken, another shower has a valve that doesn’t tightly close so water drips out, and some shower doors are broken with sharp edges.  Sometimes you get hot water, other times you don’t (for weeks at a time).  The blow dryers that are broken don’t get replaced for weeks.  About half of the lockers are out of order.  This is so unacceptable when theft is a big problem at this gym.  I’ve had 3 friends get their stuff stolen from the locker room.  When I point out all these problems to staff, I’m told that they already put a work order in for that thing or that management won’t pay for the necessary repairs.  Even when I point out bikes that don’t work to the maintenance man, they don’t get fixed.  They had a weight tower on the turf floor with smaller weights and weights in small increments: 2, 4, 6, 8, etc. pounds.  These were regularly used by people like me doing physical therapy and general exercises.  I came in one day recently and they were gone!  Replaced by a smaller set of weights at 5, 7.5, 10, etc. pounds.  The exact same weights that you can already get along the weight wall.  I begged to get the smaller weights back to continue to do my PT, but were told they were “gone”.  A lot of people used these so for them to disappear was totally frustrating!  And now the TVs that line the entire gym have things on like the Flintstones and never-ending infomercials!  I asked a couple days ago if the TV near me could be put on the news, but was told they weren’t showing news anymore to not offend anyone!  Well, having to watch an informercial or the Flintstones for 30 minutes to an hour is MORE annoying!!  This is an adult gym, why can’t we have news programs on??  Soon all the people with their New Year’s resolutions will descend on the gym, and the problems already plaguing members will get worse!!  Management, get with it and fix this gym!!  I would NOT recommend this gym.

leads.business_name: UW Medical Center - Montlake | Seattle Hospital
leads.address: 1959 NE Pacific St Main Hospital, Seattle, WA 98195, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
This hospital is ridiculous. We were in the emergency room for two hours, and only four patients were moved into room rooms. A girl came in, obviously unable to breathe, and the receptionist raised his voice at her saying he couldn’t hear her, made her repeat everything, and then repeated all of her personal private information loudly in front of everyone in the waiting room. When she asked for something to help her breathe he rudely told her that he “didn’t do that” and left her crying in the waiting room. When her name was called, she stumbled and dropped her purse and the nurse just watched as she tried to gather her things.
When we finally got into a room, the doctor forgot to put in the patient’s pain medication and the patient had to ask about it over an hour later. We waited for an x-ray for an hour and a half before the patient then had to go up to the nursing station where all the nurses and doctor were laughing together and having coffee. No one had put in the order for x-ray that entire time. There was a urine cup left in our room for the entire four hours that we were in there. A staff loudly complained that we were still in our room in front of our curtain and was audibly frustrated by the fact that we were there. When the patient asked about one of the results in her CAT scan the doctor had to go back and read that chart because he had no idea what she was talking about. It wasn’t until discharge that the doctor noticed that no one had cleaned or dressed the open wound on the patients leg in the four hours we were there. After we left there were supposed to be several pain prescriptions to administer at home and the doctor did not put in those orders. When we called to see if we could get the prescriptions put in they told us that we would have to go back in to the emergency department to do all of that over again in order to get a prescription. Just absolutely ridiculous.

leads.address: 901 Boren Ave Ste 705, Seattle, WA 98104, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Gender-affirming care? Yeah right.

Hands down the worst care I have ever received from a doctor. I had a complex gender-affirming surgery that resulted in two complications, both very slow to heal wounds and a MRSA infection. I wasn't getting adequate follow-up care with my surgery team, so I reached out to my PCP at Cap Hill Medical for a referral to a wound healing center. My PCP blocked every effort I made to get this referral. First he said that insurance wouldn't cover a second opinion. Then, when I called insurance and verified that it would be covered, he continued to ignore my request for a referral, reiterating that I should seek advice from my surgery team and "ask to speak to the surgeon." I wouldn't have been asking for a second opinion if my surgery team had provided decent care. My surgeon was utterly unavailable, literally never even in the same building. After two weeks of back and forth, I finally gave up and went to a Zoomcare, where they provided the referral and honestly seemed dismayed that my wounds had gone so long untreated.

Additionally, I needed regular labs done for my hormone levels and had done so every six months through Cap Hill medical. In January, as a fun surprise, my PCP added vitamin D testing to my panel without asking my consent, resulting in a $306 uncovered charge. He never apologized. I am still going back and forth with insurance and Labcorp to resolve it, 11 months later.

I prefer to give feedback directly rather than just posting reviews. I shared all of this feedback with my PCP, but never received an apology, or even a response.

My wife was loyal to Cap Hill Medical for years and has always spoken highly of Dr. Rongisch. All I can say is that her practice has gone WAY downhill and she should pay closer attention to the staff she's hiring.

All around terrible experience with this clinic, up to to and including HIPAA violation (they uploaded another patient's confidential medical info to my own MyChart test results — we don't even have similar names.)

Outside of that, on multiple occasions I've needed referrals to outside providers, and each time have had a nearly impossible time getting my provider at Country Doctor/Seattle Roots to put the referrals through correctly (sending faxes to the wrong numbers, taking weeks to send them or simply not sending them at all, faxing referrals with incomplete info, etc) which has resulted in delays of weeks or months in receiving care from outside specialists.

This is also the only clinic where I've ever walked out of an appointment, after being apparently forgotten about in an exam room for half an hour when the nurse went to get a flu shot. I have pretty basic healthcare needs, and still had a terrible time getting them met at this clinic — I can't imagine how much worse it would be for someone managing complex or multiple conditions/medications.

leads.address: Pacific Tower, 1200 12th Ave S, Seattle, WA 98144, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
I have had mixed experiences here. Unfortunately more bad than good.
Karen Wong, now retired, told me my symptoms and what I was experiencing as “maybe your psyching yourself out” and “maybe you should see a dermatologist in 6 months” for a symptom that could have been taken care of in under a month. I go to a Dr. for practical advice, not to suggest I’m making up health problems.
I later went to a Swedish Healthcare Dr. who confirmed I need antibiotics and other treatment plans, but only because I followed Dr. Wong’s advice and waited too long! They did admit the diagnosis was difficult, however. Dr. Wong sent me away with an excessive, do it yourself wait period, when I needed a referral.
Another Dr., Amanda B Methvin, who I think does not practice here anymore, tried to talk me out of taking medication that I needed a prescription renewal for a mental disorder! I was upset at how consistent she said that, your goal is to get off medication, not to continue using it.
I was disheartened with the lack of empathy about my needs. You may be a Dr. but I am not making up my health problems to take a very common anxiety medication. Escitalopram. It’s not an addictive medication and I have a mental health diagnosis… that is painfully clear to renew my prescription.

Some good experiences,
Decent mental health therapists, physical therapists, pharmacy and dental hygienists next door but I the dentist is a different entity. I never had issues with scheduling, health insurance, timely appointments, payments or any technical issues, the MyChart app is great. Staff are friendly or at least somewhat short and neutral haha.
I noticed my experience here generally revolved around Drs. meandering around an issue when I’m looking for you to tell me the next step, a referral, or tell me what information do you need to confirm my diagnosis? I was treated like a child, complaining, ok goodbye. Please listen to your patients attentively and offer solutions, please do not dismiss patients so quickly.
I am choosing to not return here, and I am saddened as this is a convenient location around a lovely forested area in Beacon Hill. I’ve seen other patients give good reviews so maybe still worth visiting!

I'm surprised to see all the hate on here for Dr. Kim Carney. I've never experienced this 'attitude' from her that other people are seeing. She's always been pleasant and helpful to me. I have diabetes, arthritis, high cholesterol, and other chronic conditions so my appts usually take some time and she's never been rushed or rude to me about it. I can understand frustration on her part at times because they way overbook here and it takes at least 2 months to get an appointment. Everybody has bad days, including doctors and I suppose people only do reviews to point out the negative (myself included). Anyways, I've decided to change clinics to Fransiscan because/ A. My PCP Kim left the clinic/ B. A lot of the staff there, including at the pharmacy, have very heavy accents and trying to understand them over the phone is a frustrating situation. I spent 30 minutes on the phone with their pharmacy once JUST trying to see if my meds were ready and the lady i was talking to spoke very broken English. Finally the pharmacist got on to help me. I know this isn't their fault but I dont have time to sit on the phone while someone is trying to learn the language./ C. This place is not clean, it's very rundown/ and D. It takes FOREVER to get an appt! The staff has always been pleasant tho, so 2 stars for that.

The medical providers I have worked with for over 10 years have been great. The Neurologists are have been quite good and the nurses at the infusion center are my absolute favorite thing about receiving care here (they'd get 5 stars if I were only rating them). My issues is with the billing department. I have been dealing with the billing department here for the 10+ years that I've been going here. They make having a chronic illness even worse than it already is. Just dealing with their ineptitude is like having a second full-time job. There was one, ONE, blissful year that a saint worked in the billing department that made sure my account was handled correctly. I am part of a financial assistance program through the pharmaceutical company that provides the drug I need for MS and every month (except the 12 aforementioned blissful ones) I have had to call and make sure they send the post-insurance remainder to Biogen, and every month they don't do it. Which eventually leads me to being sent to collections, which then leads me to reaching out to Biogen (who has been excellent BTW) to confirm that I didn't somehow get kicked out of their financial assistance program and confirm that Virginia Mason hasn't filed a claim with them, which then leads me to calling Virginia Mason Billing to ask them to file a claim with Biogen....which may or may not happen by the time the next invoice rolls around. And repeat that over and over again every month for 10 years. Oh and the newest thing is that I'm still getting multiple thousands of dollars invoices but Biogen has sent them the checks, they've cashed them and they are still invoicing me saying it hasn't been paid AND sending me to collections! Then they ask me to just be patient. Also, since they were bought by the religious health organization "Franciscan Health" things have only gotten worse. You can't email billing anymore, you can only call, meaning you have to use more time out of your workday to sort out what someone else does for their full-time job. The only reason I haven't switched to is because of how much more work it would be to transfer care....but I'm close.

leads.address: 2101 E Yesler Wy # 150, Seattle, WA 98122, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Seattle Roots Community Health organization took advantage of me as a TENANT/PATIENT by violating my rights to patient safety, access to official and patient-centered complaint process, by subjecting me repeatedly to inappropriate non-consensual hugging and touching by a DOCTOR and other  misconduct that has caused immense predictable harm.

Healthcare workers are among the most important people in our societies and fill a roll that demands unrelenting ethical commitment to SAFETY, BOUNDARIES AND STANDARDS.

This organization has failed at that and caused me awful emotional, physical and psychological harm.

And they have not taken responsibility AT ALL for their glaring missteps and mistreatment of a vulnerable PATIENT/TENANT.

Disgusting conduct from a ‘medical physician’.

leads.address: 325 9th Ave Main Hospital, Seattle, WA 98104, USA
leads.worst_review_text: Absolutely the worst patient service I've ever seen. I have over 22 years clinical experience at Seattle Children's and have traveled the country teaching clinical specialties with anesthesia (including HV). I did most of my clinical rotation at HV. If your dying or homeless it's great, other than that, get the hell out. The incompetence and HIPPA violations are outrageous. Within 24 hrs they lost my glasses and still haven't replaced them. They didn't even care. Their mission statement is a complete lie.

I am a refugee and I don't understand English. I got my first time vaccination here and I want to get my second time vaccination here, but they can't help me and don't provide Chinese translation. The receptionist's attitude is also very bad. This is how they serve refugees on the fourth floor.
