leads.worst_review_text:
Came here today on a guest pass. I was planning on signing up for a membership after today’s visit. Unfortunately, there are quite a few aspects that need improving before I’d do so.

Positives:
-The two staff members working at reception were very friendly and helpful.
-I loved the layout of the weights areas with semi-private “alcoves” to work out in.
-The old school, industrial architecture and exposed brick is very cool.
-The whole facility is very spacious and didn’t feel crowded at all despite quite a few people being there.

Areas for improvement:
-The men’s sauna (one of the main reasons I’d want to join) was barely warm due to the poorly installed glass door that has a large gap. A few members in there said they had complained about it, but it still hadn’t been fixed.
-The sauna had a clump of disgusting hair on the floor; a member mentioned it had been there for multiple days.
-The steam room was out of service. Talking to members, apparently it’s been like this for over a month due to a malfunctioning component.
-The general cleanliness of the main men’s locker room wasn’t great. Dirty floor, showers, etc.

If management addresses these issues, I would love to become a member and update this to a more positive review.

Weirdly exploitative experience tarnishing otherwise great gym. I pay the rather steep $155/month membership just to play basketball here because they're the only indoor basketball court in the downtown area. They just announced renovations to their indoor basketball court for 2-3 months from now through October.

Here's where it gets weird. You'd think that since we can't use the court anymore because they initiated renovations on a court that was totally fine, they could put a free pause on our memberships for the period. But no, in the fine print of the contract, "The Club will not reduce or suspend dues during the time when the facilities are not available."

So my options are to
1) Be billed $50 per month to freeze my membership (1/3rd of the regular monthly fee) to NOT use the gym, or
2) Give 30 days notice of cancellation, pay another $155 for the 30 days, and then pay $250+ to rejoin when the court is done with renovations.

Even if it's in the fine print, this doesn't feel right on principle. It's not a couple day repair. It's bleeding your members for months while you do a voluntary renovations. I actually really liked this gym, the front desk is always very helpful and welcoming. I hate that SAC is providing negative value to their basketball members just to make a few hundred dollars while doing a renovation we didn't ask for.

Dark, strange, and wildly overpriced.

This is easily the most unjustifiably expensive gym I’ve ever been to. It’s a basic, small, bare-bones facility charging prices that compete with Equinox — and delivering nowhere near the value.

Yes, it’s clean. That may be because no one seems to be there and it's too dark to see anything. The space is small, the equipment selection is limited, and even basic lifting amenities are missing (no chalk allowed — even for deadlifts). There are racks and machines, but nothing remotely special or premium.

The amenities are borderline nonexistent. There is effectively no proper shower setup (a single shower, no soap), no towels, and no sense that members are getting anything beyond the most minimal offering.

The atmosphere is honestly one of the worst parts. It’s so dark it’s soporific — like working out inside a dark, dark nightclub. The lighting is almost entirely purple and red, which makes the space feel more like an empty lounge than a gym. It’s distracting, unpleasant, and actively makes you feel tired rather than energized.

For the price, this place should be exceptional. Instead, it’s cramped, oddly lit, poorly equipped, and wildly overpriced. I genuinely don’t understand who this is for — but given how empty it was, I may not be alone.

Too bad.

Update: After I posted this review, management contacted me offering free day passes while asking if I would remove it. I declined. Reviews exist so people can understand what a place is actually like, and I’m not interested in changing an honest review in exchange for perks. Potential members deserve transparency.

leads.business_name: Carbon Health Urgent & Primary Care San Francisco - Civic Center
leads.address: 1390 Market St #109, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Do not recommend. I have used this system for 2 different urgent care needs, and Every Single Practitioner who interacted with me, including the intakes, were extremely rushed.

Only one MD focused on my injury to treat me well enough for my recovery; I can't even say that whole situation went well because when I went back for the follow up, I got a different Dr who insisted I needed care I was not there to receive/didn't ask for help with, and attempted to sign me up for further appointments.

Some more highlights: I was asked to guess my weight for an intake. I was asked to walk undressed from the waist down, by myself (in lieu of the offered wheelchair), by giant windows you can clearly see in to from Market Street. Each visit I waited for over a half hour passed my appointment time, while walk-ins were building in number. Once, one of the staff had to tell the front desk to pause on registering them. If you get an X-ray, they insist their system can only send the results via "secure" email, not the standard copy on a CD for another DR to receive.

This system is using urgent care needs as a way to build money for itself, not support client needs NOR give their clinician staff enough time and space to properly give care.

DO NOT RECOMMEND.

(this message and review copied to both clinics I visited)

Edit 1: true to my statement, I received a call about this review, and the person was so rushed I didn't know it was about the review at first, AND they got details wrong in what I'm assuming is an attempt to recover from a 1* review. Dear caller: you can try calling me back, I just work a lot and can not take this call while working, thank you.

leads.address: 4900 California St, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
333 1st St STE A, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Absolute waste of money and time.

I paid $120 for an anxiety and depression video visit with the explicit purpose of getting a medication refill that I have been taking safely for years.

During the appointment, after full disclosure of my medical history, I was told that they cannot prescribe antidepressants at all because several years ago, outside of the US, bipolar disorder was once suspected, even though this diagnosis was later revised and I have been stable for years.

As a result, I received:

no prescription

no treatment

no temporary solution

no help whatsoever

I was simply told to “see a psychiatrist elsewhere.”

This raises a very obvious question: why charge patients $120 for a visit when you know in advance that you are not able or willing to provide the requested care? If certain histories automatically disqualify patients from receiving treatment, this should be clearly disclosed before payment, not after the appointment.

This felt like paying for the privilege of being turned away.

I strongly do NOT recommend Circle Medical for mental health care, refills, or continuity of treatment. Look elsewhere and save your money.

leads.business_name: Carbon Health Urgent & Primary Care San Francisco - Castro
leads.address: 1998 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
No x-ray.

I needed an x ray to check for broken bones. I called the front desk to confirm that the urgent care could perform an x-ray this evening. I was given a confident “yes,” so I decided to go.

After a painful walk, I show up for my appointment and after paying copay and waiting 30 minutes to be seen, I was told there is no x-ray onsite. I was told I would have to make an appointment for that separately at a different urgent care location further away.

This location’s waiting room is also problematic from a privacy and HIPAA standpoint. I heard the private medical details of multiple other patients during my time in the small, concrete waiting room, including a conversation the front desk had with the patient about their stool sample. I have no doubt my identifying information was audible to other patients as well.

leads.address: 995 Potrero Ave, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
leads.worst_review_text: Don't ever go. Cazandra Zaragoza, MD treat patients differently here. I had to wait more than two hours for no reason. The nurse said there were only two people waiting in front of me. Even if I asked the nurses to ask the doctor because the order seemed to have changed several times, they said my turn was the next so I couldn't even go to the bathroom for two hours. I had to endure my pain so much that I cried. But she only took 20 minutes for me then left me saying another patient was waiting. She knew I was waiting for 2 hours as she came to me by mistake when I came in. I was very shocked that the doctor could discriminate against patients in hospitals, and I was very surprised that no nurse took it seriously even though the patient complained of pain. The reputation and reality of this hospital are completely different. This incident served as an opportunity for me to move to another hospital.

leads.address: 730 Polk St, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Worst clinic I’ve ever been to. Right in the middle of drug zombie land in the Tenderloin. It’s like a nightmare. Dangerous and horrible.
None of these people working there should even have jobs. They’re terrible human beings. You won’t even be allowed to see an actual real medical doctor. You will be assigned an ancient nurse who should have retired long ago, nodding and pretending to listen to you as she writes down nothing for your actual medical record.  She will not even physically examine you when you are sick. Doesn’t look in your ears or  throat, or even listen to your heart. Neglect of even the most basic things. Their major negligence of all my concerns, and lack of proper medical testing and treatment caused me to be hospitalized with sepsis twice in six months. I almost died.
You will wait forever for appointments,  referrals, test results, and med refills.  I had a breast biopsy for abnormalities months after my mother died of breast cancer. I sent desperate message after pleading phone call begging this old doddering woman posing as doctor for my results. After weeks and many tears, she finally posted them online. Not
even carrying enough to tell me in person. This clinic should not have a license to operate. Through direct negligence of ignoring my requests, she didn’t even offer me the common courtesy of a phone call. They are obsessed with gays and sex changes to the exclusion of other categories of patients. They support promiscuous, dangerous behavior and constant giveaways of free drug paraphernalia to down and desperate, sick homeless people. They are a huge source of encouraging at-risk people to further endanger their lives, mental well-being , family relationships, and the safety of the city at large. Do yourself a big favor and go  but here. Anywhere else. Even the exam rooms and restroom  stink and are always filthy.

I do not recommend women go here birth Control needs or women’s needs. I was not told that I should take something for pain before the insertion of the IUD. The nurse treated me as if I should have known when no one told me. Saying “oh you should have already taken something.” And then chuckled. That’s your job! Give it to me. So the first thing she could have done was to give the aspirin but she waited some time before administering it and the procedure was incredibly painful. To make matters worse, the IUD didn’t fit, they tried twice after she asked for help from the doctor to check that it indeed didn’t fit. Something they don’t tell you is a possibility and could have changed my choice for contraception. To make matters worse, the young nurse prepared herself by putting gloves on and touching her hair and who knows what else with those same gloves before touching me. I’ve worked in restaurants for many years and I’d expect your staff to know how to not cross contaminate. I was trying to convince myself that everything would be fine but I must let you know that I see a holistic doctor for other reasons and after disclosing to him that my lower left side of my pelvis had been in pain since the sticking of my uterus and was getting worse, he tested me and found staff in my kidney. All I know is that this pain started after this procedure. I am scared for other women to come here and receive inadequate health care. Women do yourself a favor and go to planned parenthood. Castro clinic please retrain your staff better. This is not ok. Honestly the doctor was kind and helpful the nurse unfortunately was obviously a moron. At one point the doctor had to tell her to get a new tool that fell on the floor. She was oblivious about this standard procedure. She agreed but god forbid the doctor wasn’t there. Unacceptable.

leads.address: 490 Post St STE 900, San Francisco, CA 94102, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
I transferred from OM to this clinic, and unbelievably DMG is worse. This clinic has an archaic one-way communication system therefore there is no way to communicate directly with the provider. Instead you must call (typically a few times before someone picks up) and then speak with the gatekeeping nursing students. I spoke with one student, KH, requesting that the MD order labs for phosphorus and vitamin D given my current medical situation which includes a broken bone that’s delayed in healing. I had just seen Dr. Grenier for my initial assessment (annual physical) two weeks prior, and these labs were not included, hence my request. KH challenged my request rudely and told me that she would transmit my message to the MD and call me back. A week later I have just now received their message instructing me to book another appointment with Dr. Grenier to assess the necessity of these tests. The entire experience has felt bizarre and is a major red flag. Further, this inadequate level of service is unacceptable in what will soon be 2026.

Update: Vitamin D was actually included in the list of labs that were supposed to be ordered from the annual physical. This was missed, however, and instead (as mentioned above) I was directed to schedule another appointment to determine the necessity of the test along with phosphorus.

leads.business_name: San Francisco International Airport (SFO) Medical Clinic
leads.address: 100 International Terminal Departures Level 3 Side A, San Francisco, CA 94128, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Was DENIED Yellow Fever vaccine for my 15 month old son because he got red bumpy cheeks the very first time he had eggs months ago and never had a reaction since.

We live downtown San Francisco and do not have a car. I called so many places that did not have the yellow fever vaccine in stock or we would not be able to get an appointment in time for the 10 day incubation period for the vaccine to be considered valid.

I was able to make an appointment here  at the SFO medical clinic. I filled out the paperwork and was honest for the question that asked if my son had an egg allergy and I just said, “maybe” thinking back to that very first time he had eggs.

The nurse came out into the lobby and discussed with me that if he truly does have an egg allergy that the yellow fever vaccine can be “detrimental.” I told her I would consult with my husband and get back. After talking with my husband and searching through AI, we decided that our son would be OK.

I let the nurse know that I wanted to proceed with the vaccine, but at that point, she told me she did not feel comfortable administering it and did not want to risk losing her license. She said if I could get a note from a pediatrician saying that he is not allergic to eggs and send that to her that she would be willing to administer the shot.

Imagine being a young mom traveling alone and adding more barriers.

I would have to make an appointment with his pediatrician, have them make a referral to a pediatric allergy specialist, and from there they confirm or deny that he does not have an egg allergy. And then I would return all the way back to the San Francisco International Airport with the documentation showing that he does not have an egg allergy in order to receive the vaccine or that he does and receive some type of vaccine exemption form.

Today is August 6 and we leave August 10. The country that requires the vaccine we enter on August 18.

Can you guess what I’m going to do when I get home today after my travels on BART and bus? I’m going to make my son eggs just to remind myself that I’m not crazy and he does NOT have an egg allergy.

This is what I get for being honest for answering, “maybe”: more travel complications, more stress, and a rescheduled appointment in Oakland.

What does this clinic get out of the matter? A 1 star review.

UPDATE: Added the picture of my son eating eggs upon getting home and guess what?! He’s FINE!!! So if your child had ONE MILD REACTION upon first eating eggs, ANSWER THAT YOUR CHILD DOES NOT HAVE AN EGG ALLERGY! If you’re honest, the nurse will think she’s risking her livelihood administering the shot.

leads.address: 240 Shotwell St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA
leads.worst_review_text: Wish I could give this place a ZERO. The appointments they give you are never accurate or even kept. There is never an explanation by the staff as to why you weren't informed about a cancelation, or a change with dates. The ladies who work at reception are very cut-offish and rude over the phone, but seem so laid back (chatting up a storm amongst themselves and playing with their phones) in person. Wait time to get a live person is usually 40min to an hour btw, which ends up being a waste of time in the end because no resolution. I bring a family member to appointments here and its always such a headache dealing with this place for anything from appointments,  to results, to even simple routine check ups with a provider. Getting an appointment that isn't two months out is terrible enough but after waiting the two months to be seen and the staff messing up the appointment that turns out was "never made" is just pathetic. They need to get organized and find people who really want to be there and do their job. Non-profit, fine, but at the end of the day they're there racking up points for their resume. This is just not fair to the patients.

The ongoing construction project at the men’s bathroom/locker room has been a complete mess. Why is the shower room still open for use while you have workers there replacing the lockers constantly in and out of there? You end up having 5 naked men coming out of shower waiting to get to their lockers, blocking the ways for other members just coming in. And everyone is looking for available lockers like doing some obstacle courses, trying not to bump into someone’s naked ass or interrupt whoever others they are socializing when they are un/dressing. Please Close the shower room until you have the locker room completely ready.

And the combination lockers are huge disappointment, they are so prone to theft and people easily forget about their codes. And you can’t easily identify which ones are being used or not. Also put some sort of instructions for use for gods sake and some area numbers like 1-40, 40- 80 etc, in set areas on the wall or something.

leads.worst_review_text:
Unexpectedly poor customer service at this location.

Recently, I attempted to make a purchase at the Equinox Shop at the Equinox Sports Club SF and intended to use my points balance, which is due to expire quite soon. Unfortunately, no one on duty at the time had access to the system needed to process a points redemption, so only card payments were available.

After speaking with the club manager, Erica, she kindly suggested a workaround: I would complete the purchase with my credit card, and she would refund the charge the next day and re-process the transaction using my points. We also agreed that I could call her if anything didn’t go as expected.

Since then, no refund has been issued. I called the club the following day - and several times afterward - and each time was assured that Erica would get back to me. Unfortunately, no one has followed up.

While the amount is modest, the experience has been surprisingly disappointing, especially given the consistently exceptional service I’ve received from Equinox in the past. I would gladly forget this minor incident, but the lack of follow-through and repeated unreturned calls leave me feeling unheard as a member.

leads.address: 1455 Fillmore St, San Francisco, CA 94115, USA
1200 Van Ness Ave, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
I visited the Van Ness location after signing up for a 2-year membership. The facility is large and spacious, which I liked at first, but the experience went downhill quickly.

The locker room was dirty, and the men’s restroom had a strong odor and looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in a long time. The stair-master machines were old, rusty, and dusty, with some damaged buttons.

The staff member at the front desk was very friendly, but he was the only employee in a facility that clearly needs more staff and constant cleaning. The whole place needs a deep clean and updated equipment.

Overall, the gym gave me the same rundown vibe as the surrounding Tenderloin area. I don’t like giving low ratings, but hygiene is the absolute minimum, so I’m giving it 1 star. With proper cleaning and updated machines, this could easily become a 3–4 star gym.

leads.worst_review_text:
PARKING ONLY Concerns.

1. Cleanliness, Odors, and Safety 🏨🅿️

The parking structure—especially the side across from the main area—is extremely dirty, including the old elevator.

There are strong odors of urine and other foul smells, and in some areas there is even feces on the floor, which is unacceptable for a hospital environment.

Every level needs to be pressure washed with soap and bleach, with special attention to the 3rd floor, which connects directly to the hospital bridge.

Regular, thorough cleaning is essential for health and safety, particularly in high-traffic areas where germs and viruses can accumulate.

A recommended schedule is to power-wash every two months.

If the hospital cannot afford this, they should consider asking volunteers or private companies to donate their cleaning services.

2. Parking Misuse by Employees

Employees are using patient and guest parking areas, causing the parking structure to be full on almost every level.

This creates hardships for patients, visitors, and families who rely on accessible parking.

Installing cameras on each floor, including inside the elevator, would help monitor and prevent misuse..

I will take pictures next time 📷

I only go here because I have to.

leads.worst_review_text:
I don’t know how this Planet Fitness is still open, because every time I walk in, it feels like the place has completely given up on even pretending to function. My experiences here have been so unbelievably bad that “disappointment” doesn’t even begin to cover it.

Let’s start with the manager, Jimmy. In my personal experience, he has been one of the rudest, least helpful managers I’ve ever encountered anywhere. Any time I’ve tried to ask a simple question, he acts like I’m inconveniencing him by daring to exist. His attitude alone is enough to make someone want to cancel their membership.

The filth in this gym is unbelievable. It constantly looks like it hasn’t been properly cleaned in ages. The bathrooms are grimy, the workout areas smell awful, and the equipment is covered in dust and sweat like no one even bothers to wipe anything down. It’s genuinely gross.

And speaking of equipment—half the machines seem to be broken at any given time. Not just occasionally. Constantly. For weeks. Cardio machines, weight machines, you name it—there’s always a giant “Out of Order” sign slapped on something. It’s a gym where you can barely work out.

Even worse, there is NO WATER. Not “the fountain was down for a few hours.” No—there have been multiple times I’ve shown up and there was absolutely zero working water available anywhere in the facility. A gym that can’t provide water is unthinkable, yet here we are.

Their payment system is a joke too. I’ve had several experiences where they couldn’t take cash, credit, anything because their system was down. How does a modern business function like that?

And on top of all this, the gym feels completely unmanaged, with people who clearly aren’t members constantly coming in to use the bathrooms, showers, and hang out. The staff seem overwhelmed or uninterested, and the situation feels chaotic and poorly controlled.

In my experience, this location is an absolute trainwreck from top to bottom. Between the rude management, disgusting facilities, broken machines, no water, and non-stop operational failures, I can confidently say this is the worst gym I’ve ever stepped foot in.

Avoid this place unless you enjoy frustration, filth, and wasting your money.

leads.worst_review_text:
EŌS Fitness operates through deception and deliberate lack of disclosure.
They market memberships as “all-access,” yet fail to clearly disclose that certain locations are classified as “Luxury” and exclude standard members. This information is buried in fine print and not clearly explained during sign-up or on their website.

They promote what appears to be a luxury-level membership at a premium price, but the so-called “Luxury” location I visited was outdated and poorly maintained, with no visible branding indicating it was any different from a regular EŌS gym.

My experience:
I live in Riverside County and work throughout Los Angeles. Because I travel frequently for work, I intentionally selected a membership that advertised access to all locations. When I arrived at an EŌS location with my sister (who has the highest-tier membership) and a guest, we were denied entry because the gym was labeled “Luxury.” None of us were clearly informed of this restriction when signing up.

Staff then offered only me a one-time entry, expecting me to leave the people I arrived with—an insulting and unreasonable solution.

This lack of transparency cost them a potential new member, as our guest was considering switching to EŌS but decided not to after witnessing this experience.

EŌS does not clearly advertise Luxury locations or plans.
Instead, they rely on small print and vague language to mislead customers into memberships that do not provide the access they expect. I will be providing photos to show exactly where and how this information is hidden.

If you value transparency and honesty, be extremely cautious before signing up.

I’ve been a member of this gym since it first opened, and I’m disappointed with my experience. Unfortunately, the staff has consistently come across as rude and unwelcoming. The rude one is the girl with the glasses. She really need to reconsider a new job or get some serious help in customer service. Simple gestures, like saying good morning, are often ignored, which creates an uncomfortable atmosphere.

What’s frustrating is that while staff interaction is lacking day-to-day, communication suddenly improves when it comes time to collect membership payments. In comparison to other gyms I’ve visited—where staff are friendly and welcoming—this location falls short in customer service.

Additionally, members are charged a $20 fee to train on holidays, while non-members pay $25, which feels unreasonable given the lack of service. The only reason I continue to attend is because the hours are convenient.

I hope management considers investing in staff who are courteous, professional, and genuinely interested in providing a positive experience. Improving customer service would greatly enhance the gym and likely benefit the business as well.

Came here on winter break about a month ago to a new hairstylist(bad idea) for a highlight touch up. Amy had done my hair the summer before and did an absolutely fantastic job. She wasn’t available the days I was, so I booked with a stylist that charged the same amount, assuming I’d get the same quality of work. I told they stylist I wanted them a tad lighter. Mind you the highlights were originally like a dark honey blonde. When I said a tad lighter, I meant honey blonde. I didn’t notice how awful they looked until I got home to regular lighting and could see my roots. My hair was literally WHITE and my roots were showing? Why would a stylist completely leave the roots out and not only that, not blend the color to at least make it look good. My roots literally looked burnt. I went to a Sally’s store and had to fix the color and blend the roots myself because when I called to schedule a redo, the snobby front desk lady told me she couldn’t get it redone that week, and NEVER called me back to schedule me in. Absolutely horrendous job and waste of 200 DOLLARS. Yes 200 dollars for this 😭😭😭 and mind u I had to part my hair to the side to TRY and not make them looked so chopped.
**** just so y’all know, they never reached out as they said they would in their response to my review 💕💕💕

leads.address: 351 W Hubbard St, Chicago, IL 60654, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
I really wanted to like this salon. I booked here specifically due to a friend going here but I received the WORST haircut of my life from ANNA DALEY.

To make this as short as possible everything that was done during my “luxury” appointment:

- stylist 10+ minutes late, no notification from the front desk that she would be late. The salon has a late policy which apparently doesn’t apply to stylists
- she shows up in a hoodie, WITH the hood ON which she left on the entire appointment to cover her 2 inch PLUS roots and dirty/ faded  yoga pants
- she told me her morning was “rough”. It was 12 in the afternoon? Morning was long gone
- the ENTIRE appointment, she did not have me facing the mirror. She had me pointed in the direction the entire time to look at another stylist doing hair and did not move me
- she has me slouch down to cut my hair instead of moving me because she stated she’s “short” I’m only 5’7, hard to believe I would be her tallest client
- she kept making comments about hair length. Asking me if my hair grows fast and told me to look down and said oh I know it seems like a lot of hair, but it’s not. Then after my haircut was done, she didn’t even do a 360 of my hair. She just pointed me to the side and said look. It’s still towards the middle of your back and she spent more time curling my hair than actually cutting it.

I thought everything was ok and I didn’t think much of my length as she curled my hair pretty strongly. Well after I washed my hair I noticed how she completely ruined my hair. My hair was LONG and she cut off all my hair AND there is no symmetry as you can see from the photos.

I waited a little bit cause maybe I thought oh it’s just in my head, but then I had someone take videos of my hair to realize how bad it was. So I called to make a complaint with management and at first I was pretty lenient cause I understand how things work, but it took over two days to come to a solution. They kept asking me to come in to assess my hair and I’m just like why would I come in? I’m sending you videos and pictures like my hair is extremely uneven. They said they would like to make it up to me by conditioning and I’m like that doesn’t bring my length back? My hair is completely GONE. I told them I wouldn’t want to go back because the only way to fix it is to cut off all my hair and I don’t want it cut so I asked for a refund. The owner of the salon told me that I could not have a refund because it’s part of their policy so I brought up the website and I said OK can you let me know where on your website it states that you don’t give refunds?  She couldn’t. Long story short, she ended up trying to record our conversation which I told her I did not consent to. She ended up giving me a refund AFTER I told her I was going to make a review but ANNA DALEY still kept my $20 tip as I sent it via Venmo. I would not recommend.

The heart photo is my hair BEFORE ANNA DALEY BOTCHED my hair. All one length and I end up leaving with a butchered mullet. No symmetry. Appalling that this was a $130 hair cut!!!!!! I have never had such a BAD haircut from what is supposed to be a luxury salon from an “EXPERIENCED” stylist.

leads.worst_review_text:
DO NOT COME HERE. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

The short version: this shop pulled a bait-and-switch twice, lied about pricing, and refused to release our car unless we paid more than the agreed quote. The situation escalated to the point where we had to call the police so we could safely leave with our vehicle.

The full story:

We live in the neighborhood and have been paying customers of this shop for 3–4 years. Most recently, we brought our car in to replace a side mirror that had been chipped overnight. We spoke directly with the lead mechanic, who explained that the replacement mirror might not be an exact color match but guaranteed—both verbally and on the written quote—that it would be a similar shade. He also said that if the part arrived in a completely different color, it would be sent back. We agreed on a set price.

A few days later, he called to say the mirror arrived and that it was dark silver (our car is white), but told us he would cover the cost of painting it so it would match. We asked multiple times on that call to confirm there would be no additional charge, and he confirmed there would not be.

When we arrived to pick up the car, the shop demanded $250 more than the agreed quote, stating that we either had to pay the higher amount or they would remove the mirror and return the car in its original damaged condition. We explained that we had been long-time customers, lived in the neighborhood, and had clear proof of what was agreed to. None of that mattered.

The lead mechanic refused to involve the owner or management, even though we had a recording of the call confirming the price. He stated that he “couldn’t make $10 on this job” and tried to undo the work instead of honoring the agreement. The situation became so hostile that we had to call the police to supervise the interaction. The mechanic showed up outside of his shift, became aggressive and loud, and had to be calmed down by the police while they waited for us to safely leave the lot.

This experience showed a complete lack of honesty, accountability, and leadership. There is no clear management presence, no concern for customer service, and no willingness to stand by written or verbal agreements.

Additionally, we dropped our car off with 1/4 tank of gas left and when we picked it up it was the lowest I've ever seen the tank (well below the empty line).

If you value transparency, professionalism, or basic trust with your car, do not bring it here.

leads.worst_review_text: I took my car in because my battery completely died and they ended up charging me a massive $125 to decontaminate the engine from rodent feces, $185 for an engine diagnostic, and then charged me $105 for an oil change when I initially asked them to top it off. Then they had the audacity to tell me I needed essentially every single thing possibly done for my car including a full front and back brake system replacement. They said my front brakes were rusted and 4.5mm and the rear brakes were rusted with 3.4 mm calipers electric. I ended up taking it to a different shop in the suburbs for the brakes, only for that shop, which I trust, to tell me that my entire vehicle was running perfectly fine, nothing needed to be flushed or replaced, and that I had between 7 to 8 mm on both my front and rear brakes. Logan square auto repair shop recommended approximately $2,500-$3,000 worth in additional services that they listed as an immediate concern. I’m so glad I got out with just an $800 bill after the way they tried to scam me.

leads.address: 3830 N Kedzie Ave, Chicago, IL 60618, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
I chose this shop based on positive reviews but was extremely disappointed with the quality of work. My vehicle was backed into in September and finally returned today after multiple trips back. At pickup, the hood was misaligned and the bottom bumper scratched. At home, I found additional issues: a cracked aftermarket (AFK) headlight, clear coat drips, and polish/burn marks around the driver-side door. While the burn marks didn’t go through the paint, they still reflected rushed workmanship.

I spoke with the general manager about these concerns, but none were properly communicated to the technicians. I later learned the manager had been terminated, which explains the miscommunication. The CAPA-certified hood didn’t fit properly, and despite multiple corrections, the front hood/bonnet was still scratched at one point before being fixed. Even after everything, the hood alignment was slightly off, and I was told there was nothing more that could be done because it was OEM. I still don’t understand how the shop released my vehicle in that condition—an aftermarket (AFK) headlight was cracked, the paint had issues, and the CAPA-certified hood was misaligned.

My frustration wasn’t about waiting for parts; it was entirely with the quality of work and having to bring the vehicle back multiple times to address issues that should have been fixed the first time. Communication was extremely poor—I did not receive a single email, text, or phone call with updates, which was especially surprising given that other reviews mentioned regular updates.

It was also clear the shop seemed frustrated with my follow-ups, but that is not my fault—these issues arose because the work was not completed properly initially.

I’m glad insurance covered the cost, as I would not have wanted to pay for this work myself. While most issues were eventually corrected, the process shows a clear lack of attention to detail and oversight, which is frustrating given the high cost of the repairs.

leads.worst_review_text:
1.Insisting on taking X-rays without justification: You should learn about a basic principle in radiation protection called ALARA – As Low As Reasonably Achievable. Taking X-rays without a valid reason is against the Swiss Federal Act on Radiation Protection (StSG) article 16.

2.You charge patients for being late, but you're the one who's late!

3.The dentist who showed up late was clearly in a rush and made harsh, rushed movements during the cleaning. The result? My gums were left sore and irritated.

4.Overcharging! I've never paid so much for a cleaning — not in Zurich, not anywhere else!

leads.worst_review_text: Hotel is more into relying on past reviews instead of improving. I was traveling with a tour group that was scheduled to leave the next day. I was hoping to speak to the tour person to confirm what was expected for check out but I was late in returning from a private tour so I asked the front desk staff if they could help me out. They said that the tour guide was done for the day and perhaps they could help. That was nice of them to say so but at times it is best to speak to the person you need to speak to for clarification. One person said the information was on the printed handout and that I should read it. I mentioned to him that because of a eye situation that effects me reading fine print, I can't see it. Other staff persons were very helpful but this person that told me to read it was difficult and not what I would expect from this hotel. I tried to make him aware that I was trying to confirm what I thought I was told but to no avail , he merely said suitcases will be picked up at 8am. One other staff read to me what the time for pick up was and to my amazement, it was a different time from what he told me. Some staff are great but this person made me feel that my questions were above and beyond him and it left me with the impression that asking questions may be snarled at by some staff. Very impressive hotel name but it can do better

Hello Salon Owner

I’m reaching out regarding my recent appointment with Marcus. I was charged $380 for a cut, dye, and style. Throughout the service, Marcus appeared very nonchalant, as if he didn’t want to work with my 4C hair, even though he is also Black.

I originally requested a balayage, but Marcus said he couldn’t do it because of my hair length. Instead, he offered to do a base color, which I specifically asked to be copper, but that is not the color I received. He applied dye to my hair and I was just sitting there no cap was placed on my head to secure the treatment nothing total disregard and lack of compassion. Once the base didn’t come out as expected, he decided to add highlights which I never requested and when I asked what color he was applying, he told me to “trust him.”

After the service, although I wasn’t satisfied with the results, I still tipped him $60 and left. Later, I called the salon to request that someone else correct the color, but was met with hostility. Marcus answered the phone yelling, accusing me of being rude to the staff, when in fact I was simply trying to resolve the issue professionally and get my hair color corrected.

I would really appreciate it if someone could review my situation and help arrange for another stylist to fix my color.

Thank you for your time and understanding.

I had a very disappointing experience at Studio D Nail Salon, and I cannot recommend them for nail services. I paid $75 for a gel manicure, plus an extra $15 to remove my previous gel polish. The nail technician assured me that my nails would last at least two weeks, but just three days later, most of the gel began to lift and peel off. Seems like for the price i paid , they can accommodate at least a credit when the client is able to come instead of making the situation worse and losing a client.

I understand that scheduling can be difficult, and I appreciate that they made time for me initially. However, when I finally returned to address the issue, I was shocked to learn that I would need to pay an additional $38 for a polish change. This was incredibly frustrating, especially since the original service did not meet the promised quality.

The lack of accountability and customer service is unacceptable. I felt dismissed rather than supported in resolving the issue with my nails. Save your money and go elsewhere; this salon did not deliver on their promises.

leads.address: 3301 NE 1st Ave Suite 102, Miami, FL 33137, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
I got my hair colored by Laura prior to Christmas, and I am unfortunately just now getting around to writing this review because every time I think about the experience, I get overwhelmingly irritated.

I had a haircut from James, and he recommended Laura, the salon’s blonde specialist. I had a good experience with him, and she had good reviews, so I scheduled with her. I did not have to pay for this appointment due to the quality of work, so I am writing this PURELY to warn others.

I specifically booked a full highlight. When I sat in her chair, she looked through my hair and said it was already pretty blonde and that I would only need a partial. We went back and forth, and I emphasized that I need my roots to look freshly done, especially in up do’s, as my job is heavily presentation-focused. She again confirmed that a partial was recommended. I asked whether my roots would look done while half up/half down, and she confirmed yes and stated that she places foil all over, even on partials. I regrettably trusted her and went with her recommendation.

The appointment itself felt rushed and emphasis on messy. While contributive to the context, I am limited due to the character limit, so I digress.

When finished, she only blow-dried the front section of my hair and then quite literally LEFT because she had a doctor’s appointment. I had a haircut booked with another stylist since she only does color, but she didn’t even stay to confirm the final result with me.

While getting my hair cut, I asked for a mirror when my hair was sectioned half up/half down. I was truly horrified by how incomplete it looked. She had confirmed my roots would be touched up in this exact style, which was untrue. Upon further inspection, nowhere did the blonde reach my roots aside from the outer front, coincidentally the exact piece she blow-dried. It was laughably bad, even for a partial.

I complained at the front, and because there was no manager on duty, they initially tried to send me away! Only after I pushed back on the verge of tears, stating that a luxury salon should have customer service available, did the front desk assistant call the manager, who forced a busy head stylist to speak with me. He kindly confirmed the work was indeed poorly done and needed to be re-colored. They attempted to reschedule me with the stylist who cut my hair, but I did not feel comfortable.

Management never contacted me to apologize. Laura texted me herself to confirm my appointment with the other stylist (why??) and days later, asked me to call her. Never sent a text or voicemail that would imply an apology, and maybe she would have, but I wasn’t interested. I genuinely believe she manipulated me into a partial so she could make her doctor’s appointment. Fortunately, I didn’t have to pay for this rock-bottom experience, but now I have to find a stylist to correct her subpar work.

The most ironic part is that during our appointment, I had mentioned a previous bad experience with another stylist. She said many stylists simply just don’t know what they’re doing! Based on these results, would you think Laura knows what’s she’s doing? What a JOKE.

In response to the Owner’s reply:
- I am not sure how you can say management was involved when the front desk assistant tried to send me away due to there being no manager on duty. The head stylist that communicated with me after my appointment is quite literally in the background of my first picture attached doing someone’s hair.
- I was offered an appointment with Jesus, who was very kind, but not a senior stylist. Not only is he the most affordable stylist on your website, but when I asked him if Laura was the only blonde specialist, he said yes. If your blonde specialist can’t even handle basic blonde coloring, why would I trust a novice stylist at your salon.
- The text quite literally said, “Good morning Victoria, Laura here, are you available 12/24 time 12 with Jesus so we can re do the highlights?”. I will be adding this to my review. Similar to your stylist’s work, your response is ridiculous. 🥰

I am a regular customer and come here and recommend it often because I really love the menu offers, but I was extremely disappointed by the service today. As you expect it to be high quality to represent the hotel, but it was absolutely unprofessional and disappointing. We were told to wait for a few minutes for a table. We were told to wait a second time so they can clean it for us, so we did patiently as requested. But in the meantime a man walked in past us and just sat down at the table that we were already given and waiting for and nothing was said to him. We ended up being the ones directed to another one that we did not prefer and we were told that they don’t want to have a discussion with him. Extremely unprofessional behavior. White rich men privileges are supported here… sadly

She says that the price I was given was wrong and it was 158$ more. Not my problem when I double checked the price. For your own sake, don't go this place. Family problems is not what you want to deal with when you have car problems.
Calling customers from their private number and try to ask for more money, making me feel bad because of her private life is not ok in anyway.

Dear reader,
I'm sharing this because I believe patients have a right to honest information.

After I wrote a personal and factual review about my experience at this clinic, I was contacted multiple times — despite clearly asking to be left alone I was contacted one more time. What I found especially disturbing: Dr. Wick did not reach out to me herself, but instead sent her husband, Dr. Wick, and eventually a legal representative to pressure me into removing my review. I was indirectly  threatened with legal action — simply for sharing my opinion.

I encourage you to read reviews of this clinic with a healthy dose of skepticism. It appears that criticism is not tolerated here, and rather than engaging with it constructively, the response may involve pressure and intimidation.

Whether this is a place where you feel safe and respected as a patient is for you to decide.

I have a life and have better things to do than "ruin someone's reputation". I simply felt responsible to share my experience. Though this has led to me be harassed by this clinic, I will do my best to stay truthful to my belief.

My initial Review:
I am not in a position to judge Dr. Carina Wick’s medical decisions or work, but as someone with dental anxiety, I was referred to her as a specialist. During a procedure to disinfect the roots of an infected, root-canaled tooth, she told me local anesthesia would not help with the pain I felt. However, another dentist later performed the exact same procedure with local anesthesia, and I realized the pain I endured at Dr. Wick's was unnecessary. This is unacceptable, especially from a doctor specializing in treating anxious patients. It reflects a complete lack of care for the patient's well-being. I also felt rushed rather than cared for. While Dr. Wick may be suitable for those with a high pain tolerance, I wouldn’t recommend her for patients who need a calming and supportive environment.

We stayed at the hotel on December 25–26 with our dog and were very satisfied with our experience.

Pros:
•	Underground parking is available (€22 per day).
•	Friendly and helpful staff — they kindly allowed us to check in a bit earlier upon request. Special thanks for that!
•	The room was clean and well equipped: a capsule coffee machine, tea, sugar, dishes, and one bottle of sparkling water. The textiles looked almost brand new.
•	Breakfast (€15 per person) was varied and tasty. Dogs are allowed in the restaurant, which was a big plus for us.
•	Excellent location: a metro station right across the street, a SPAR supermarket on the ground floor, and Asian/Turkish cafés within walking distance.
•	Reception can call a taxi, which arrives within 3–5 minutes — very convenient.

Overall, this is an excellent hotel for traveling with pets. Caring and respectful treatment of animals is very important to us, and this hotel truly delivers.

Thank you very much for the great service! We will definitely come back 🫶🏼

leads.worst_review_text:
I’ve stayed at East Hotel Hamburg twice this year: the first time in May, which was wonderful. I loved the ambiance, the design, and especially the room with the large bathtub. Because of that great experience, I decided to book again in October through Navan (Expedia PartnerCentral) for a work trip, specifically selecting and paying for the Aqua Room.

However, upon arrival, I was given a completely different room without the features of the category I had booked. When I showed my confirmed reservation, which explicitly stated Aqua Room, the front desk informed me that the error had come from the booking partner and their system that there was nothing they could do unless I paid an additional €35 to get the room I had already booked. After a long day of travel, I reluctantly paid the extra fee, even though the mistake was clearly between the hotel and the partner, not mine. Since I had other work-related plans and didn’t want to waste more time at the reception, I decided to resolve the matter with the hotel later.

What disappointed me most was how the situation was handled afterward. Despite acknowledging that the issue came from their booking partner, management refused to refund the €35 and advised me to take it up with the external provider myself. This raises a serious question: how can any guest trust the hotel’s booking and notification system if, upon arrival, they can simply claim an error occurred and downgrade your room —> even when your company has already paid for a higher category?

For a hotel of this standard, I expected a much more professional and guest-focused resolution. It’s a beautiful property, but the lack of accountability and poor handling of this issue left a lasting negative impression. I travel to Hamburg several times a year for work, but I’ll be looking for a better alternative in the future.
leads.ai_response_draft: Nadia, you're absolutely right to be frustrated - having to pay extra for the Aqua Room you already booked and paid for is completely unacceptable, especially when our own system caused the mix-up with the booking partner. I've escalated this to our revenue team to ensure we properly handle these third-party booking discrepancies going forward, and frankly, we should have resolved this immediately at check-in rather than putting you in that position. I'd like to make this right - please reach out to me directly so we can discuss how to restore your confidence in staying with us during your regular Hamburg visits. - east Hotel Hamburg

leads.worst_review_text: A picture of my hair before, the inspiration picture of the haircut I wanted, the results of the haircut w/styling, and then a picture of my hair without the styling. I spent a year growing out my hair hoping when I finally got a haircut it'd turn out nice. But instead the haircut was way too short, the layers aren't right, and it's so blunt and straight at the ends. I've had short haircuts before, but it has never been this bad. I really feel like this haircut was doable with the way my hair was, but I guess not. I understand hair grows back but this was genuinely awful. I don't recommend coming here if you want layers or trendy haircuts.

I’ve given this salon a few chances, but each time I leave disappointed. Even when I show reference photos, the stylist never delivers what I ask for.

About a year ago, I came in for a temporary straightening treatment. I repeatedly told the stylist—at least 10 times—that I did not want anything permanent, especially not keratin. I had previously done Hair Botox and Brazilian Blowouts at other salons, which were great because my curls always came back after a few months.

Despite my clear instructions, he reassured me multiple times that the product would only last 3–4 months and that my curls would return. Ten months later, my roots are curly, but the rest of my hair is still pin-straight—clearly a keratin treatment.

I went back to explain what happened and to get a trim with a voluminous blowout. Once again, I left with hair that was mostly flat and straight with a slight curl at the ends—definitely not a voluminous blowout. When I asked what product was used that one time I had asked for a temporary hair straightening treatment, they admitted it was keratin. When I reminded them that I had explicitly said not to use keratin, there was no apology or explanation.

To top it off, they barely offered a discount—and still asked for a tip after I paid. I’ve never had a salon do that, especially after an experience like this.

Unless you’re going in for a basic trim and hairstyle, I can’t recommend this place. I won’t be returning.

leads.worst_review_text:
Review: Munich City Hotel – Extremely Disappointing Stay

We arrived at the hotel with heavy luggage only to discover there was no elevator and we had to carry everything up three flights of stairs by ourselves. No staff to help.

Security was a serious concern – the front door had no lock at all, leaving only the individual room lock for protection. The front desk was completely understaffed, with a single employee trying to check guests in, answer calls, and even serve drinks at the bar at the same time.

When we finally got to our room, the condition was shocking:
•	The bathroom door was broken and wouldn’t close.
•	The drapes were half hanging off the wall, clearly damaged and never repaired.
•	The view from our window was of a yard filled with garbage.
•	The room itself was dirty, giving us no sense of comfort or cleanliness.

Another guest even told us his room had bugs, and he was extremely upset.

Overall, this was one of the worst hotel experiences we’ve ever had. Between the lack of security, poor staffing, broken facilities, uncleanliness, and unsafe environment, I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone.

I recently had work done at Phil’s and want to share my experience so other customers know what to expect. Phil diagnosed my vehicle with a noisy left front wheel hub bearing, and the repair itself appears to have been done correctly. I appreciate that he was able to get the job completed the same day.

However, my experience with customer service was disappointing. When I returned to pick up my vehicle, the interaction felt rushed and dismissive. I asked a few reasonable questions about the repair and the parts that were used, but I received unclear answers and very little explanation. I was also told that the brand of the hub installed was “maybe” one thing or another, which raised concerns about record-keeping and communication.

Overall, the mechanical work seems fine, but my experience as a customer was not positive. I believe communication and professionalism are just as important as the repair itself, and I hope this feedback helps future customers make an informed decision.

Extremely low quality parts that they’ll try to disguise as genuine + bad craftsmanship = stay away! My BMW needed new front brakes and I couldn’t get an appointment with the dealership for a while so i decided to get it serviced at Universal (HUGE mistake). They seemed capable and were accommodating with my schedule. Fast forward a week after getting my brakes done and I started to hear screeching every time I break. Called them and they told me to bring it in. They said it just needed a little adjustment and I should be good. Fast forward a couple of weeks after that and we had the same issue again. Brought it back in and this time they said they used the warranty to  swap the pads for new ones and this type of issue  “almost never happens and I should be good from then.” Within a month we were right back at it. I made them aware and wasn’t able to get to the shop for another month. When I finally did, their posture was completely different this time around: extremely unprofessional. I was given a speech about haven waited too long to return back to the shop and how I must be breaking too hard; I was in disbelief. At that point I realized it was time to call it; these people were either incompetent or fraudulent. Took my car to a reputable shop and had to pay once again for the breaks to get done properly and with genuine parts. The other shop also discovered they had broken a couple of the wheel locks too. All in all, I had to pay for brakes twice and to replace parts that universal had damaged in the process of this debacle! JUST STAY AWAY!

leads.worst_review_text:
My Review of Morgan & Morgan — Deeply Disappointed After a Year of Delays and Poor Communication
My experience with Morgan & Morgan has been nothing short of exhausting and incredibly disappointing. I hired them after my accident over a year ago, believing their “For The People” message and “no upfront cost” promise meant I would receive strong representation and basic professionalism. Instead, what I encountered was month after month of unanswered emails, vague updates, and constant delays — especially when it came time for them to finally close out my case and provide my statement.
The email chain speaks for itself.
For weeks, I repeatedly asked the same simple questions: “What is the status?”, “Do you have the closing statement?”, “Can you provide an update?” Every response I got — when I got one at all — was some version of “We’re waiting on another department,” “Hopefully today,” or “I’ll do my best.”
Meanwhile, I was left completely in the dark.
No proactive communication.
No clear timeline.
No sense of urgency whatsoever.
Even after sending them a voided check so they could “speed things up,” the delays continued. I kept being told “end of day,” “today or tomorrow,” and “soon”—yet nothing happened. I had to chase them down for every single piece of information, sometimes going days or weeks without any response at all.
What makes this even more frustrating is that Morgan & Morgan takes a large percentage of any settlement, yet in my experience they provided minimal follow-through and poor customer service throughout the entire process. Their marketing paints a picture of a supportive, responsive law firm. In reality — at least in my case — it felt like dealing with a giant, automated system where real communication and real care were not part of the service.
I expected professionalism.
I expected timely responses.
I expected transparency about my settlement and closing documents.
Instead, what I got was delay after delay and a year-long process that should have been handled far more efficiently.
If you’re considering Morgan & Morgan because the commercials make them sound caring and accessible, I strongly suggest thinking twice. My experience shows a completely different side — one where the client is left waiting, guessing, and emailing endlessly just to get the most basic updates on their own case.
I would not recommend them based on what I went through.

leads.worst_review_text: I was really excited to work with this firm because they were highly recommended, and the reviews were good. However, I didn’t have a good experience. I was advised that they couldn’t determine that until I provided my social security number, and agreed for them to represent me. leads.address: 328 E 59th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
I PAID $400 FOR A DIGITAL PERM THAT ONLY LASTED 2 DAYS WITH NO REUNDS WHATSOEVER.

I made an appointment for a digital perm with Min, a MASTER STYLIST, on 7/23.
I showed her a picture of the look that I wanted, which is a Korean wave hairstyle. I told her this is my first time getting a perm and asked if this is doable. She said my hair is too fine so only a more prominent perm will last for my hair. She showed me a picture and I said that's fine. She then asked if I want layers or cut my hair (She later tells me that me refusing the layers or cuts is the problem with the outcome. But she never explained that. She only asked if I want layers or cuts). I said no and to just perm my hair starting from the cheek area.
That's all the conversation we had.

After she's done, I noticed that the curls were pretty low (picture of me in the green shirt. Pic I took once I got home that day).
She said this perm will last for 3 months and that I mustn't wash my hair for 48 hours.

I did this perm on Wednesday afternoon so I washed my hair again on Friday night. As soon as I blow dried my hair, the curls were mostly gone.

I contacted them the next day and sent pictures (the picture with the black shirt is what my hair looks like on Saturday) showing them my hair and asking for a refund. They said owner isn't there and that they'll contact me on Monday.

On Monday when they texted back to me (I think it was just Min and not the owner) , the only options they gave me were:
1) I can go back to redo my perm but I refused because I don't want to damage my hair anymore (Also why would I want to go back to your store when I had such a bad experience).
2) I can get 20% off any service within half a year (which is basically telling me to spend more money there).
But absolutely NO REFUND because they have a no refund policy.

I understand that some stores, especially service industries, have no refund policy to avoid being scammed by customers. However, I feel that depending on the situation, exceptions should be made. And this is exactly that type of situation.
If the stylist did the job right and it's just a problem with the customers preference, then I totally understand. But my case is that I paid $400 for a perm that was promised would last 3 months, but it fell out in just 2 days.

Min texted me back and this is what she wrote:
"I'm sorry to hear that and I understand how disappointed you are. But I'm not sure what your expectations of the perm were. Because the inspired photo that showed me was cutting layer and bang. And you refuse to have that If the hair cut isn't a similar result it would be a different style. I wish I could make you happier but I don't agree with this and if you go ask another stylist or salon I'm confident I wasn't wrong. We understand that our service may not have met your expectations. However as with restaurants and other businesses, we don't offer refunds simply because something didn't align with individual preferences."

This isn't a matter of preference. I do think that the problem could also be that my hair is just not fit for perming. But if so, I feel like she, the professional, should've said something. Just because the customer asked for it, it doesn't mean a hairstyle will work for them. The stylist also has the obligation to tell that to the customer and work something out so that both parties are happy. I do feel that this is no ones fault, but it still doesn't justify the amount I paid for such results.

I showed my hair to all my friends and they all agree that this is unacceptable and a refund is definitely a must.
I even asked for a partial refund and they still said no.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That's completely unacceptable - a $400 perm should last way longer than 2 days. Please call us directly so we can work out a proper solution, because this isn't right.

- T-Gardens New York Hair Salon

leads.worst_review_text: Pardalis has displayed nothing but deception in my business dealings with him. Choosing this lawyer has dragged me into a sea of shady business partners displaying zero accountability. I have filed formal complaints; in the interim I hope to deter others from getting tangled in his web of nepotism. After convincing me to use their colleagues for my property sales as well as to oversee the packing, storing and shipping of an entire house full of valuable heirloom antiques, they effectively stole my property. From the onset, bills were sent to me for  “expenses” and “services” without details such as hourly rates or itemized costs. When I asked to speak with Tasso personally, he flippantly insisted everything checked out and I continued to pay. I was not permitted to use the shippers of my choosing, who had a BBB presence. Their movers refused to speak with me in English, intentionally putting me in a position to constantly need the services of the lawyer so that I was constantly paying two people just to maintain storage or communicate. When I asked for my belongings to be shipped to me, Pardalis and his associates went dead silent. I have spent months reaching out to Pardalis for assistance in releasing my belongings from his clutches, month after month they strung me along with emails claiming they were “looking into it” until they stopped replying. As a point of reference, Tasso leaves glowing reviews on the business pages of his colleagues, while I alert him to blatant misconduct, he pretends to know nothing about what is transpiring. Perhaps he might  redirect his attention from inflating online ratings, to dealing with the the clients he is neglecting. My extensive, well documented correspondence with him and his associates reveal nothing more than a ring of defrauders believing they are beyond reproach.

I'm sharing so you can avoid this hotel. It is not what I have come to expect, neither from Marriott nor a 5 star hotel. Room was up to par, but wait time for elevators was abysmal, and had an extremely negative service experience that indicates poor management. I wish I would have picked any other hotel.

I chose the Zurich Marriott because I have status, had great stays with Marriott in the part, and wanted to treat my parents and brother to a nice weekend trip. Reception gave me a 1 drink voucher and explicitly offered that it could be extended to all 4 members of our booking. Staff member at Lenox Bar refused to honor it, sent me back to reception to get a second voucher, then continued to argue with me, insisted there was no misunderstanding, finally agreed after I flat out asked him whether he could make our drinks. I have no idea where this negativity came from, and would have just paid for the drinks if I had simply been given nonconflicting guidance. My parents were mortified and initially refused any drinks because they thought we'd actually done something wrong.

I escalated the experience to Guest Relations via email a few hours later, and in a wildly tone deaf series of exchanges, Lisa clarified that the voucher should have only been for 1 drink, promised to discuss internally, and offered to personally welcome us with drinks next time. No skin off their backs and completely missed the point -- the drinks were never the problem. Ultimately, I was told 10,000 Marriott points "reflects our effort to address the situation" and that I should've escalated it to management at the time of so they could address it directly (fantastic use of my last few hours of family vacation.) Extremely frustrating experience and can't believe I paid for this. In a crowded market, I feel zero need to patronize Marriott again.

This hotel helped me realise it's possible to be too hot and too cold at the same time. Also, all the rooms apparently have an inescapable high pitched fluorescent whining noise. Fun!

Update: As I was writing this review, my partner discovered the over-exuberant shower. The water pressure is so great that it will push the showerhead to point at the ceiling and the tiny gap between the shower room and the rest of the room if not actively managed. Pros: The water was hot. Cons: The water knows no god but its own.

This hotel looks outwardly amazing. There are so many good things to say about the decor - quirky, interesting, unique and beautifully curated public areas, the food - highly recommend the restaurant which serves some of the best middle eastern food I’ve had in a long time, the location - 10 minute walk from the station, lots going on in the area, the soundproofing - even though it’s a lively area the windows block out almost all of the noise from outside.||Unfortunately there were a few things that have prompted a poor review. These may be particular to me and may not bother other people. ||||1) no air conditioning. There’s apparently an ‘air cooling system’ in the rooms but we had it on the coldest setting and the room was way too hot to sleep comfortably in. We had such poor sleep because of this. ||||2) when you’ve barely slept, all you want is a coffee asap in the morning and there are no facilities to make a coffee or tea or anything in the room. The mini bar is free but it had just water (which is usually free anyway), two basic beers and a cola of some brand I didn’t recognise. So no coffee in the room meant having to wait until showered and dressed etc to go for breakfast.||||3) which brings me to the final point. The shower. There was no privacy as the shower had a clear door and as there wasn’t a bathroom as such (just a separate loo, separate shower, and the sink in the actual bedroom) it meant that you were showering with a clear door which offered no privacy at all from the main room. ||||I get that they’re branding as different and quirky, but honestly, for over £300 a night, I don’t expect no air conditioning, no coffee making facilities in the room, and no privacy to shower. We stayed in a different hotel in a different part of Switzerland earlier in our trip and it was much cheaper but had all the basics covered which I think this hotel needs to do before trying to be quirky and different. I do regret spending this as mount of money staying here.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The cooling system clearly didn't work for your stay - that's frustrating when you can't sleep. You're right about the basics like coffee facilities, especially at that price point.

- 25hours Hotel Zürich Langstrasse
