The kettle suggestion makes sense - we've heard that before. New Year's breakfast was chaos, you're right about that.

- Hotel Motel One Zürich

leads.worst_review_text: I stayed here on the 9th-10th December, the room was had no window (outside facing) and hot, I requested the reception to change my room. The attitude and response was very negative/unfriendly and therefore I canceled my future stay with this hotel too. The only nice part was the bar and restaurant staff at the hotel.

Despite its good location, this was the worst hotel I’ve stayed in. The rooms are dirty, doors are swollen from water damage, and several pieces of furniture are missing. The fridge makes loud noises all night, and the breakfast is truly disappointing — the eggs are always cold, and the rest of the food is questionable at best. The coffee tastes like typical cheap hotel coffee. Breakfast is served in a basement with an unpleasant atmosphere.

Although it’s rated as a 4-star hotel on Booking, there’s not a single star to be seen at the property. There’s no information in the room about the hotel or services. The beds are tiny, and the sheets are so small you can barely cover yourself. No bathrobes, no amenities — nothing that would justify four stars.

The only advantage is the central location, which is great if you want to explore Vienna easily. But unless you can’t afford something better, be prepared to compromise a lot — Vienna can be tough on a budget.

Terrible service! The waiter, Ivo, was jumpy and clearly unhinged — he definitely needs a day off.
The soup was served in a jar, which made it very inconvenient to eat.
I ordered ice cream with the strudel, but it seemed like part of the portion was missing.
The atmosphere is interesting for children, but don’t set your expectations too high when it comes to the food.

A failure in professionalism, not what you expect from a 3 Michelin star restaurant

As frequent Michelin star restaurant diners who plan trips around renowned restaurants, my husband and I were eagerly anticipating our lunch at Steirereck on September 22, 2025.
One doesn't go to a 3-star establishment just to eat; one goes for a flawless, delightful culinary experience that stands well above average. Unfortunately, our visit was a masterclass in how not to handle guests when things go wrong.

The issues began with a serious hygiene lapse. After our first course, a dark, curly hair was sitting wrapped around my newly placed silverware. The server didn't even notice the hair, and she placed it there herself!!!! When we pointed it out to her, the apology was scarce and perfunctory.
We are human, and we understand hiccups happen, so we decided not to make a fuss. What defines a top-tier restaurant, however, is its reaction. Here, there was no manager rushing over — just a quiet replacement of the utensils as if nothing had happened. We decided not to let it spoil the experience, even deleted the picture I took.

The second failure was environmental. Sitting by the window on a +27°C day, we were baking in the sun. It was September, so the management went through the summer with this, and we were probably not the first who complained.
The sun was blazing in, and while a curtain was shading another table, we were left in the heat. We asked for more shade, and while solar blinds were lowered, they did little to help. My husband was genuinely suffering. We asked for the manager, but only the floor supervisor came. We explained the problem, and then... nothing happened for 10-15 minutes. By the time our main course was being served, we were still waiting for a solution. In a truly awkward moment, my husband had to ask them to physically shift our table into a sliver of shade, which they did while our main dishes were on it. It was absurd.

The mood was completely spoiled. We decided to just push through and not let it ruin our vacation.

The true lack of professionalism was revealed at the end.
To add insult to injury, when we were leaving, we saw two perfectly unoccupied tables in a cooler, shaded section. I asked the floor supervisor about this, she claimed they had planned to move us after our main course. This excuse made no sense—why not move us and then serve the mains?
When I recounted the hair incident to the supervisor, her "sorry" was utterly insincere, as if it was something regular and we were just picky. Shocking!!!!!

It's crucial to understand: this was a demonstration of the absolute lack of proper training and reaction. Hiccups are inevitable; a poorly trained staff that cannot manage them is not.

And for the record, the bill and service charge were processed very smoothly—no complaints there.

The food was good (not excellent) and beewax as cooking agent was very interesting, but at this level, "good" isn't enough to justify the prestige and the highest level of the industry.
Also I have to be fair and mention fine linens and silverware, they were noticed.
The one standout was the wonderful man serving the bread cart—he and the bread selection  delivered a glowing positive experience.

Verdict: Based on the combination of a hygiene lapse and a complete failure in service problem-solving, this is simply not a 3 Michelin star establishment. The lack of urgency, empathy, and a genuine apology was staggering. We expected an unforgettable meal, but for all the wrong reasons, that's exactly what we got.

This was a sharp contrast to our very recent visits to 2 Michelin star restaurants in Dublin and Mexico city.
leads.ai_response_draft:
You're absolutely right - the hair on silverware and leaving you in blazing heat for that long isn't acceptable at any level. We clearly failed you that day and I'm addressing this directly with our team.

- Steirereck

leads.worst_review_text:
I have stayed in different Mercure hotels in different countries - this was by far the worst!.

Read a lot of reviews before booking - I thought they were made up, until I checked in.

What hotel doesn’t have a basic kettle in the room? I am not asking for a coffee machine with pods which are readily available in budget hotels.

They should not advertise their rooms as air conditioned - surely someone needs to be certifying that claim.

Will I stay in that same hotel again - No.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That's rough feedback and honestly deserved. No kettle is basic stuff we got wrong, and the AC issue is something we're dealing with right now. Email me directly and I'll sort out your next Hamburg stay properly.

- Mercure Hotel Hamburg City

leads.worst_review_text:
TOTALLY LET DIWN BY OPODO AND NOVUM

I booked the Novum Hotel Hamburg Stradzentrum through Opodo for a trip with friends, and the experience was very disappointing from start to finish. After booking, I discovered that the hotel is located in a red light area and had shared bathrooms, which was not made clear during the booking process. Because of this, we felt uncomfortable staying there and tried to cancel or transfer to another Novum property.

However, we were repeatedly passed back and forth between Opodo and Novum Hotels. Opodo told me the hotel had to handle the booking, while the hotel insisted everything had to go through Opodo. Novum’s central reservations team also failed to respond or help. Despite several phone calls and emails to both sides, no one took responsibility or offered a solution.

In the end, I lost the money I paid for the accommodation due to this complete lack of support, even though I acted well in advance and for legitimate reasons. We ended up booking a Premier Inn instead, which was excellent - clear communication, helpful staff,and exactly as advertised.

By comparison, the service from both Opodo and Novum Hotels was extremely poor. I would not recommend booking through either based on this experience.

Location is good as close to the main train station but the main road is super busy and noisy.
Rooms are very stuffy and bath room smells very musty.
The whole hotel is very dull, no nice looking interior design nor any vibrant colours. It’s stuck in the 90s.
The air con in the room is so noisy you think a train runs thru the room but w/o it the room is just too stuffy.
The WLAN you can only use if you sign up with for the hotel chain rewards program incl setting up a profile with password - ridiculous! There was an option saying if you don’t want to sign up for it ask reception to get you WLAN access code but when we called reception the reply was this option is only for banquet customers - ridiculous!

I will definitely not stay in an Intercity Hotel again!

Location is fine but the rooms are so bad. Extremely dated, mattress was legit possibly the single most uncomfortable mattress I’ve ever slept on in my life. Pillows were way too thin as well. Like I was in prison. Carpet horrible. Very small.

Then to top it off I had cleaners knock on my door TWICE (waking me up) hours before my checkout time at midday. Yes, I know I can put up not to disturb, but cleaners supposedly don’t even clean rooms unless requested anyway which I didnt and I hadn’t checked out yet!

Perhaps it’s a somewhat cheap hotel but I’ve stayed in cheaper which were nicer. Would never stay here again.
i couldnt attend, had to cancel, they werent near fully booked had to pay 137Euro in fees, totally illogical.

leads.business_name: Holiday Inn Hamburg - Hafencity by IHG

leads.worst_review_text:
My mother’s purse was stolen inside the hotel’s breakfast restaurant. She left the table for literally 25 seconds to help me carry a plate from the buffet back to the table. When we returned, her bag was gone.The purse contained all of our cash for the trip, valuable cards, and many important items.

The hotel’s reaction? Utterly shameful. They barely cared, told us to “go to the police,” and insisted they “can’t do anything about it.” They didn’t even bother to check anything as if this is a regular occurrence in their hotel. This is a so‑called “5-star” hotel that doesn’t have any security cameras in the restaurant.
They didn’t even investigate.

To make matters worse, during our stay we also found a mouse in the bar. That says everything about their hygiene standards. We had seen thi mouse outside a few times before but one of the days it was inside, again the staff didn't seem completely bothered however a few other guests were not happy.

If you value your safety, your belongings, and basic customer care, do not stay here, there are many other amazing hotels in Hamburg where you won't loose your belongings.

For a hotel with the reputation and pricing of Bayerischer Hof, our experience was extremely disappointing.

The room was advertised as a double room with both a king bed and a twin, and the photos clearly showed two separate beds. Instead, we were given a room with only one king bed, and when we raised the issue, the staff were dismissive rather than helpful.

We also attempted to book spa treatments, only to be told that they did not know when anything would be available because the therapist was out. Throughout our entire stay, no treatments were offered at all, something unacceptable for a luxury hotel.

The room itself fell short of expectations: it was dark, had stains on the couches, low ceilings, and unimpressive décor. For the price, the overall quality was far below what one would expect from a five-star property.

To make matters worse, no one assisted with my luggage down the stairs. A staff member commented, “I see you are able to do it yourself, so you won’t need any help,” and walked away. The remark was deeply disrespectful and left a lasting negative impression.

Overall, our stay did not meet the standards promised by a hotel of this category, and we left feeling extremely disappointed.

Edit: I reached out to their customer service team and no one responded. This generic response here is copy and pasted on all negative reviews. Poor customer service!
leads.ai_response_draft:
Jen, I'm genuinely sorry about the room mix-up with the beds and especially the dismissive treatment you received from our staff - that comment about your luggage was completely inappropriate and not reflective of our values. You're absolutely right that our spa availability should have been communicated upfront, and the room quality issues you describe are unacceptable for what you paid. I want to personally address these service failures with my team and would like to speak with you directly about making this right - please contact me at the front desk so we can have a proper conversation about your experience.

- Hotel Bayerischer Hof, Munich

leads.worst_review_text:
I honestly don’t know why this place has any good reviews — it’s filthy. The room smelled stale, the floors looked like they hadn’t been cleaned, and there were old, disgusting items left under the bed — clear proof no one had bothered to check the room. The bathroom was grimy with dirt in the corners and a sticky floor. Reception were uninterested and rude, acting like this was normal. Nothing like the pictures online and absolutely not worth the price.
“Posting on a friend’s account to maintain my privacy.”

UPDATE: our stay was marred by an unpleasant encounter in the reception who would not honor the breakfast rate we were given at check in. It’s not cool to agree to a rate you’re given by hotel staff only to be told you are wrong and for staff to repeat and raise their voice at you. It doesn’t change the fact that it’s their mistake, not ours. That’s false advertising. The manager was called and he honored the price agreed to upon check in. In terms of reception & housekeeping service improvements and retraining is needed. It’s not at par with Marriott hotels we have stayed in all over the world.

UPDATE 2: I removed another star because they don’t change used glasses to clean ones and they don’t restock the toiletries. We used up the earbuds and I needed one on the last night but there was no replacement.

-

The exterior looks dated but the interiors have been wonderfully renovated. I love the modern gold details in the lobby. The cafe/bar and staircase is stunning.

When we arrived at 6pm & our son’s sofa bed had not been made up, room towels were only for 2 with zero robes. We requested for 2 extra pillows in our booking but had to request 2 more times. They made the sofa bed but only brought 1 extra pillow.

When we arrived tired in the evening it was convenient to eat at the Champions Sports Restaurant on the ground floor or EG. Big servings and delicious food.

My son and husband were excited to swim, but after requesting and waiting we were told that there are no robes and they aren’t sure if there are towels by the pool. On 29 Dec 80pm there were too many people in the pool area. It was chaotic. The next day they went to the pool first thing and it was much better. But sad they only got to swim once. Still no robes.

The breakfast buffet is only €19/person and half for kids. It’s good value so we decided to eat in the hotel for breakfast. It was very crowded. (UPDATE: So this was wrong according to reception upon  check out who repeated this to us multiple times like we were hard of hearing. The manager had to be called)

There is a 24/7 Market by the lobby which has some free infused water & refreshments. We bought sparkling water but had no need to because they supply fresh Bavarian mineral water (still or sparkling) on water stations around the hotel. They have a refillable glass bottle in the room which is good value and more environmentally friendly than plastic bottles.

One the 2nd day we got the extra pillow and the robes delivered to our room but the robes were too late.

leads.business_name: Premier Inn München City Zentrum Hotel
leads.worst_review_text:
NEVER AGAIN!

We were traveling with friends and a child and planned to spend two days in Munich. We had booked two rooms from December 11 to December 13, 2025, but at the reception desk we were told that our reservation was actually from January 11 to January 13, 2026!

However, we were 100% assured that if we contacted the booking service through which the reservation was made, we would receive a full refund. The service would send a letter to the hotel, and the hotel would refund the full amount — that was the stated procedure. They assured us that they fully understood the situation, checked our reservation once again, and guaranteed a refund, while asking us to leave the hotel so as not to create a queue, as there were many guests.

After sending an email, I received a reply of just two sentences and a 90% cancellation penalty, despite the fact that my message was sent one month before the January 2026 check-in date. I wrote another email explaining the situation again and recounting the conversation we had with the hotel staff when we were there. The reply I received was simply a copy of the same message they had sent before.

The result: a 90% penalty, additional expenses for an emergency same-day accommodation search in Munich, catching a cold from waiting outside, and ruined Christmas holidays! The conversation at the reception desk turned out to be completely meaningless, as the hotel’s support service behaves in a completely opposite manner. We will continue to investigate how this booking issue happened.

The location of the hotel is great, but that’s about it. Although the hotel is self-service, the lack of a reception really shows when you have encounter issues with your room or when you are new to the town and need additional information. Several people were struggling to check-in or figure out the elevator. I would definitely avoid this kind of hotels in the future.

IMO the room was feeling crammed because of the irregular shape, the blankets were strangely split in half, the bed was pretty small and the note “everything in the fridge is yours” with only a bottle of water being there was strange. There was also quite a bit of noise because of the passing trains and trams.

The bigger issue is that during our entire stay the sink was clogged and dirt would keep coming out of it.

If I could give a lower score I would, I was happy four years ago with the dentist services but KRISTINA ,the manager is a BIG COLLECTOR! Be careful, I was quote an amunt of $2300 for my implant, and then verbally when I was going to pay she was on the phone and said, no is $3000, how did she came out with this amount?, covid hit and I have being paying whatever I can ,but haven't being able to finish paying the amount of $866, tx to her I am trying to finifh paying. She is the worse person on earth, not to mention one time a cleaning and a filling done on my tooth was cote $600, had the cash,  count it a illion times and she told me $60 dllrs were mussing, how come, be aware of this woman Kristina, has no feelings.Thanks to her, I am still in debt with Care Cedit.

This office has been canceling our appointments since 2021 L. Every time we have an apt fir a cleaning every 6 months it us canceled or you show up and they say your not even on their schedule. This time the hygienist is goi g to be out in Monday . I have never had a dental office do thus over and over. The apts are made 6 months in advance. How and why dies this keep happening ? This is like the 5th time since 2021 after the  initial lockdowns and then they finally started taking apts again. Don’t choose them.

I had a very disappointing stay at this hotel. First, they charged me for parking on the street even though it was a free public parking area – a complete scam. Second, they took €5 from me for a city tax even though all taxes and fees were clearly included in my booking. The room had no carpet, just a bare cement-like floor, which felt uncomfortable and unfinished. The staff were also very rude and unprofessional. Lastly, the bathroom and toilet were in terrible hygienic condition. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. Be careful before booking – this place is nothing like what they advertise.

A pretty wild stay. To add to the other reviews posted: the door to the room didn't close properly, no utensils or basic amenities you'd usually expect from even the most basic of hotels. No cups, cutlery, water, shampoo, coffee, etc. we asked for a spoon at reception and they charged us 50 cents for a disposable wooden one 😆 one of the windows didn't open properly, the elevator malfunctioned, the safe in the room didn't work, you get the gist. Just stay away. There are other hotels out there for the same price but ya know, better.

I had high expectations based on the great reviews, but my experience at Taverna Athene was disappointing.

Despite having a reservation, I received little attention and had to wait quite a while. The table offered was not great, and overall the service felt disorganized.

The dish I had was okay, but definitely not exceptional—nothing that would justify the wait or make the visit memorable.

Maybe it was just an off night, but I expected more from a place with such high ratings.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That sounds like we had a rough service night and didn't take care of you properly. The long wait with a reservation is especially frustrating - that's on us. Give us another shot when you're in Kreuzberg again.

- Taverna Athene

leads.worst_review_text: Initially I was very happy with the service here. Some months ago I cracked my back tooth and needed some ceramic filling. I was able to get a quick appointment and was satisfied with the service from the dentist herself. However, last week when the filling simply fell off again during a meal. I’d say that for the costs of the treatment I would have expected at least 2 years of no trouble with this. So I am not too content with the quality of the work perhaps. Again, this is my experience and is not indicative of Zahnarztzentrums overall service and quality, which I am sure is good.

Want to get ripped of? Then this is the place to be. I went for a one time appointment and paid right after the treatment. A year later a received an additional bill from my insurance with amounts i already paid for. After 100 phone calls and emails they promised to transfer me my money back. I have never received anything. Strongly advice you to avoid this place.

leads.business_name: Zahnarzt Zürich HB ShopVille | Notfall Zahnarzt | swiss smile
leads.address: Zürich Hauptbahnhof / ShopVille, Bahnhofplatz 9/Etage U1, 8001 Zürich, Switzerland

leads.worst_review_text:
I am very much disappointed  this time . My son was there almost three times for teeth cleaning. I paid 60 to 80 CHF every time.but today I was there with my daughter for teeth cleaning too and I had to pay double amount for the same treatment which is 160 CHF. And second reason is that I gave her Gutscheine from school 88 chf . She took me from Gutschein and 160 chf too. When I asked to deduct from Gutschein she said this is not for you we had control with your daughter. But before Gutschein she even didn’t know about any control.And she was very rude.
I just recommend to everyone you should ask the prices before your visit.

leads.business_name: Zahnarzt Zürich Bahnhofstrasse | swiss smile Zentrum für Zahnmedizin
leads.worst_review_text: they make you feel like you're their 50th appointment of the day and made me feel very uncomfortable about a dental issue I had rather than providing sound professional advice which I would look for at a dentist... would not recommend this place, I think they benefit from their location as opposed to the qualifications of their staff

I've seen jail cells smaller than the rooms here. There is a bed and a couple of feet around it at most. Not even enough room to open a large suit case. Beds were mediocre. Breakfast was good. Easy walk to the train/town. We crashed here for one night after a long flight. I guess it was good enough for that, but comfort it was not.

I am staying at this hotel and experiencing many issues. I reported an issue with the power sockets and USB ports 2 days before and till now there is no response from the staff. Upon asking they said ticket is open. (For what? When will you fix it, after I leave?). I also reported that the floor lamp is not working and they did not change it. Room has very bad lighting. You cant even see your food properly. There is no ceiling lights (ok so there is no ceiling cover itself, its just a cement slab). Upon booking the room it was clearly mentioned that washing machine with the room. Upon arrival I got to know they meant paid laundry.

Never expected such a terrible stay at Radisson. Before this I stayed at 5 other hotels in this holiday and didn’t face any issue at all. Though they were not so famous chain. But Radiasson is most expensive of them all and most regrettable. Never going to stay with them ever again!!

I spoke to the staff member Ariana. She was so rude on the face. Upon telling her the problems with the rooms she straight up said “thats your opinion”, “I was not there yesterday so I don’t know”, “do you want to change the room or not” (9:30PM at night). I don’t know this was discrimination or the staff is always rude.

I'd recommend this place only for its location, and the ability to use the gym and sauna. Breakfast's choice for 20 CHF was so poor... the scrambled eggs were definitely made out of powder. Breakfast is until 10:30, but they start to clean at around 10:10, which I've never experienced before... the noise that comes from the kitchen is very distracting.
We also extended our stay from the 1st reservation that was made by the company, and the service was not informed about it, so on the day when the extension started, they knocked to our room 3 times, and even though I mentioned that our stay was extended, I had to call the reception.
On the day of the final check out, they also knocked to our room 2 times before the check out time... and once they knock, they enter the room!!! This is unacceptable... I've never experienced something like that before.

WORST HOTEL IVE EVER BEEN TO! DO NOT COME HERE!
I’ve stayed in some budget hotels in my time but this was the worst.
The budget hotel is around the corner from the ibis and it felt like we were the poor cattle that the elite didn’t want to see.
The rooms were tiny - I opened my suitcase and it took up the entire floor space. The shower is in the room!!!! There is no privacy!!! I was staying with my friend so we had to take it in turns to go downstairs to the reception while the other showered. And we were gaslit into thinking it’s normal. There are signs in the shower saying ‘we know this is unusual but it’s part of our creative design! You can give your partner a private concert with your shower singing! Enjoy the free entertainment!’ You shower for 5 minutes and everything in your room is damp. The toilet is in a cupboard in the room which is so high that your feet don’t touch the ground. And you can hear everything and smell everything from the toilet when you’re in bed. The WiFi doesn’t work, the plugs are too small for European sockets.
The breakfast was infested with flies - everything had flies on it. I ate plain porridge as the oats were in a sealed jar and used hot water from the coffee machine as it was the only thing that didn’t have flies on it. The worst place I’ve ever stayed. Not a single redeeming factor!!!

Very disappointed with this hotel.  First of all its in the middle of nowhere. The room has a concrete floor....no carpet,lino etc. The double bed is placed against the wall making it difficult for the person on the inside to get in and out. There is no kettle only a nespresso machine. Haven't had much of an encounter with staff yet so can't comment on that.
Staff were very helpful. They got us a kettle and a small fridge.

After half a year of trying to find a proper orthodontist in Vienna, because I haven’t been able to come home to Ukraine since the war started, a friend of mine recommended this clinic.
I contacted the clinic to ask for an appointment. My request was “politely” declined as I was told that I cannot get help from this clinic, because I already have braces which they didn’t install. I tried to explain the situation(I cannot come to my doctor because he went to the war and it is not that I am bored; I just wanted to find proper care as I am already trying  to solve my problems with braces for 10 years), and that I would pay as everyone else not asking for any discounts , but still I was rejected as a client. It was a huge disappointment as I never expected that a doctor could reject a patient in need especially I such a situation. Just pure shame.

Do yourself a favor and choose a different place. One star is too much for this place.

I've been coming here for years and have never had any complaints until two weeks ago. I went to the emergency room, had a root canal done, and ended up spending two weeks on antibiotics because THEY DON'T STERILIZE THEIR INSTRUMENTS. The hygiene is poor, communication is lacking, and the treatment of patients is unacceptable.

I asked for a check-up appointment and was told by the doctor that he had no time and many patients. As if it were my fault that the staff doesn't communicate properly, and that management is responsible for not hiring enough staff.

The hygiene is extremely poor, with trash left out in the open. You will be left standing around, confused about everything. The staff wears fake jewelry on their wrists, and their hair is down during appointments. It's disorganized and frustrating.

Thank you.
Lg,

leads.business_name: Dr. Lukas Hallmann – Zahnarzt in Wien

leads.worst_review_text: That was the horrible experience waiting for  more than 2 hours and no sign of dental technician. Took an appointment in Lower austria on same day within 1 hour they solve my problem.

In my opinion not a real Hilton.
Poor Christmas decoration. Depressive and cheap. The outside area in front of the river was like abounded.
We booked New Year's Eve and didn't have available table for dinner…so we had to search elsewhere.
Room service after 23.00 stop responding.
Problem with the heat during all night. The room was like a fridge. They couldn't solve the problem so they give me an electrical heat-unbelievable. The basic ground heat near the windows didn't work at all and they admit it-just like that!
No slippers-we had to ask.
No bathrobes-we had to ask.
With just a "sorry" from the employees....problems aren't solved and they behaved like nothing happened.
I would never visit that hotel again and I would never recommend it.

I stayed at this hotel on September 29th. The room was completely different from the photos on the website. It was very small, with the toilet on one side of the room and the shower and sink on the other side. The hotel is also right beside a street, and the car noise can be heard clearly inside the room.
Definitely its not 4 stars hotel.

Extremely unprofessional attitude — I am honestly in shock.
Here’s what happened: a group of teenage rhythmic gymnasts were traveling for a competition together with their coaches. As athletes, they have a strict schedule and routine, and we have never had any issues or complaints with accommodation anywhere before — from either side. We expected the same this time, but we were terribly wrong.
The booking was made well in advance through the Booking.com platform, so the hotel staff definitely saw it. The reservation had been confirmed and active for almost a month. Just as we were about to make full payment, the hotel contacted us (via Booking.com) with a shocking message:
“We cannot accommodate your group.”
Mind you, finding alternative accommodation for 21 people just a little over a week before the competition is almost impossible!
Then came “option two”:
“You can still stay, but you must pay an extra €50 in cash for each teenager.”
Excuse me — WHAT?! Their explanation was that they would “refund it later if everything is fine.” Sure… I can just imagine how that would go when everyone is rushing to the airport. The staff could easily delay things until you give up — and the cash “extra” stays in their pockets.
This is absolutely unacceptable and unethical behavior.
It’s clear that this hotel cares more about squeezing money out of guests than about hospitality or professionalism.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That deposit demand was completely wrong and I understand your shock. We messed up badly with how this was handled, especially so close to your competition. Please contact me directly so we can make this right for your team.

- PLAZA INN Amedia Wien

leads.worst_review_text:
Really quirky hotel! Lovely rooms and great shower! Breakfast was amazing!! Be sure to order an omelette! Chefs kiss! We also had mimosas to finish which were a real treat!
Rooftop bar is magnificent! The cocktails are sooo good! Big shout out to our bar waiter Marrick.. what a top notch guy! Very friendly and excellent service! A credit to the hotel! Thanks guys we will be back!!
leads.ai_response_draft:
Those omelettes are pretty special - glad Marrick took good care of you at the rooftop bar too.

- 25hours Hotel Vienna at MuseumsQuartier

leads.worst_review_text:
Good day. I travel a lot, I've been to different countries, all over Europe, I have something to compare with.
The only plus of the hotel is a tolerable breakfast.
Now about the minuses:
1) Disgusting location. The windows overlook noisy locations on both sides. The stench of sewage from the metro side.
2) The area is disadvantaged. Lots of alcoholics, drug addicts, migrants in the park - I don't recommend leaving late.
3) The room has no infrastructure. No kettle, dishes.
4) The staff either does not fulfill requests, or does them reluctantly. I asked to prepare breakfast, since we were leaving early, before breakfast. In Thailand for example with the same situation, they prepared a lunchbox for me. The hotel employee deceived me that there would be ALL food at 5 am. There were yesterday's croissants, and that's all - NOTHING ELSE - Is it really so difficult for a person with a paid breakfast to pack a sandwich and yogurt?
The staff is intended to give advices and toxic comments (staff are speaking about you, your style, money etc near you).
5) Dusty room and bed linen.
6) The elevator takes forever, there is no separate elevator for cleaning ladies and equipment. You can wait 20 minutes.
I have stayed at Ibis in other countries many times before, it was pretty good. 3* does not correspond.

First, the room key card did not work at all. We replaced the key card five times, and every time it showed a red light and failed to open the door. Only your staff’s master key was able to open the door, which clearly indicates a problem with the door lock or system rather than with the key cards themselves. This meant we were unable to access our room independently.

Second, the shower water in our room was cold, making it impossible to shower comfortably. This is a basic facility that should be guaranteed for all guests.

Third, we were charged for snacks taken from the cabinet in the room without any price list or clear information displayed. Charging guests without providing transparent pricing is unacceptable and misleading.

All of these issues caused significant inconvenience and negatively affected our stay. I would appreciate a clear explanation regarding these problems and appropriate compensation for the inconvenience caused.
leads.ai_response_draft:
Those are serious problems that we completely messed up on. The key card system failing five times and cold shower water - that's not acceptable for any guest. Please contact me directly at the hotel so we can make this right with proper compensation.

- Austria Trend Parkhotel Schönbrunn

leads.worst_review_text: We came to this hotel as a family with a dog and we were welcomed by multiple small black hairs on our pillows and bed and also long white and yellow hairs on the little sofa pillows. We asked to change the room and they immediately changed it which i found very friendly and helpful but nonetheless there shouldn't have been hair in the first place which disgusted me for the rest of my stay. The rooms also lack the bare necessities a hotel should have in my opinion, like a hotel phone to contact the other rooms and reception, a place to sit and relax like a sofa which was only in the first room we had but not in the second "cube" room, there were some towels missing and coffee, tea machines or simple water and glasses. I didnt like the rooms or the housekeeping. The breakfast was fine but didnt have a lot of good options for vegans. The hotel is also pretty far away from the centre of town so walking is not an option.

The Mercure Hotel has the advantage of being very well located in the city center, which makes it easy to reach most tourist attractions and shopping areas on foot. The nearby garden is also a nice feature. However, when compared to other Mercure hotels and their standards, this property falls short in several areas, except for cleanliness.

The room facilities are outdated. For example, the television is extremely old and only offers basic channels, there is no Smart TV, so streaming services like Netflix are not possible. The carpets are worn and visibly old, especially on the floor, and it is clear that no major renovation has taken place in at least the past 15 years.

The bathroom layout is particularly inconvenient and unhygienic: the toilet is located in a very small separate room near the entrance door, which also contains the only full-length mirror. To wash your hands, you must leave the toilet, cross the sleeping area, and go to the shower room, which is far from ideal.

The minibar is free, which is appreciated, and includes water, beer, Coca-Cola, and orange juice, as offered in some Mercure hotels. However, the room was cold due to old windows that do not properly insulate against low temperatures.

Breakfast was very disappointing. The scrambled eggs were unappealing, as new batches were continuously mixed with old ones, giving them an unpleasant, meat-like appearance. The bread and pastries were mostly not fresh; the cakes, in particular, were extremely dry and seemed to come from a discount supplier. The selection was limited, and live or show cooking was practically non-existent. Additionally, tables were often not properly prepared; we frequently had to look for cutlery and napkins ourselves or partially clean tables before sitting down.

Considering the price of over €370 per night, the overall experience was extremely poor. As an Accor member entitled to a welcome drink, the service was so underwhelming that I did not even feel inclined to use the minibar during my four-day stay. While the idea of an older, charming hotel can be appealing, at this price point I would honestly rate an Ibis Budget higher, as it offers better amenities and service. Apart from the housekeeping staff, no one ever asked about my stay, not even during checkout.

Overall, this was not a good experience. The hotel urgently needs to focus on improving room standards, customer care, service quality, and especially the breakfast offering.

leads.address: 5020 Lake Shore Rd, Hamburg, NY 14075, USA

leads.business_name: Western New York Dental Group Hamburg

leads.worst_review_text: I was treated badly when I confronted the Dentist and asked questions about my treatment.  He tried to force me into paying for something I did not want.  They were billing my insurance company incorrectly/processing errors which caused a long delay in my treatment that led to 2 teeth not being able to be repaired.  When I told the Dentist that I did not want what he was trying to get me to prepay for, he dismissed me from the practice.  I had my last Dentist for over 20 years.  This has never happened to me before.  I am not happy with the care I was given.

leads.address: 469 W State St, Hamburg, PA 19526, USA

leads.worst_review_text:
Called ,  asked about available
appointments . The lady who I spoke to on the phone was rude and clearly not interested in being helpful....wonder how many potential clients have been lost because of that employee. Hamburg Dentistry you really should work on your employees customer service skills.

The Hotel tried to get this review removed. I submitted proof of  stay to google 🙃

Tiny rooms, size of a walk-in closet. No laundry service, awful breakfast...

Worst guest experience … the lady at the reception refused to talk to me because i arrived before check in hour and she said: « i am not a hotel guest yet …. And in germany there are rules .. » but in hotels all around the world there are rules.. and Guest are guest
Never seen such a bad and disrespectful receptionnist. I am sure never coming back here and i would advise anyone with dignity to not come to this hotel.

I do not recommend this hotel, and my opinion has nothing to do with cleanliness, food, or the appearance of the rooms – all of these aspects are truly of high standard.
Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this place because of the afternoon front desk service.

Everything went perfectly during the booking process and earlier business communication. We arrived as a group of three on a business trip, with reservations made well in advance. Upon arrival, we were placed on different floors, despite the booking being made together.

We also had the impression that the receptionist was displeased by the fact that we were speaking Polish to each other. Although we had a confirmed parking reservation, we were initially refused a spot because the receptionist claimed our car was too long. This issue had been discussed over the phone earlier, and we were assured that the vehicle would fit. Morning front desk gave us a parking space immidiately – without any problem. The afternoon reception was not answering the phone - were not happy that they (he) must open parking garage for us. My colleague spoke to the manager and the attitude has changed.

In summary, while the hotel itself is really good in terms of facilities, cleanliness, and food, the attitude and behavior of the afternoon reception staff were unprofessional and disappointing enough for me not to recommend this hotel every! Never to business and international envirionment.

Pros:
Cheap, and close to the Ubahn for easy travel to the city center.

Cons:
Not clean at all. Dirty cups, cutlery, and a half empty bottle of water from a previous guest. Very dirty floor, that definitely hasn't been vacuumed.

I feels like they are very sloppy with their cleaning and checking the room, as there are several remnants of previous guests

I thought i paid for one of the nicer rooms. but it was not nice at all. Only good thing about the room was that it was big. There was horrible air quality because of no aircondition. there was an old noisy plug-in fan. The balcony had no «wall» between the other rooms. so people could walk in your room if they wanted. the balcony door had to be open at all times because of the bad air quality. The room was also outdated. I am surprised the hotel has a 4 star rating.
leads.ai_response_draft: Oliver, I'm truly sorry your room fell so short of what you expected when booking with us. You're absolutely right that poor air circulation and a shared balcony space creates an uncomfortable and concerning situation - no guest should have to choose between fresh air and privacy, or deal with outdated facilities when paying for quality accommodations. We're taking your feedback directly to our operations team to address these room condition issues immediately. - Hotel Hafen Hamburg

leads.worst_review_text: perfect hotel if you wanna find out what it’s like to live inside of an ashtray! the smell is terrible, gave me horrible sinuses. the staff is absolutely lovely though and they carry the place!

The shower is full of black mold, I asked the staff to check and clean it but they don't do anything about it. Its so much if you touch it it comes off so definitely a health hazard. Its not really a hotel, more a hostel. No basic room utilities like cups, water cooker, tea, fridge etc. Location is close to Altona station. Car parking is 15 eu/day, you can find cheaper if you look around but its decent.

leads.business_name: Premier Inn Hamburg City Alster Hotel

leads.address: 279 W State St, Hamburg, PA 19526, USA

leads.worst_review_text: I usually start with the good things about a restaurant first, but I honestly have nothing to start with here. If I could leave a negative 5 star review, I would. The service was slow, our appetizer was brought to the wrong table and it took 20 minutes just to get that. The wings were luke warm, soggy, and flavorless when they finally came out. I had to choke down 3 of them only because I was starving at this point. The carrots were WHITE, and the celery was nearly limp and had no crunch at all. The Bleu cheese portion was the smallest I have ever seen in WNY. My daughter's chicken tenders were also terrible. I could see and taste chunks of uncooked corn meal in the breading. The fries were OK, but nothing more than frozen fries from a bag. As for cleanliness, we had flies all over our table and food the entire time we were there. It's probably from the condensation from the A/C that was dripping on us the whole time and literally causing the floor beneath us to mold. When we told the waitress about it, she said "yeah, that's an issue at this table". She never once asked us how the food was, even after taking away full plates of uneaten food and us telling her we didn't want a take out box. Even if we wanted to tell her, we only saw her once about 15 minutes after we got our food. This is seriously the worst experience I have ever had at any restaurant ever. We actually had to stop at Taco Bell on the way home just so we weren't hungry for the rest of the night.
Food was delicious and big portion. Service was polite and friendly. Would love to come back to try other dishes one day if we visit Hamburg again.
leads.ai_response_draft: The portions are pretty generous here. Hope you make it back to try the crayfish soup next time - Alt Helgoländer Fischerstube

leads.worst_review_text:
My husband and I went for dinner to celebrate our first anniversary. We thought it must be worth spending this kind of money.
Everything starting great even though prices are quite high. Dinner was ok however service could be better for the amount you are paying.
Once our main course was served our waitress completely disappeared and we had to get up to serve our self’s wine as we wanted wine with our main course and not later.
When we finished dinner we asked for the desserts and this is when for our surprise the answer was the kitchen is closed… really? You are paying over 100€ per person for a dinner and you just get the answer that the kitchen is closed and you can’t have dessert?  This is really not professional. Leaving your customers half way done with dinner. :(
If you don’t want to be disappointed with the service then don’t go to this restaurant.
Sorry.. I can’t recommend.

leads.address: 4151 Lake Shore Rd, Hamburg, NY 14075, USA

leads.worst_review_text:
I have no idea what other people are eating when they say "world class"... but that was NOT our experience.

Smoked Eel and scrambled egg was a novelty for a non-native and surprisingly,  very pleasant.  Everything we ate after that was a dissapointment.

Staff were pleasant, if somewhat erratic and MIA, which is hard to fathom as there are a LOT of staff on the floor.

My wife was really looking forward to a good Sole Meunière -  unfortunately, over cooked, (seemingly either shallow or possibly deep fried, but didnt taste like it was done in butter?) the flesh was dry and the whole fish was presented naked, on a bare plate with a jug of what looked and tasted like a mix of hot vegetable oil and (possibly?) butter that she was to "dress" it with... ? Not great value for money at €75.  (NB Had my wife insisted that I "not make a fuss" I would have sent both her's and mine  back)

The North Sea Turbot I had @€69.50 was equally dissapointing. Again it appeared to have been over cooked and possibly deep fried as it had a hard "shell" of flour or a batter of some sort all over it? The flesh inside was tasteless. The "mess" of overcooked vegetables created the final factor in the trifecta of dissapointment that was our €300+ last meal in the beautiful city of Hamburg.

We were really excited to finish off our visit to Hamburg on a high note but left without finishing either main dish or the bottle of wine.

We left quietly, very dissapointed and unsatisfied from what should have been, by all accounts, a sensational seafood dinner...

Who knows, maybe the main chef was off on a Monday Night and they let the apprentice cook our meals?

My recent visit to Boothaus Hafencity left much to be desired, primarily due to significant service issues that overshadowed an otherwise mediocre meal.

To start, I ordered a mocktail but was mistakenly served an alcoholic drink. While the waiter apologized when I pointed this out, and the drink was rectified, no compensation was initially offered. It wasn't until I specifically requested it when the bill arrived that any form of compensation was provided. We also noticed that our server gave a detailed "knife talk" to all other tables, explaining the different steak knives available. However, when our food was served, we were simply given a generic knife and it was just placed on the table, with no explanation whatsoever. Later, our side dishes were also brought out incorrectly, requiring another correction. Finally, when we were ready to pay, the same server spent a good ten minutes chatting with another table, completely ignoring us and another table that was also patiently waiting to settle their bill. These repeated errors in service and a clear lack of attention really detracted from the evening.

As for the food, it was just "alright." The steak was nothing special, and I've certainly had better elsewhere. The sides were also uninspiring and didn't elevate the meal in any way.

Overall, while the food was acceptable, the poor service was the main issue. The lack of proactive compensation for their mistakes, the unprofessional demeanor of our server, the noticeable disparity in service between our table and others, and the extended wait to pay were particularly frustrating. I wouldn't recommend based on this experience.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That's a lot of service mistakes in one night - the mocktail mix-up and missing knife talk especially shouldn't have happened. We're working on consistency training with the team.

- Bootshaus Grill & Bar - Hafencity

leads.business_name: Dental Day Clinic Dr. Eichenseer MVZ GmbH II

Dr. Manev and Frau Humi are great with emergencies - glad they could help you out when you needed it.

The clinic is modern and equipped with high-tech technology. I had some difficulties finding a really good dentist in germany, and now I’ve finally found one. Highly recommend!

leads.worst_review_text:
A very very terrible experience:
Never trust a good Google rating before booking appointment.
Website design is difficult to make appointment changes. Called to cancel on the day because was sick, counter agreed and I made new appointment.
But! Two weeks later, non stop chasing me payment of 75Euro cancellation fee and can’t waive. The counter assistant on phone already quit. But I need to pay for her mistake.
It’s super easy to pay this fee though: one click payment, unlike other processes.
This is close to a scam. The new counter person insist me to pay, doesn’t allow to talk with doctor says doctor is fully booked. And non payment goes to debt collector. She said there was terms and conditions but it was not visible and not informed at all. On the opposite the counter assistant didn’t disclose.
I will never book with dental21 again and need to report this incident to authority. Please be very careful.

leads.business_name: Zahnarzt München - Dental Carré | Zahnzentrum Lehel

leads.worst_review_text: The reception and staff is horrible. I have been waiting for the processing of my treatment by insurance for 2 months now but it seems they didn't even send it! I went for crowns and they hooked me on gum treatment (which is good, thanks!) but then forgot about my other treatments completely. I have been sending emails but reception never reposes. The dentist email is suddenly not working (not a valid email) and now I am stuck and don't know what to do as I signed the fees documents for the gum treatment but no one cares about my crowns! months and months of waiting and now I have to find another clinic!!! so bad so horrible!!! they even cancelled an appointment that I tried to make so I can speak to someone!!!! very unprofessional and awful. Additionally, there is specifically a reception employee who pretended she doesn't speak English and her treatment is horrible and racist.

Room is ok to the value we spent. But the amenities in the room is so small. Not even a glass for drinking water. Our shower door rubber was missing also creating a big whole and wet all the floor while showering. No fixing provide during our two nights stay.
Breakfast is ok
Staffs are nice though.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The missing shower door rubber should've been fixed right away - that's on us. Good to hear the staff treated you well though.

- H2 Hotel München Olympiapark

leads.worst_review_text:
I have been waiting 4 hours in the lobby to check in. I have been traveling already for 14 hours. I asked several times for an earlier check in I was told to either wait in the lobby for a chance that an earlier room could be booked. I was never offered an earlier check in they claim to offer for 12 and was told at the earliest a room would be available at 1pm or later. I am still waiting in the  lobby.

Update 2: heaven forbid after 14 hours of travel you want to nap. The service carts and doors slam continuously up and down the halls as the rooms are serviced. Super "relaxing"

Update: I made it in the hotel room after 4.5 hours. I was then required to pay the entirety of my bill at check in and was denied the ability to split the bill with my friend traveling with me. this hotels policies shit all over all our budgeting and planing and months of work. Icing on the cake The room had three selves and one suitcase stand to split between two people. Super"great" experience.

leads.worst_review_text: dont go there . very bad treatment. i went there because my teeth already 10 percent correct. they checked up and cleaned . after told me you go to another doctor. lot of needle put inside my teeth . they given dont any pescription medicine .  that time totally slept my mouth. after cleaning told me ok meet to another place doctor and by. after 5 6 hour my mouth swelled with pain and my teeth not properly closed with each other. some up and down after cutting and cleaning.  bad service

We slept in a sleeping pod; although cheap, we did not expect to be so tight: we were 16 people packed in a room usually hosting 4, with one (!) shared bathroom (1 sink, 1 shower). This has clearly negative impact on cleanliness and silence during the night.
The bathroom was often dirty, the shower worked but the showerhead support on the wall was broken.
A kitchen is available for use, however, it lacks essentials, and can become crowded (one space for the whole hostel).
Breakfast is good for the price, 7€ not included in the price. Wifi works ok.
A very annoying thing: there is no split garbage collection, just "uncategorized".
But, the most negative thing of all: we were given the access code to another girl's pod, in which she was, at that exact moment, resting. This is very concerning, both for personal safety, and for concerns for the personal belongings stored therein.
There is a 24h manned reception, which is very nice.
Besides the reception, a smokers room renders the surrounding air always smelly.
The location is pretty good: close proximity to grocery stores, U-Bahn and S-Bahn.

leads.business_name: MEININGER Hotel Berlin East Side Gallery
leads.worst_review_text:
The hotel is fairly priced, well located and has a kitchen where you can cook.
My stay was RUINED by the man that works at the bar in the evenings. Extremely rude, he shoved a sign at my face when I approached to buy a coffee (the sign said the bar was closed until 16:30 - I waited until it was 16:30 to actually go buy my drink) I understand people need breaks but that agressiveness ruined my stay. It sounds silly but going to get a coffee after the café opens to be greeted in such a manner, getting a sign thrown at me like I’m a nuasance…horrible experience. The woman in the mornings on the other hand…LOVELY. She always had a smile, asked what kind of milk I wanted…proper service.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The evening bar staff behavior you described isn't acceptable - that's not how we treat guests. The morning team clearly gets it right, and I'll make sure the evening shift does too.

- MEININGER Hotel Berlin East Side Gallery

leads.worst_review_text:
I stayed at St Christopher’s Inn Berlin Mitte and honestly it was just “okay” at best, with some very annoying issues that ruined the experience.

First of all, charging guests to store their bags is ridiculous. A SMALL bag costs 6 euros for 24 hours or 3 euros for just 3 hours. Who is keeping their bag for 24 hours? Most tourists need storage for maybe 4 to 6 hours. There are no flexible options, just overpay or suffer. It feels greedy and unfair, especially for a hostel.

The showers were another joke. Every time you shower, the drain is clogged and the water builds up around your feet. This is not a one time problem. It is clearly known and they never fix it. Standing in dirty water while showering is not exactly what anyone wants after a long day of sightseeing.

The toilets were also disappointing. They were not cleaned every day, which is unacceptable in a busy hostel with so many people sharing facilities.

Then there are the long term residents. Some very shady and dodgy people seem to live there permanently. They clearly do not shower, smell bad, and honestly look mentally disturbed. It made the place feel uncomfortable and unsafe at times. Not the vibe most travelers are looking for.

The only decent things about this hostel were the location and the breakfast. The location is great, and the breakfast is actually good for 6 euros if you buy it on the day of check in. Sadly, those two things are not enough to make up for everything else.

Overall, this place feels more like a budget shelter with extra fees than a traveler friendly hostel. I would not stay here again.

Our experience at this hotel was completely ruined by the behavior of the front desk staff. While sitting with my family enjoying dessert at the hotel’s coffee area, two of my teenage children politely went to the reception desk to ask where the restrooms were located.

Unfortunately, the receptionist responded in a rude, aggressive, and completely unprofessional manner. She raised her voice, spoke to them with disrespect, and used offensive and humiliating language. No guest—especially a child—should ever be treated this way under any circumstances.

This behavior shows a total lack of basic hospitality, courtesy, and training. A hotel that allows staff to scream at guests and treat families with such disrespect should seriously reconsider its customer service standards.

When my son came back from the restrooms, the same hotel receptionist came back, alongside her staff member, and began lecturing him on the rules of the hotel, raising their voice, and even saying outright they didn't belong in the hotel.

We expected a welcoming and family-friendly environment. Instead, we left feeling upset, disrespected, and deeply disappointed. The rest of the hotel staff was indeed helpful and nice, but the two at the reception completely ruined the experience. I would not recommend this hotel to families or anyone who expects basic politeness and professionalism.

leads.business_name: Hotel Berlin, Berlin, a member of Radisson Individuals

leads.worst_review_text:
Dont go there. Its located directly at a super noisy big street. No personal staff available at reception so no one is there for you when you face issues.

My room was noisy from the big street and even worse smelled like mold and cold smoke. For all inquiries you need to text with them on whatsapp or try to call.

The blankets are super light and not warm. It is november and they still have summer blankets on the bed!

If you have the chance dont book that accommodation, you will find mucj better value for money. It is one of my worst hotel experiences. After a room change same night was not possible i asked for a refund and cancellation of my booking. They denied and offered me a 15% discount only.

Hilton Berlin – A Deep Decline After Years of Loyalty

I have been a Hilton Honors member for almost 15 years, and a Diamond member for 8–9 of those years. Sadly, Hilton Berlin has gone from a great hotel to one of the worst-managed Hilton properties I’ve stayed in.

The spa has been out of order for years with no real progress. The executive lounge was moved into the middle of the lobby, completely losing the quiet, relaxing atmosphere it used to have. The lobby itself now feels uncomfortable, with sofas replaced by basic chairs.

Service has also dropped dramatically. Almost every time I arrive, there is only one person at reception, leading to long queues. Even at checkout at 10:00 a.m., I had to wait 15 minutes because only one staff member was working — unacceptable for a hotel of this level.

Breakfast is overcrowded with no available seating. And the suite I stayed in was shocking: bad smell, toilet not working properly, broken taps. It felt like a three-star hotel, not a Hilton.

I’ve stayed loyal to Hilton for many years, but Hilton Berlin has become so poorly managed that I’m seriously reconsidering that loyalty. The brand name no longer matches the quality. Very disappointing.
leads.ai_response_draft:
15 years of loyalty and we've let you down this badly - that's completely on us. The suite condition you described is unacceptable, and you're right about the reception staffing issues. Please contact me directly so we can fix this properly - [email protected]

- Hilton Berlin

leads.worst_review_text: What an excellent place! We’ve been to this place twice and will always return. They are quite popular so make a reservation instead of walking in. The food is great and the servings are hefty. The staff is friendly and attentive. We received free beers when we arrived. Highly recommend the schnitzel vom kalb (veal) and lachsforelle (if you feel like having fish instead). The potato salad that came with the meal is really excellent. But don’t forget to order dessert!
leads.ai_response_draft:
The veal schnitzel and that potato salad - good choices. Free beers are our way of saying welcome to Berlin.

- Schnitzelei Mitte

leads.address: Wiener Bundesstraße 22-24, 5300 Hallwang bei Salzburg, Austria

leads.worst_review_text: Die Apothekerin war ungeduldig und unhöflich und machte während der ganzen Zeit Grimassen, weil sie zwei Minuten warten musste, bis ich versuchte, meine Ärztin wegen eines Rezepts zu erreichen.
leads.ai_response_draft:
Das war unprofessionell von mir. Niemand sollte sich so behandelt fühlen, schon gar nicht wenn es um ein Rezept geht. Bitte kontaktieren Sie mich direkt - das muss ich richtigstellen.

- Apotheke am Schillerplatz

leads.worst_review_text: NIE WIEDER! Absolute Frechheit!! Wollte etwas für mein Kind kaufen und wurde so herablassend behandelt! Als Mutter mir sowas anzuhören wie: „Wenn das mein Kind wäre …“ usw. das geht überhaupt nicht! Die Höhe war ja das die Mitarbeiterin mir dann verweigert hat mir etwas zu verkaufen!!!??? Den 1 Stern haben die nichtmal verdient! Würde keinem empfehlen da jemals hin zu gehen.
leads.ai_response_draft:
Das war völlig falsch von uns. Keine Mutter sollte sich so behandelt fühlen und schon gar nicht mit einem Verkaufsstopp. Bitte ruf uns direkt an - das muss ich sofort klären.

- Neue Welt Apotheke

leads.business_name: ST. ISIDOR PHARMACY in Medical Center West
leads.worst_review_text: Unfortunately, they're often arrogant and incompetent. If you need something for a cough, they'll quickly list a few products without mentioning prices, etc. Even though there were no other customers in the store, they barely took their time. It's a shame.
leads.ai_response_draft: Maximilian, I'm genuinely sorry you felt rushed and that we didn't give you the thorough consultation you deserved - that's not the service we want to provide. We'll make sure our team takes proper time to discuss all options including prices, especially for something as important as finding the right cough remedy for your needs. Please give us another chance to show you the attentive care you should expect from your pharmacy - ST. ISIDOR PHARMACY in Medical Center West

leads.worst_review_text: To much cheese pizza covered in cheese
leads.ai_response_draft:
We went heavy on the cheese - that's on us. Come back and we'll make it how you like it.

- La Luna Essen

leads.worst_review_text: The “Manager” im not sure but she seems like she’s the boss. She talked to me in a very bad way! I couldn’t even respond well to her because I was surprised by the way she’s speaking to me!! I was happy at first that I find this nice cafe near my house but unfortunately I would never go again! Very bad experience, Not recommended.
leads.ai_response_draft: Hi Rasha, I'm truly sorry you experienced such disrespectful treatment from our manager - that's completely unacceptable and not how we want anyone to feel in our café. I'll be addressing this directly with our team to ensure this never happens again, and I'd welcome the chance to make things right if you're willing to give us another opportunity. - Banunino - Coffee & More

leads.worst_review_text:
The blonde, bespectacled clerk began removing chairs and desks two hours before the end of opening hours, intentionally making it impossible for customers to sit down and forcing them to sit in a small area.
They also made it look like the food was finished with no refrigerator lights. They were obviously trying to make themselves less work.

I don't know if people in Essen would accept this kind of store, but it was the worst Starbucks experience I've ever had.

We went on Saturday night and we queued twice for around 5-10’. Not too bad.

The best pizza was the champions 🍄‍🟫 one although a bit too much cheese.

The classic pizza was good but the sauce a bit too sweet for us.

The pepperoni square pizza was not fully cooked. The dough didn’t feel fully cooked. We should have returned it as we didn’t finish it/enjoy it.

We would have preferred if instead of a ricotta, there would have been a pizza with a blue cheese like Gorgonzola for example.

The staff was super kind and the atmosphere inside/outside is very friendly.

Prices aren’t too expensive and there’s the option of buying slices, which we loved.

Best part? How thin and crunchy the dough was.
leads.ai_response_draft:
Good feedback on the pepperoni square - that dough should've been fully cooked. We'll add gorgonzola to the rotation soon.

- Bleecker Street Pizza

leads.business_name: Nan Xiang Soup Dumplings - East Village
leads.worst_review_text: We went in the winter and the inside was pretty cold. We ordered the noodles and bean puff to come out first, then the kaofu and dumplings to come last. Instead everything just came as soon as it was made. But they forgot to send us our kaofu until we asked. Unfortunately the noodles were very salty. However the bean puffs were nice, flaky and warm. The dumplings were very okay, but the kaofu was served cold which took us by surprise. Wasn’t a fan.
leads.ai_response_draft:
The cold restaurant and cold kaofu - that's not right. We'll talk to the kitchen about the timing and get the heat sorted out.

- Nan Xiang Soup Dumplings - East Village

leads.worst_review_text:
My family physician recommended me distilled water with isopropanol to form a mixture of 70 vol% for disinfection of any wounds and spots. Now I use this successfully since several years and I have been happier with this recipe than with any other disinfecting agent. It is also widely used in healthcare.
Now the pharmacist refused to give me 500ml of isopropanol without proper reasoning and although it is freely available. I got informed pretty badly by this pharmacist and upon research, the information I got unfortunately turned out to be incorrect.
In the end I turned back to my trusted pharmacist and got the isopropanol. Just one day after that I got bitten by dozens of ticks upon a stay in the woods overnight. When I was at the hospital to get checked for lyme desease the physician told it was a very good decision to disinfect with 70 vol% isopropanol.
I am disappointed by the incompetence of this pharmacist and don't understand the intentions of misinformation.
leads.ai_response_draft: Hi MrSagnix, I'm genuinely sorry our pharmacist gave you incorrect information about isopropanol and refused your request without proper explanation - that's not the professional service you should expect from us. You clearly know what you're talking about with the 70% isopropanol mixture, and I'll make sure our team is better informed about these legitimate medical uses so this doesn't happen to other customers. I'm glad you found what you needed elsewhere and that it served you well for the tick bites - that sounds like quite an ordeal in the woods! - Paracelsus Apotheke Linz KG

leads.worst_review_text:
One should expect that at least in the pharmacy store you won’t get ripped off. Of course everyone should count his change but at least the employees should be honest.
(22,55 bill. 2x 20 Euro given. Only 15,45 as rest)
Very kind of Mr. Mag. Fischnaller.
leads.ai_response_draft:
That's completely unacceptable - we should have given you 17,45 back, not 15,45. Please come in so I can make this right and we can figure out what went wrong. 

- Columbus-Apotheke

leads.business_name: Apotheke Wegscheid - Mag. pharm. Romana Sternberger
leads.worst_review_text:
If you don't have a prescription, you can't expect any help here! ☠️
If you're having trouble breathing, you can get a herbal syrup (250 ml) here for €16.90!
Great advice! And you need a master's degree for something like that?
A liter of Jägermeister would have been cheaper and better!
It’s far from
leads.ai_response_draft:
Not sure what we got wrong but that's clearly on us. Reach out directly so we can figure out what happened.

- Emotion Apotheke

leads.worst_review_text:
The pharmacy is nicely decorated. A really lovely shop. But: I think the staff needs better training. I had recovered from erysipelas, finished the course of antibiotics, and my skin had a large area of ​​redness with small, red spots, some slightly brownish to red. So, post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation. And the staff told me there was nothing they could do for it?

So I showed the pharmacist the area.

I then went to another pharmacy and got an ointment there.
leads.ai_response_draft:
Gerald, I understand your frustration - you came to us with a clear skin concern after your recovery, and we should have been able to help you with post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation rather than leaving you to seek care elsewhere. We clearly missed an opportunity to provide the specialized dermatological guidance you needed, and I'll be addressing this with our team to ensure we're better equipped to handle these situations. Your experience shows us exactly where we need to improve our consultation services.

- Zeppelin-Apotheke

leads.worst_review_text: Since I had a very strange encounter for the umpteenth time today, I'm going to give it a negative review. After years of tolerance, despite the fact that I've always received very unfriendly service and am also very picky about my prescriptions. It's almost bordering on harassment, in my personal experience. In most other pharmacies, everything runs smoothly with private doctor's prescriptions, but here they really harp on every detail. As a patient, you don't take most medications voluntarily, so you'd expect the customer service in a pharmacy to take this fact into account. There's no need for excessive bureaucracy to fray your nerves. I won't be shopping here again, despite the central location.
leads.ai_response_draft: G deli, I'm genuinely sorry you felt harassed and faced unfriendly service repeatedly - that's absolutely not how anyone should be treated when picking up medications. You're right that dealing with prescriptions is stressful enough without adding bureaucratic frustration, and I clearly need to address how we handle private prescriptions and train my staff on showing more understanding to patients. I hope you find a pharmacy that treats you with the respect and care you deserve. - Centralapotheke Mag Jörg Müller KG

leads.worst_review_text: Extremely rude personnel! I went to make a PCR test which I booked online and they were extremely rude. One of them even throw my ecard like it was some piece of .... and she was extremely disgusted. I'm really shocked by this behaviour and I really cannot understand it. Just terrible. I will never go there again.
Very rude and irresponsible staff. I will never go there.

Unfriendly staff! No help with important questions. They are prejudiced against people with serious illnesses and treat them condescendingly. I don't think that's okay, hence the 4-star deduction. They should work without prejudice and treat every customer equally!

leads.business_name: Donau Apotheke Linz – Apotheke Mag. pharm. Susanne Schirmer KG
leads.worst_review_text:
A very condescending, know-it-all, and disrespectful tone.

I hope the employees there are treated the same way. I'll remember that nice lady; perhaps I'll come into contact with her in my work sometime—I would be very happy if I did!
leads.ai_response_draft:
That's completely unacceptable behavior from our staff. No one should be spoken to that way when they're trying to get help. Please call us directly so I can address this properly.

- Donau Apotheke Linz – Apotheke Mag. pharm. Susanne Schirmer KG

leads.worst_review_text:
The boss is truly incompetent... He doesn't even know what "Descale" means. He argues with everyone... I'm not letting him serve me anymore.

I don't need that...

Schlechteste Apotheke, die ich in letzter Zeit erlebt habe! Kundenfreundlichkeit: 0. War dort, um ein  Medikament abzuholen, die Dame raunzte mich an, sie müsse es bestellen. Auf die Nachfrage, wie lange es denn dauern würde, meinte sie,  morgen hätte ich es. Schlussendlich musste ich über 1 Woche (!) warten und mehrmals anrufen! Des Weiteren hat ein großer Hund, der jeden der reinkommt anbellt, absolut nichts in einer Apotheke verloren!
leads.ai_response_draft:
Das mit dem Hund und der Wartezeit war inakzeptabel - über eine Woche ist viel zu lang. Rufen Sie uns direkt an, damit wir das richtig regeln können.

- Prinz Eugen Apotheke

leads.worst_review_text: Hello dear pharmacy team, I can give vent to my disappointment here. When I tried to fill a prescription at your pharmacy, the system gave me an error message. They then prohibited me from dispensing my medication because the prescription was allegedly forged. I got a bit louder and also pissed off because that's just not acceptable. The cashier there said in all seriousness, "Go back to your country" (I'm a pure German, more German is impossible, even in terms of appearance) and that the care is definitely better there. When I said what she thought I was from, she avoided the situation and disappeared into the back room. Then her "colleague" from the other cash register came over, and I asked very nicely if I could speak to my supervisor because this was unacceptable. I was told with a grin, and I quote, "She's standing in front of you" (very respectful), and a complaint wouldn't achieve anything, since she was there and hadn't heard anything like that. Very disappointed with Austria, actually a beautiful country, but people like that ruin everything for tourists...
leads.ai_response_draft: Kevin, I'm deeply sorry about the racist comment you experienced from our staff member - that behavior is completely unacceptable and has no place in our pharmacy or anywhere else. We take immediate action in situations like this, and I want to speak with you directly to address what happened and ensure this never occurs again. Please call us so we can resolve this properly and restore your confidence in our service. - Linden-Apotheke Mag.pharm. Gerstmayr KG

leads.worst_review_text: Be aware: In general employees are nice and helpful, only one employee tries to talk customers into homeopathics, which I see very critical considering the effectiveness is very questionable. If customers specifically ask for it - fine, but for regular customers - please stop.
leads.ai_response_draft: Sabine, I completely understand your concern about being pushed toward homeopathic options when you're looking for conventional treatments. You're absolutely right that our role is to provide what you need, not to promote products with questionable effectiveness unless specifically requested. I'll address this with our team to ensure we focus on evidence-based recommendations that match what our customers are actually seeking - TIME - City Apotheke Linz Hauptbahnhof

leads.business_name: Apotheke Bulgariplatz, Mag. pharm. Dr. Martin Hinterleitner KG
Guardian Angel Pharmacy Mag. Jörg Mayrhofer KG
leads.worst_review_text:
This is by far the worst pharmacy I've ever seen in my life.

At the emergency pharmacy, they treat you like an idiot and ask if you're serious that you absolutely need a bandage after work.

I've never encountered anything as appalling as this pharmacy.

I will avoid this pharmacy forever!!!!!!😠😠😠😠🤮🤮🤮🤮🤮🤮🤮
leads.ai_response_draft:
That's completely unacceptable - no one should be questioned about needing a bandage. We clearly failed you and I'm sorry for that treatment.

- Guardian Angel Pharmacy Mag. Jörg Mayrhofer KG

leads.worst_review_text:
Habe kein Mittel für Sodbrennen gefunden war sehr überrascht
Nur 1 Feld war leer gekauft.....sonst geile idee

Das mit dem Sodbrennen-Mittel tut mir leid - sowas sollte eigentlich immer da sein. Die leeren Fächer checken wir jetzt öfter.
